story:
RædLeaf Foundation for Poetry & Allied Arts was established in 2012. It conceptualized the RL POETRY AWARDS to promote discerning new voices in poetry.

Apart from a handful of government and state- funded awards based on political and personal nominations, India does not have a platform where poets who are 18 and above can participate without a reading fee.


AWARDS/FELICITATION

The RL POETRY AWARD 2013 was open to Indian poets living anywhere in the world. For the first time, it attracted over 700 submissions.

The 2013 awardees were Rohan Chhetri and Sohini Basak in the General Poetry section and Geetanjali and Chasrishma R in the Haiku section. We also awarded the remaining eight shortlisted poets in the General Poetry Section and three shortlisted poets in the Haiku Section.

We were honoured to celebrate renowned poet Jayanta Mahapatra’s contribution to world poetry  with a Lifetime Achievement Award. 

The 2013 Award/Felicitation ceremony took place at The Fern, Manasarovar, Hyderabad in association with Ministry of Tourism and Culture, Andhra Pradesh.

The 2013 Award/Felicitation ceremony took place at The Fern, Manasarovar, Hyderabad in association with Ministry of Tourism and Culture, Andhra Pradesh.

2013 Expenses:

General Poetry-

Rohan Chhetri: $320

Sohini Basak: $160

8 shortlisted poets: $10 each

Haiku

Geethanjali Rajan: $80

Charsishma R: $80

Ramesh Anand: $50 (commendable prize initiated by Poet Sandip Chauhan, in memory of her father)

2nd&3rd shortlisted poets: $10 each

In 2013, we had 3+2 readers to winnow the longlist and 4+1 jury members. A total amount of $600 was paid as honorarium.

In addition to this, the event launch worked out to $2400, including the venue and $1600 was spent on delegates, including airfares and accommodation.


The RL POETRY AWARD 2014 was open to both Indian poets and poets of other nationalities. The award attracted over 960 submissions.

The 2014 awardees were Tushar Jain from India in the national category and Lauren Camp from Mexico in the international category. We hadeight shortlisted poets in each category. In the Haiku section, the awardees were Carl Seguiban, Tracy Davidson and Andre Cecon. The haiku section hadsevenshortlisted poets.

2014 Expenses:

General Poetry-

Tushar Jain: $250

Sohini Basak: $250

Haiku-

Carl Seguiban: $100

Tracy Davidson: $75

Andre Cecon: $25

Other fees include dollar conversion rates.

In 2014, we had 2+1 jury members where a total amount of $320 was offered as an honorarium.


OTHER ACTIVITIES

OTHER ACTIVITIES

Events:

·  Poetry Peacemeal, bridging borders between Tibet and China, Readings by Wang Ping, Tenzin Tsundue and Linda Ashok at IIC Annex, New Delhi

·  Reading by Wang Ping, Chinese American Poet and Medha Patkar, River Activist at India International Centre, New Delhi, 2014

·  Reading by Tenzin Tsundue, Tibetan Activist and Poet at Our Sacred Space, Telangana, 2014

·  Reading by Mani Rao, Jennifer Robertson, Christopher Staudinger, Oliver St. John and Wang Ping at ITC Kakatiya- a Chain of Luxury Hotels, Telangana, 2014

Major Publishing Projects:

Poetry in India actually happens in its twenty-nine official languages. While RædLeaf Foundation for Poetry & Allied Arts has been primarily publishing works in English, it realized the need for presenting the works of poets who, for linguistic concerns, do not get the due appreciation for their contribution to Indian literature.

To start with, we are featuring the works of the Malayalam Poetry Diaspora; 60 poets, 2 poems each over 120 days! This will run parallel with a short introductory to the works of  11 Poets of African Diaspora followed by The Telugu Poetry Series and The Bangla Poetry Series in early 2016.

YOUR GENEROUS DONATION WILL HELP US COVER THE FOLLOWING:

1)  The registration of the RædLeaf Foundation for Poetry & Allied Arts.

(Advocate fees and seed capital to sustain Trust’s activities)

2) The creation of a dynamic website with a dedicated server to keep up with the speed and space for new content and ease of navigation.

3) The commission of five language translations to five regional poets.

(Fund to commission works to Translators)

4)  The printing of a critical anthology of poetry of major world diasporas.

(Fund to Research and delegate editorial tasks)

5) Funding future awards and felicitations.

The ‘we’ you’ve been listening to, is me! I have exhausted my seven years’ savings on poetry in setting up RædLeaf Foundation for Poetry & Allied Arts and its activities. To be honest, I am not completely sure how the Trust’s activities will shape up from this year on.  If you value this independent initiative,  kindly consider claiming some of the awesome perks I have mentioned! The moment you care, great things will start to happen for the Foundation and for poetry. Please donate and help us keep poetry alive and well. Thank you!

                                                                             ~o~

Linda Ashok graduated with a major in English and minor in Philosophy from Rabindra Bharati University, West Bengal. Details of her publications and features on her can be found here.In 2014, Linda was one of the 25 guest poets invited from India and abroad by Prakriti Foundation for the annual Poetry with Prakriti Festival. She was the guest speaker at KaviSangamam Poetry Festival, 2013 and the Guest of Honour at SNMV College for Women, Abids, Telengana where she read her paper on Indian poet, Sarojini Naidu. To read more about the work of the Foundation and to be amazed at some wonderful poetry, please go to www. rlpoetry.org.

story:
Let's do this a second time! 

Due to overwhelming demand and those that were not able to contribute at the time, I am creating a second campaign to allow additional people to contribute to get Led Zeppelin Gear printed. Here is the original story.

Hello, there.I am Jeff Strawman, webmaster and editor of Achilles Last Stand, a Led Zeppelin fansite (http://www.led-zeppelin.org). Since launching the website in 1996, I have reached Led Zeppelin fans in 214 countries, and made many, many friends along the way.

My top goal with Achilles Last Stand is to create the best Led Zeppelin-related website online. I have spent many hours to make it what it is today. One of the sections in the website details what gear the members of Led Zeppelin have used throughout their careers. Led Zeppelin Gear is the next step.

I want to take Led Zeppelin Gear to print!

Although Led Zeppelin Gear was started as an online resource, and I will continue to update the website, I have always dreamt of making a physical book. And now I am doing it! Led Zeppelin Gear will be a beautiful way to preserve some of the content I have featured online and allow it to be enjoyed virtually anywhere.

The book will be a gorgeous piece around 600 pages. It will feature noteworthy information on a lot the instrumentation, amplification, effects and accessories that were used, as described in interview by Jimmy Page, John Paul Jones, John Bonham and Robert Plant, as well as some of the people that were there, such as Roger Mayer, Andy Johns, Bruce Becvar, Jeff Ocheltree and Andy Manson.

Why this book?

There are many Led Zeppelin-related books currently available. Some feature biographies on the band members, some feature the live experience, and are a catch-all, encyclopedia-style, however there is not a book available about the gear that Led Zeppelin used.

There are gear books available for other bands, such as The Rolling Stones, Greatful Dead and The Beatles, however there is not a book available about the gear that Led Zeppelin used.

Who am I to write it?

Who am I am why should you consider funding and/or reading this book? I am not a former member of Led Zeppelin’s road crew, I wasn’t there while Led Zeppelin was an active band. I don’t work for Gibson or Fender or Marshall. In short, I am not an expert. I am just a thirty-something guy with a deep interest in Led Zeppelin and a penchant for perfection. I started researching for this book sixteen years ago.

In addition to being a Led Zeppelin fan, I am also a musician. I grew up in a musical house. All of my immediate family are musically inclined. After starting with piano as a young child and playing the baritone and tuba, beginning in elementary, I began playing the bass guitar in the summer after senior year of high school. I’ve played in bands for the last twenty-one years and have really made it a point to pay attention to the detail of gear that the various bandmates have used.

Obviously, with being in bands, I am a great lover of music. Although I listen to most genres of music, classic rock of the 1960s and 1970s is my favorite. Led Zeppelin was introduced to me by high school friend, who spun his mom’s Zeppelin vinyl after school.

I grew up in the generation with a computer in every classroom and have been involved with technology my entire adult life. I remember in 1994, while in college, I remember learning about this relatively new thing called HyperText Markup Language that interpret text and images on to the World Wide Web. I recall a handful of Led Zeppelin websites that popped up of the next few years and they often presented different information on the same topics. I figured that I needed to create a website about Led Zeppelin.

I found a web hosting company that offered unlimited space and bandwidth and after a few years of presenting my Led Zeppelin website as a sub-domain on my personal website (www.fancyketchupguy.com–now defunct –don’t ask!), I purchased www.led-zeppelin.org and presented my website there. My website had A LOT of information, as I scoured the internet for every bit and piece of related content. In addition, I’ve picked the brains of a lot of people, including members of the Led Zeppelin, CEOs from gear manufacturers and people who are just plain intelligent. With a fine-tooth comb. I’ve spent countless hours at many libraries searching through books, magazines and newspapers. I want to have the best Led Zeppelin-related website online.

What to expect of Led Zeppelin Gear?

Led Zeppelin Gear consists of seven chapters that gives a whole look into a lot of information. The book is written chronologically, beginning with the first time each piece of gear was used for each member.

Chapter One, Jimmy Page: The Grand Sorcerer, which comes from a description from Keith Relf, prior to performing Shapes Of Things at the Anderson Theatre, in New York City, New York, on March 30, 1968. From playing Baby, Let’s Play House on a found Spanish guitar to the Martin D-28 Marquis acoustic guitar that was used by Page on his last live performance, on November 5, 2011, the reader will learn about Page use of selected pieces of signature gear to create the sound he wanted.

Chapter Two, John Paul Jones: The Groove, lets the reader learn that Jones is much, much more than just a bass guitarist. He is a multi-instrumentalist that is not afraid to pick up any instrument or have any instrumented crafted to get the music out of his head and projected out through his fingers. Jones had never stopped evolving and transforming sound and was never stuck or felt comfortable in just one genre.

Chapter Three, John Bonham: The Thunder, chronicles a kid from the Black Country that went from pub bands to a stadium band in his eighteen-year professional musical career. The world will never see another drummer with Bonham’s hard-hitting, technical expertise, being able to stay slightly behind the beat, showmanship and good looks.

Chapter Four, Robert Plant: The Lion, addresses that skinny, blond, head-strong Adonis who wanted to make it on his terms. He hasn’t been linked to only just one genre of music, while still appearing current.

Chapter Five,Three Hours of Lunacy, discusses the PA (public address) systems that were used at live Led Zeppelin concerts, from the earliest days up to their last performance in 2007.

Chapter Six,Magic Studio Days, is a song-by-song analysis of the gear that was used in the studio, both by the members of Led Zeppelin, as well by the engineers. Also included is a study of the tracks in each song, as well as some history on the songs.

What is so special about this book?

1.First of all – me. Nineteen years of research by a 30-something Led Zeppelin fanatic has resulted in a very thorough written experience.

2.Led Zeppelin Gear is a jam-packed book. All 600+ pages (~120,000 words) are full of well-known and some not-so-well-known information.

3.The approach. I am not here for a quick buck. This is my honest and truthful tribute to Led Zeppelin. I have gone to great lengths to make this book as grand as it could be.

Your support means the world to me.

I am thrilled about the prospect of seeing Led Zeppelin Gear in print, and I hope you are, too. There are a variety of costs associated with a project of this size, and you support will allow me to:

·Set aside time to focus on finishing writing the book

·Copy editing content

·Secure print rights for photographs

·Secure ISBNs (International Standard Book Numbers) for printed and electronic versions

·Pay for the printing costs up front

Keep in mind that all pledges are subject to Indegogo and/or PayPal fees which amount to about 10-12% of the total funds.

The Perks

Led Zeppelin Gear is being released in two different offerings: the eBook and the hard cover book.

The eBook will be in your choice of format (EPUB, MOBI, AZW3, PDF, etc.) for compatibility on your eReader.

The hard cover book will be printed on 60 lb 420PPI (pages per inch) 94 opacity paper with a high-gloss cover, created by designer Gerson Vecchi. The book is in a US trade 6x9 inch size.

And, just because, there will be an 11x17 inch, full gloss commemorative promotional poster available.

So, what?  Now, what?

Well, this is the moment when I turn the mic to you... As you will see in the perks, the contributions that I am shooting for are pre-sales, rather than charitable donations (although I am not in the position to turn those down either!).

If you cannot contribute, I would be very grateful if you could share this campaign. Please join the Facebook page or follow Led Zeppelin Gear on Twitter. By doing this, I can keep you in the loop about this book, and my next project (yes, something is cooking already!).

THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT AND CONSIDERATION!

story:
Hi. I'm Deborah Teramis Christian (I go by Teramis). I'm a science fiction and fantasy novelist published by Tor Books, a professional role-playing game designer with roots in the old-school D&D era, and founder of the World Building Academy. 

I'm crowdfunding a collection of my short stories in this book called Journeys. The funding will go to cover editing, artwork, ebook design and print-on-demand book formatting.

Here's why I'm excited about this project, and hope you will be too.

Why Short Stories, and Why Now?

Because of a very serious health crisis, I nearly died last year. I spent the next six months in hospitals and rehab facilities, and when I finally returned home, I realized that I wanted to bring several creative projects to completion. (Put this under the header of, “Important Things to Do Before I Croak.” Which now I don't expect will happen for decades to come, but that was one serious wake-up call about getting on with my creative work!)

I'm a novelist and don't often write short stories – but the ones I have done are pretty cool. So, now: I want to gather all my short stories together under one umbrella and let them have a life of their own as a publication.

That brings me to this book, Journeys. I call it that because it offers you several journeys not only into my imagination, but into many Great Escapes of your own.

Journeys contains 10 tales. It is a sampler of stories from my fantasy world, from my science fiction setting, and a couple of oddments not easily categorized but intriguing nonetheless. (Scroll down to see story details under the "What Are the Stories?" header below.)

The World Building Connection

Because I am passionate about world building, I must note that my fiction works are almost all set in role-playing game settings. Or put another way, my game worlds have spawned stories.

You wouldn't know this to read the tales – after all, a good story is exactly that, and stands on its own – but if you, like me, are both a writer and rpg designer, I have some insights into this process that might be helpful to you.

For this reason, I'll be sharing a series of video tips during this campaign about how I created some of the stories in this collection: what their relationship is to game worlds, and how you too can tell excellent stories with that kind of genesis. Even if you don't care about writing such things yourself, these videos will give you insights into my process that went into the stories in this collection. The first video in this series will be posted online on or shortly after Sunday, September 20th. (If you're a campaign supporter, you'll get an update announcement, or you can sign up to my projects list and get video updates as well: http://bit.ly/dtcprojects.)

Artwork

I love illustrated stories. Don't you? And who says illustrated stories are not for adults? (I still swoon over Howard Pyle's artwork in his King Arthur and Robin Hood novels.) And so I have resolved to have each and very story in this collection illustrated. That is part of what the funding goal will cover: appropriate compensation for the artists whose work will help illuminate these intriguing stories.

You can read more about the artists and the stories below.

For now let me just leave you with this thought: if you want to journey into the land of Imagination and have a little Great Escape, this book is a great way to do it. Q&A

Why IndieGoGo? Why Not Kickstarter?

Every time I mentioned that I'm crowdfunding, without exception everyone assumed I was doing a Kickstarter project. Obviously I am not, and that is for one simple reason: IndieGoGo permits flexible funding. That means that even if I do not meet my full funding goal, I will still receive whatever money is pledged.

Essentially, this means that even if project funding falls short, I will still have something to invest in making this book a reality. In exchange for that, I promise to produce an ebook version of Journeys for supporters at the $10 level and higher as the minimum guaranteed deliverable. The amount of artwork and print options will be limited (if not fully funded) as discussed under “Risks” below.

The Trade Paperback Perk

Related to the above, please do not think of this perk as an automatic “pre-order” system for a paperback copy of Journeys. It is not.

Rather, consider this a commitment to help fund Journeys towards the goal of becoming a paper book as well as an ebook. The following conditions and rewards apply:

  • IF funding falls short, your perk will be a discount coupon that will allow you to purchase the paper version at cost when it becomes available. Sadly, I cannot guarantee when this will be if we do not make our funding goal, because then I will have to dig into my own shallow pockets to make this come to pass. However, it is my intention to accomplish this within a month or two after release of the ebook format.

  • IF the funding goal is met, your perk will be a copy of the trade paperback version of Journeys (in addition to the ebook format, which you will receive automatically). We will all be happy and have a big party and wear goofy hats. There will be cake.

  • If we do not make the funding goal, you will need to cover shipping yourself. If we DO make the funding goal, I will cover shipping within the United States. If you live elsewhere, you will need to pay for shipping and I will let you know how much that will be when we're at that point in time.


Funding Priorities

Question: Why do you not guarantee delivery of a paper book if I have paid for that perk?

Answer: These funds must go to different aspects of this project in descending order of priority. First priorities are editing; artwork; ebook formatting. Then comes print-on-demand formatting costs, then a varying scale of costs to set up with a PoD printer. (The variation depends on final book length, print options, and whether or not this project will be accepted by my ideal PoD printer, Booklocker, which is notoriously picky about the projects they will accept. If we can't go with them, setup costs will be considerably higher elsewhere.)

So it boils down to a question of how much funding we achieve. If the pool is large enough, it will cover everything up to and including PoD costs, and make it possible to simply send you a book, if you've bought the Trade Paperback perk.

If the money pool is not that large, then your contribution has at least helped us get closer to a complete project, and I will strive to find a way to give you some tangible value in exchange for your investment. That applies even if I cannot afford to offer the book completely free and clear as it would be in a fully-funded situation.

Risks

The story collection itself: This book is 80% complete as of this writing. I'll be writing the final stories over the next two months after the campaign closes. After that, I am an experienced editor and have seen seven ebooks through to publication. I foresee no difficulties in creating the baseline minimum deliverable here of an ebook version for supporters.

Artwork:  If the funding falls short, I may not be able to have all the stories in the book illustrated as planned. See priorities discussion in “Trade Paperback Perk | Answer” above. The artists themselves are professionals and accustomed to meeting deadlines for publication. 

Deliverables and caveats:  An ebook version is the minimum deliverable you can expect if you are a basic level supporter. If we are short on funding, I would have to use my own personal resources to achieve goals like having artwork done, or getting this book to the print-on-demand stage of production. I cannot guarantee if or when these higher levels of product polish will happen if Journeys is not fully funded by the end of the campaign. I may not be able to overcome the gap between my desire for a certain caliber of product and my means to achieve that goal. That's rather the whole point of crowdfunding, after all.

So if you, too, want to see an illustrated book in a dead tree version, please support and share this project with your social network, and help Journeys reach or exceed its funding goal!


Why Bother to Read My Work?

I know there's a lot of stuff out there to choose from, and you probably aren't familiar with my writing. So what's special about my work?

  • My breakout novel Mainline (science fiction) was only the third book ever purchased from the slush pile at Tor; it made the Locus Top Ten List of Best First Novels in the year it was published.

  • Kar Kalim (which I think of as my “sleeping with the enemy” novel) was so disturbingly memorable that the endorsing quote from Piers Anthony was edited to leave out the “disturbing” part, because they thought that would hinder book sales. Also, this book grew out of a need to explain an anomaly in my rpg world that stemmed from poor design decisions, so it has some insights to offer for game designers as well (I'll get into that in one of my videos in this rpg/fiction series elsewhere on this page.)

  • The Truthsayer's Apprentice was praised not only by Lloyd Alexander (author of the classic The Black Cauldron) but also by a real-world runemaster who had helped consecrate Iceland's parliament building when its foundations were laid. He told me in private correspondence that he thought I had an exceptional grasp of the esoterica of rune magic. A high compliment, indeed.

That gives a quick sample of some things that are unique about my writing. The titles mentioned here are out of print right now (although you can find used copies online). I am working to get the rights back so I can self-publish these books. In the meanwhile, I am refocusing on some novel projects, and of course, on this collection of short stories.

What are the Stories?

Without giving spoilers, here's a little about the tales that will appear in Journeys:

1 “Small Benefits”

I am very fond of “gotcha” tales – short things with a twist and an unexpected ending. This is the first I ever wrote, when I was 19. It features a hapless mage and an inscrutable gnome in a not-so-generic magic shop in the city of Nimm-on-Witholl. This has stood up well to the test of time; I wouldn't change a word of it if I wrote it today. It also introduces a story element that has resurfaced in my works across the years, and features now in Queen Victoria's Transmogrifier, one of my novel-length works-in-progress. “Small Benefits” foreshadows my later rpg fantasy world development, and sets the stage for a milieu that I am still writing adventures for. This is the first time this story appears in print.

2 “The Transformation of Gerick Bare-skin”

Set in the hinterland of the Duchy of Nimm on the world of Àstareth—the same land where “Small Benefits” takes place—this is a coming-of-age tale of a youth from a clan of were-bears. Only problem is, he can't make the change happen—and then his home is threatened with war.

Reviewer Andrew Knighton said of this book, “[I]t let me relax for half an hour, feel things I wanted to feel, enjoy a brief moment of transformation and adventure, and emerge rejuvenated. Stories can and should surprise us. But they should comfort and relax us too, give us the full range of human experience. And The Transformation of Gerick Bare-Skin definitely has a place in that range.”

3 “The Duke of Nimm” (in progress)

Duke Arn of Nimm is called the Mad Duke for a reason: this man is off his rocker. Today we would call it schizophrenia, but in his time and place, it is suspicion and distrust (read paranoia), unreasonable moods, a lot of acting out, and the power and chutzpah to ensure he is left to do as he pleases. So when he orders an all-out defense of the capital of Nimm, while the only known threat remains distant on the borders, his paranoid whim once again sets city forces into action. But this time, perhaps, he has gone a measure too far, and sown the seeds of his own destruction.

The Duchy of Nimm is the homeland of the antagonists featured in The Truthsayer's Apprentice. When you read this, you might start to get the impression that Nimm is full of bad guys....and that might not be far from the truth.

4 “Li Wan's Revenge”

Halfway across the globe from Nimm is the Asian-inspired island nation of Qua-lun. In this land with a samurai ethic, there are also deep superstitions and tales about ghosts and the supernatural. The tale of Li Wan is a cautionary one about the hazards presented by uneasy ghosts. The story is beautifully illustrated by artist Emily Vitori (http://www.syreenestudios.com/).

This is a setting I was creating just before I hooked up with TSR to do development in their Oriental Adventures property, so my creative interests certainly aligned with that rpg work. To read more about the connection between OA and my own writing, check out this website, where you can also pick up a free novel of mine called Dragonsword (the first half of an unfinished duology).

5 “Ridgerunner”

The culture of Qua-lun eventually becomes dominant on its homeworld, and milennia later gives rise to the star-faring Sa'adani Empire. But you don't need to know that to appreciate what happens in Ridgerunner. This story focuses on an up-close, alien-eye-view of an encounter with human xenologists from the Empire. This is a chilling “gotcha” tale, written originally as a dramatic monologue, and still lends itself to reading out loud. (Like that concept? Check out the Audiobook perk in the sidebar.)

6 “Live Fire”

Fast-forward to another place in the Empire: a lonely demilitarized zone on the farthest reaches of the Sa'adani border. Here, imperial ships keep vigilant patrol against incursions from an age-old enemy. They test new weapons, and new ships, and an aspiring young weapons officer thrills to her assignment and the opportunity to make a name for herself.

Until things go wrong, and she learns that not all mortal dangers lie outside the ship.

This story and the anthology it first appeared in (No Man's Land) were considered for the Tiptree Award in 2011.

7 “Med Call, or How Zendo Worked the System” (in progress)

My novel Mainline is set in the Sa'adani Empire on the planet Lyndir. A minor character is mentioned in passing: Zendo, a net runner who has mysteriously vanished, thus opening the way for other, more important characters to engage with the protagonist.

This story is about what happened to Zendo to cause him to drop out of sight so suddenly, and remain silent at least for the length of events covered in Mainline. He was, shall we say, a little preoccupied, and getting to know Lyndir in a way his native-born self had never intended, and never plans to repeat.

8 Elise's Gift

My WIP Queen Victoria's Transmogrifier features Julia, headmistress of an esoteric secret order who saves QV from an assassination attempt. But a decade before the events in that novel, she was merely a senior member of her order, tasked with instructing the aspiring not-so-talented ladies who hoped to join her sisterhood. It was business as usual until she met Elise: an exceptional woman and exceptional talent whose gifts, however, remained concealed until necessity and a succubus encounter drew them out.

This story first appeared in Demon Lovers: Succubi (2012), and is a prequel to QVT.

9 “Creative Visualization”

A woman in prison can't get over the strange habits of her Native American cell-mate, and she tells you all about it—including the unbelievable event that convinces her there might be something to this “creative visualization” notion after all.

Perhaps this is fantasy. Perhaps it is magical realism. It is certainly a variation from what I usually write, but in any case, it is a Great Escape, however you frame it. This story is also written as a monologue, and lends itself to reading out loud.  This will be its first appearance in print. 

10 “Bread”

This one's a real departure from my norm, but it's a story I have to share.

I once gave a neighbor a loaf of homemade Christmas bread when I was living in Berlin in my early 20s, and that opened the door to her sharing a life experience from World War II that was much more than I bargained for. This partially fictionalized memoir uses narrative to recount events in the 1940s as she related them to me, but aside from that artistic license, this encounter, and all the rest of the tale, are completely true.  If you are touched by poignant stories, keep your hanky handy for this one.  It's a real journey to another time and place, on many levels.


Who Are the Artists?

I am working with some talented women artists who, along with myself, will be illustrating the stories in this book. They are:

Gennifer Bone. http://onwingsofink.blogspot.com/

Sarah Richardson. http://www.scorcha.net/

Emily Vitori. http://www.syreenestudios.com/

Soon I'll be adding graphics to the gallery so you can see some of their work on this page and not have to go link-surfing for it.


Videos

Check out the video gallery for vids about Journeys and my rpg/world building connection with these stories. 


Now, what are you waiting for? Go snag a perk or two that you like, and then share this page with a friend! :D

Hi. I'm Deborah Teramis Christian (I go
by Teramis). I'm a science fiction and fantasy novelist published by
Tor Books, a professional role-playing game designer with roots in
the old-school D&D era, and founder of the World Building Academy. I'm crowdfunding a collection of my
short stories in this book called Journeys. The funding will
go to cover editing, artwork, ebook design and print-on-demand book
formatting.Here's why I'm excited about this
project, and hope you will be too.

Why Short Stories, and Why Now?

Because of a very serious health
crisis, I nearly died last year. I spent the next six months in
hospitals and rehab facilities, and when I finally returned home, I
realized that I wanted to bring several creative projects to
completion. (Put this under the header of, “Important Things to Do
Before I Croak.” Which now I don't expect will happen for decades
to come, but that was one serious wake-up call about getting on with
my creative work!)

I'm a novelist and don't often write
short stories – but the ones I have done are pretty cool. So, now:
I want to gather all my short stories together under one umbrella and
let them have a life of their own as a publication. 


That brings me to this book, Journeys.
I call it that because it offers you several journeys not only into
my imagination, but into many Great Escapes of your own. 


Journeys contains 10 tales. It
is a sampler of stories from my fantasy world, from my science
fiction setting, and a couple of oddments not easily categorized but
intriguing nonetheless. (Scroll down to see story details under the "What Are the Stories?" header below.)

The World Building Connection

Because
I am passionate about world building, I must note that my fiction
works are almost all set in role-playing game settings. Or put
another way, my game worlds have spawned stories. 


You wouldn't know this to read the
tales – after all, a good story is exactly that, and stands on its
own – but if you, like me, are both a writer and rpg designer, I
have some insights into this process that might be helpful to you. 


For this reason, I'll be sharing a
series of video tips during this campaign about how I created some of the stories in
this collection: what their relationship is to game worlds, and how
you too can tell excellent stories with that kind of genesis. Even if
you don't care about writing such things yourself, these videos will
give you insights into my process that went into the stories in this
collection.  The first video in this series will be posted online on
or shortly after Sunday, September 20th. (If you're a
campaign supporter, you'll get an update announcement, or you can
sign up to my projects list and get video updates as well:
http://bit.ly/dtcprojects.)

Artwork

I love illustrated stories. Don't you?
And who says illustrated stories are not for adults? (I still swoon
over Howard Pyle's artwork in his King Arthur and Robin Hood novels.)
 And so I have resolved to have each and very story in this
collection illustrated. That is part of what the funding goal will
cover: appropriate compensation for the artists whose work will help
illuminate these intriguing stories. 


You can read more about the artists and
the stories below.

thought:  if you want to journey into the land of Imagination and

challenging to our perceptions and paradigms, and will give you some
interesting food for thought to engage with. 


I hope you'll engage with it.

This one's a real departure from my norm, but it's a
story I have to share. 

I once gave a neighbor a loaf of
homemade Christmas bread when I was living in Berlin in my early 20s,
and that opened the door to her sharing a life experience from World
War II that was much more than I bargained for. This partially
fictionalized memoir uses narrative to recount events in the 1940s as she related them to me, but aside from that artistic license, this encounter, and all the rest of the tale, are completely true.  If you are touched by poignant stories, keep your hanky handy for this one.  It's a real journey to another time and place, on many levels.
Who Are the Artists?I am working with some talented women
artists who, along with myself, will be illustrating the stories in
this book. They are:

Gennifer Bone. http://onwingsofink.blogspot.com/


Sarah Richardson. http://www.scorcha.net/


Emily Vitori. http://www.syreenestudios.com/


Soon I'll be adding graphics to the gallery so you can see some of their work on this page and not have to go link-surfing for it.VideosCheck out the video gallery for vids about Journeys and my rpg/world building connection with these stories. Now, what are you waiting for? Go snag a perk or two that you like, and then share this page with a friend! :D

story:
We are so nearly there!!!

Update
We have been raising money through Indiegogo, but also through direct contributions to the accounts of the Transnational Institute and the Campaign for Nuclear Disarmament and Peace in India. We have raised $7500 so far....but still have a little way to go to meet our target.
Meanwhile, Praful's The Phoenix Moment has been published and launched across India, and work has begun on a booklet of his collected works. Translations of The Phoenix Moment are due to start in late January.

Summary

As friends of Praful Bidwai and out of commitment to the causes you shared passionately with him, we hope you will join this crowdfunding effort to honour his legacy.

Praful Bidwai died tragically in Amsterdam on 23 June 2015. He is regarded by many of us as one of the best investigative journalists South Asia has produced, and a true internationalist public intellectual. Praful was passionately concerned about many issues, including the threats of nuclear weapons, climate change, environmental  destruction, religious communalism, social and political egalitarianism.

We want to ensure Praful is not forgotten, that his work is popularised and made accessible to ordinary South Asians, and that the scholar-journalist tradition he was so famous for inspires a new generation of writers.

What We Need & What You Get
We want to raise $10,000 as initial capital to support a Praful Bidwai Memorial Fund which would immediately:
  •  publish a collection of his writings on nuclear disarmament and the pitfalls of nuclear energy (estim. $1000)
  • actively promote his last book, 'The Phoenix Moment: Challenges Confronting the Indian Left', which is to be published by Harper Collins India in November 2015 (estim. $500)
  • translate key works into vernacular Indian languages - Hindi, Bengali, Malayalam, Marathi and Urdu (estim. $7000)
  • provide an annual prize to promising young investigative journalists in South Asia (estim. $1500)

The managing committee of this Fund would comprise close friends of Praful and also some members of TNI. TNI will inform you as soon as this has been formally established, and will keep you informed of  progress of the initial projects outlined above.

The Impact

 We want to ensure that Praful's legacy is well remembered, that his writings on key issues of common concern are made available in collected form and accessible to South Asians in the vernacular, and that a new generation of writers are inspired to follow in Praful's footsteps.

The Praful Bidwai Memorial Fund is currently being formed and this initial capital will enable it to immediately start work on the projects outlined above.

Risks & Challenges

We may not meet the target we have set here, but whatever we do raise will go to the Fund and will enable them to achieve least some of the plans outlined above. We would then prioritise the translations and the prize for young investigative journalists. Only around 10% will be kept by Indiegogo, Paypal etc for providing this platform and processing contributions/currency conversions.

The Fund may take a little time to get set up, but work will begin within 30 days of the launch of this crowdfunding campaign on a collection of Praful's writings on nuclear disarmament/energy and in promoting his posthumously published book, The Phoenix Moment.

Other Ways You Can Help

Next to donating some money there are other ways to contribute to this campaign
  • Encourage friends to contribute, send an e-mail or post it on facebook or tweet about it.
  • Help promote The Phoenix Moment when it is published by getting your library to order it, buying a copy yourself, encouraging appropriate people in your network to publish reviews of the book or publish one yourself, set up a reading group, or anything else you can think of
  • If you have other ideas of how you might contribute or for what the Praful Bidwai Memorial Fund should do, please let praful.memorial [at] tni.org know.

And that's all there is to it.

story:
POETRY TO CELEBRATE LIFE, FRIENDSHIP AND LOVE / POESÍA PARA CELEBRAR LA VIDA, LA AMISTAD Y EL AMOR

(You can read this project in English or Spanish)


If you have ever had a tireless, fun, and unconditional friend that is full of dreams, then you will understand this project better.

However, I had better tell you the story first:

I met Nancy García at La Habana many years ago when we were teenagers studying at the same school. Distance separated us went she moved to live in Mexico, but years later we found each other once again in the United States.

Nancy never grew tired of reading, writing, or studying. She was a creative and curious person with an insatiable desire for knowledge. Everything interested her: from literature and art to politics, finance and astrology! Her friends adored her because she was very sweet, but also very sincere.

Lately, she was teaching computer classes to elders at a community educational center. At the same time, she was taking a Master’s Degree in Hispanic Literature at Florida International University in Miami.

Nevertheless, Nancy grew gravely ill and died in 2014, after a brave battle for her life. While organizing her papers, we found a collection of poems titled El instante que nos une, or “The Instant that Unites Us”, which she had written and never published due to modesty. They are beautiful verses, filled with sincerity and emotion, written in Spanish. It’s a book that’s very hers, very Nancy.

My project consists of publishing this book and organizing an event to present it to the reader’s community of Miami. To achieve this I count with the support of various collaborators.

Nancy helped many people during her life. For us, her friends, it would be a great joy to publish this book so her poems can be read and shared. In this project, we have counted with the valuable support of Zaida del Río, a painter of international prestige, who has created the drawings that will be used to illustrate the book and to create a promotional poster. We propose to have this ready by October.

Help us make this dream come true. Join us in this celebration of life, friendship, and love. 


POESÍA PARA CELEBRAR LA VIDA, LA AMISTAD Y EL AMOR

Si alguna vez has tenido una amiga incondicional, incansable, divertida y llena de sueños, entonces entenderás mejor este proyecto.

Pero mejor te hago el cuento:

Conocí a Nancy García en La Habana, hace muchos años, cuando éramos adolescentes y estudiábamos en la misma escuela. La distancia nos separó cuando ella se fue a vivir a México; pero años después nos reencontramos en Estados Unidos.

Nancy nunca se cansaba de leer, de escribir y de estudiar, era una persona creativa, curiosa y con un insaciable deseo de conocimientos. ¡Todo le interesaba: desde la literatura y el arte hasta la política, las finanzas y la astrología! Sus amigos la adorábamos porque era muy cariñosa, pero también muy sincera.

En los últimos tiempos ella impartía clases de computación para adultos de la tercera edad en un centro educacional comunitario. Al mismo tiempo, cursaba una maestría en Literatura Hispana en la Florida International University, en Miami.

Pero Nancy enfermó gravemente y murió en 2014, después de una valiente batalla por la vida. Ordenando sus papeles, apareció una colección de poemas titulada El instante que nos une, que ella había escrito y que, por modestia, nunca intentó publicar. Son versos hermosos, llenos de sinceridad y emoción, escritos en español. Hablan de la vida, del amor, de la amistad. Es un libro muy suyo, muy Nancy.

Mi proyecto consiste en publicar ese libro y organizar un evento para presentarlo a la comunidad de lectores de Miami. Para poder realizarlo cuento con el apoyo de varios colaboradores.

Nancy ayudó a mucha gente a lo largo de su vida. Para nosotros, sus amigos, será una gran alegría que este libro se publique y que sus poemas sean leídos y compartidos.

En este proyecto he tenido el valioso apoyo de Zaida del Río, pintora de prestigio internacional, quien hizo los dibujos que se usarán para ilustrar el libro y para hacer un poster promocional. Nos proponemos tener listo el libro para octubre.

Ayúdanos a realizar este sueño. Súmate a esta celebración de la vida, la amistad y el amor.

story:
My name is Daniel Garth and I'm a Mississippi native, a U.S Navy Veteran, and a graduate of Full Sail University. My goal is to raise $10,000.00 to go towards the cost of an illustrator, editor, a first run of printing, marketing, and a book tour for promotion of my new book.  The Problem With Friends is a book/journal that I feel will be helpful to many people in their life and it is a priority of mine to bring this book to the public. This book focuses on the types of friends that exists, specifically on the types that will make it harder for you to have the life that you've always dreamed of. It is broken into chapters that deal with friend "types" and end with journal entries for reflection and action planning.  I want to reach, and hopefully surpass, this goal that I have set. You can help me accomplish this goal by selecting a perk which best suits you. Any awareness that you could raise by passing this indiegogo campaign on to someone who might be interested would also be a tremendous help. Let's make this happen. 
-Daniel Garth-

story:
‘Yes Africa Can’ is a book written to primarily embolden young Africans to rise to proactive servant leadership and social entrepreneurship as a tool for a sustainable African future. This book challenges the readers to go beyond the threshold of being onlookers, to implementing African interventions.

The author, Timi Olagunju, felt that there has been too many books that have addressed leadership from the ‘traditional' and theoretical perspective of a woman or a man leading others. So in this book, he took a slight detour. He neither delved into leadership theories nor its models. The book shifts the focus from the positional acknowledgement of the leader to drawing lessons from personal examples of young people (with little or no title or position) who have taken up the odds to distinguish themselves as leaders in their respective fields and communities, and have been so acknowledged as leaders, thereby qualifying them as participants of the Mandela Washington Fellowship. 

This book propels the reader to look further inwards. It also addressed some cardinal issues involving the Mandela Washington Fellowship application, the YALI Regional Program, and interview process.

The book touches on seven stages as regards the Mandela Washington Fellowship.

These are as follows:

1. THE APPLICATION,

2. THE INTERVIEW,

3. THE PRE-DEPARTURE ORIENTATION,

4. THE RESIDENCY PROGRAM,

5. THE WASHINGTON SUMMIT,

6. THE INTERNSHIP (PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT EXPERIENCE),

AND

7. THE RETURN HOME.

The complete book, ‘Yes Africa Can’ is available for eReaders on their computer and phone via Amazon (www.amazon.com/dp/B015VRRIEW) and Okada Books (http://okadabooks.com), with the search name, 'Yes, Africa Can'.

story:
Our Project

Three’s a Charm Fund-a-Book is a writing project involving three generations of word crafters! We are Ivory, Trish, and Raven respectively grand-mum, mum, and daughter. Each of us has unique stories to tell between real-life and fiction. We want to spend the summer writing together gathering family stories, fictional adventures, and discovered poetry.

                                                           Meet Ivory!


Ivory is a mother of seven once-rambunctious and now-grown children. She has collected many adventures and poetic images to share. At this time, she is fighting (and winning) her battle with cancer. Nothing is slowing her down, clamming her up, or getting in her way to leave an amazing legacy of courage, spunk, and humor.

                                                       Meet Trish!


Trish is a mother of two super creative teenagers and three awesome deaf Dalmatians as well as a wife to a bigger-than-life artist. She teaches creative writing, literature, and academic writing at three colleges. Her academic adventures include an MFA in creative writing and a PhD in adult education. The biggest dream she has now is having time to write with two of her best friends, Ivory and Raven.

                                                      Meet Raven!


Raven is an adorkable teenager who loves to write, sing, draw, design, and dream. She loves to write original fiction and fan fiction. She is always looking for a story in every situation and adventure that comes her way. Family is very important to her, which is why having an entire summer to write with her grand-mum and mum means the world to her.


       

We hope to raise enough money to afford us the time to spend inspiring one another, writing our stories, and publishing them to the people who matter (that’s you)! By funding this book-writing project, you are helping make all three of our dreams come true (that’s many years of dreaming with all of us combined). By the end of the summer, we will have two short story collections and two fictional books ready to publish on Amazon.

                                       What We Need & What You Get

While we set our goal at $500, we could use $5000 really to make this project shine. The funds will go toward keeping up our house, pantry supplies, and for writing tools. Taking time off to write is a costly endeavor. However, your generous donation will add to the treasure chest that will fund this dream.

In exchange for your generous donation, you will get some exciting gifts to connect you with our writing project. In essence, you are joining our crew.

                Check out the story previews here at www.trishhopkins.com to get an idea of what exciting adventures await you!

Tier 1:

For a $1 donation, you get a Twitter, Facebook, and website shout out, a cool digital scrapbook page, and our gratitude.

For a $5 donation, you get a digital scrapbook kit, a Twitter, Facebook, and website shout out, and our gratitude.

For a $10 donation, you get a choice of one of two children’s ebooks (By the Sea, Brunswick, Maine or Emma’s Treasure Book), a Twitter, Facebook, and website shout out, and our gratitude.

For a $20 donation, you get two children’s ebooks (By the Sea, Brunswick, Maine and Emma’s Treasure Book), a digital scrapbook kit, a Twitter, Facebook, and website shout out, and our gratitude.

For a $40 donation, you get the novel Lit Mag ebook, a choice of one of two children’s ebooks (By the Sea, Brunswick, Maine or Emma’s Treasure Book), a personalized digital scrapbook kit, a Twitter, Facebook, and website shout out, and our gratitude.

For a $60 donation, you get a requested blog post, the novel Lit Mag ebook, two children’s ebooks (By the Sea, Brunswick, Maine and Emma’s Treasure Book), a personalized digital scrapbook kit, a Twitter, Facebook, and website shout out, and our gratitude.

For a $80 donation, you get the choice of one of two writing courses (Fiction or Children’s Book taught by Trish), the novel Lit Mag ebook, two children’s ebooks (By the Sea, Brunswick, Maine and Emma’s Treasure Book), a requested blog post, a personalized digital scrapbook kit, a Twitter, Facebook, and website shout out, and our gratitude.

For a $100 donation, you get both writing courses (Fiction and Children’s Book taught by Trish), the novel Lit Mag first ed. print and ebook, both children’s ebooks (By the Sea, Brunswick, Maine and Emma’s Treasure Book), a requested blog post, a personalized digital scrapbook kit, a Twitter, Facebook, and website shout out, and our deep gratitude.

For a $150 donation, you get both writing courses, Three’s a Charm canvas tote bag, Lit Mag first ed. print and ebook, two children’s ebooks, a requested blog post, a personalized scrapbook kit, a Twitter, Facebook, and website shout out, and our deepest gratitude.

If we hit $5000, everyone who donates at $20 and higher level will be guaranteed the fruits of our summer writing project, which includes two short story collection ebooks and two fictional ebooks. When you donate at any level, you will receive the gifts for that tier. So spread the word because the more people on board, the more you will receive for your own donation!

The Impact

Your generous donations are having a profound impact on this family of writers. Ivory will have a concrete way to share her storytelling legacy with the world; Trish will realize the dream of a summer writing with two of her best friends and finishing threads of fantastic stories; Raven will start her budding career of being a young, imaginative author with a magical future. This writing project is a beacon of hope, faith, and charity to eclipse the burdens of chemo treatments and household bills for one crazy and magical summer. Every single donation will make a huge difference in our lives!


Risks & Challenges

There is no risk with any of the tiers above, as we can make good on those gifts. However, we might struggle to complete the summer writing project including two short story collection ebooks and two fictional books if we do not hit the $5,000 mark. Whatever amount we raise, we will still attempt to meet this ultimate goal. Either way, you are still getting some fun gifts per the tier you donate at. Remember, the more people you get to fund this project, the more likely we will hit the ultimate goal; so tell everyone you know!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot spare a $1, you can still make a big difference by sharing this project with everyone you know. Make some noise; give a shout out; help make dreams come true. You can use the Indiegogo share tools to toot our horn for the world to hear!

story:
A 80 pages of black and white book filled with humour and tongue in cheek illustrations that show a journey of me overcoming nasopharyngeal cancer. The fund raised will help me to start upanti-cancer health supplement store and website

ABOUT THIS PROJECT

Tongue in cheek, humorous and philosophical, Monk Key is a candid look into the life of a young adult battling cancer, but with a strong Buddhist influence. It’s more like an adult children's book. It’s emotional, educational, heartfelt, and totally original.

Born in the year of the Monkey and with a strong Buddhism background and Key connotes with the initial of my name Kyle and to unlock the mystery of life. Monk Key is conceived after a year I’ve completed my cancer treatment. After the death of my father and recently, a friend of mine, Uncle Chan whom have the same cancer as me, discovered that the tumor has spread to the liver, that inspires me further to write this book . 

This book talks a lot about the mental states I’ve gone through cancer. By using humour and creative visualization (guided imagery) as a way to allows reader to comprehend Cancer is no different from other kind of mental anguishes we suffered universally. Hopefully this book will brings you laughter and others might find it inspiring.

My goal is to publish this book and give it away to others who are suffering from cancer or family and friends affected by cancer, and you can help to make it happen!

FOR EVERY BOOK (HARD COPY) SOLD, I'LL GIVE ONE TO A CANCER PATIENT*.

P/S:  *If you have cancer or friends who have cancer and would like to get on our list to receive the free book, please email me at kyle@flickdesign.net

WHERE DOES YOUR MONEY GO?

After Indiegogo take their 4-9% off the fund, nearly 2/3 of the remaining expenses will be used for publishing, shipping, production of the book and merchandise cost (“Rewards”). The other 1/3 will barely help to fund and maintain the anti-cancer website, Healtitude (Healthy attitude) which encourages cancer patients & consumers to take preventative measures and make informed health decision on cancer. In addition, the remaining will used as a start-up fund for my anti-cancer supplement online store which advocates the consumption of anti-cancer natural food, turmeric with black pepper.

www.healtitude.com  & www.healtitude.com/store (Domain purchased but website is still under construction)

                       

EVEN THOUGH THE TARGET IS $8,000 BUT THE MORE WE CAN RAISE THE BETTER THIS WILL BE.

All the fund that were raised doesn’t include all the writings, illustrations and designs I’ve done for this book. If I've raised more than 15K, I would like to take 20% of the fund to pay for the work I've done that includes all the writing, designing, illustrations and all the hours I've spent in the logistic of administrating, purchasing & handling the  "reward" (merchandise).

Our estimated printing cost is based on publishing 1000 copies of an 74 page, black and white book, and perfect binding A5 size book. If we can raise more than our goal, we'd like to consider using higher quality and thicker paper to print on, and have matt lamination spot UV effect on the cover.

REWARDS


                

Reward: Note Book

                     

                                                                 Reward: Tote Bag

                     

Reward: A4 Size Poster from the illustration of Monk Key  

                     

                           Reward: A4 Size Poster from the illustration of Monk Key  

                   

                           Reward: A4 Size Poster from the illustration of Monk Key  

                     

Reward: A4 Size Poster from the illustration of Monk Key  

                   

I’m always looking for partnerships and collaborator;

For hospital, cafes, temples, bookstores whom are able to help and spread the word out for Monk Key.

For cancer related charities regardless it’s sharing or fund raising events which I can help to raise awareness or fund.

For sponsors whom like to donate on the printing of this book for free distribution.

Please contact me at Kyle@flickdesign.net

Read more of my story from www.thedayifoundcancer.blogspot.com

Thank you for your time and consideration! Help us spread the word!

Thanks to everyone that pledged or spread the word and helped us to make this happen!!

story: Positivity in Pain is a project that is rooted in humble beginnings. It began as a small idea, a blog, where others living with chronic pain could come and swap stories, share coping methods, talk about their daily lives. Then, it grew to something so much bigger than any of us. We have a community filled with love, hope and inspiration. It is something so special. Our book is now available on Amazon Kindle, but so many people want something real, something that they can hold in their hands. And, in the world of chronic pain, we deserve that. We need something that we can hold steadfast to in the midst of the never-ending siege of pain that we feel on a daily basis. Please help us bring this book into the world, be a part of something incredible!

story:
Short Summary

My name is Rebecca and I have always been a writer. From a young age I started writing poems and within journals, diaries always handy. I wrote for school and church papers, and participated in writing role playing games to stretch both my skill and my imagination. I have previously written several novels, although this is the first worth mentioning.

This campaign is to help raise funds to publish my novel, "Life's Defeat". It is the first a series, outlining the trials of a young woman as she is tested both mentally and physically in a world that she never knew existed. I have included a synopsis below.

Publishing this novel will be quite the dream fulfilled, hopefully the first of many. The second book in the series is already written as well, and the third is around half done. I would love to be able to see all of them published by the end of 2016. 

It had already made a huge impact in my family's life. My daughter (age 6) now attends my monthly writing meetings with me, eager to write herself. My husband looks at me with a new found awe that some may argue is hard to achieve after being married for nine years. My son, well, he is only 15 months old so I am just cool in his eyes regardless. 


Transparency is key

I have asked for $2500 which is broken down accordingly:

- $700 for editing through T.Morgan Editing
- $150 for Cover Design
- $600 for the printing and shipping of 100 softcover books
- $450 for producing and shipping rewards for sponsors
- $350 for website creation, promotions, etc
- $250 for indiegogo and paypal fees

These amounts are approximate, as the amount needed for editing may change slightly as I am doing one last edit before sending the manuscript to my editor and based on how much gets added/cut will affect the book printing costs.

If I exceed my goal the excess money will be going towards editing and publishing the next book in the series which is already written and awaiting me to edit it. 

If my goal is not reached I will focus on getting the novel ready step by step, editing first, then cover design, then printing last (as the printing is the last step in the process the physical books will rely on making the full funding goal).

My perks for my sponsors are things my own street team has suggested: physical books, bookmarks, tshirts, etc. All will be sent out once the novel has been edited and published - my goal is for the end of October; however, I hope to have it out sooner.

Short Synopsis of Life's Defeat

A young girl is brought to a boarding school after tragedy strikes and her parents are killed. To the majority of the students ignorance, the school is run by a vigilante soldier, a genetically altered man who keeps a close eye on the girl, always watching. Years later she is given a choice to become one of the soldiers and seeing no better choice, agrees.

Time passes and the girl, now a young woman, fights with a tenacity rarely seen but she is changed, tired of the bloodshed and heartbreak of sending young people to their graves too soon. She leaves for a time but is destined to return.

But as she rejoins the school, the only home she has ever known, she is captured by a malicious criminal who intends to take over the nation. The young woman is put through trials to test her physical limits in a seemingly endless cycle testing her sanity. Through murder, accidents and suicide she survives, gaining scars that will never heal. As time passes her fears grow; there is no escape, not even death.

At one of her lowest points she is rescued by those soldiers with whom she used to serve. Broken, beaten, mentally unstable and severely injured she finds herself without purpose as those around her try to fit her into life without the vigilantes at the school. A romance begins, and in him she finds a piece of home she had long forgotten.

Unable to bear a life without purpose any longer, the woman steals away to remedy her physical condition under the watchful eye of a new ally. When she returns she successfully proves both her strength and emotional state are intact. She yearns to reap vengeance on the man who imprisoned her, but is she prepared to make the ultimate sacrifice to defeat him?

(NOTE: This novel is not intended for children due to the violence of the fighting and graphic scenes. It is a little bit mystery, science fiction, fantasy and game of thrones-esque...)

NaNoWriMo

As I explained in my video, this novel was all due to encouragement by a good friend to join (you know who you are you desert rat) and participation in NaNoWriMo in November 2014.

NaNoWriMo is the National November Writing Month, where participants are encouraged to write a 50,000 word novel in one month, November 1-30. It is very very difficult, but obviously not impossible. It is also more popular than you would think, with over 57,000 people worldwide participating in Camp NaNoWriMo in 2014.

NaNoWriMo is an excellent organization, encouraging creative writing of all sorts in children and adults, providing web casts, articles, and events for all age groups. For more information or to pledge an amount or purchase some of their merchandice, go to http://nanowrimo.org/


Risks & Challenges

The most obvious challenge will be raising all of the funds I need to carry out my publishing on my time schedule. I have made the goal to have the book to me, in print, the week of my birthday in October. Obviously if I can get it done sooner I will however. 

To achieve this goal I will be advertising through facebook, twitter, my website (once up and running) and taking advantage of the many many people I know who have been interested in this project from day one and have offered their help. I am confident I will be able to reach enough funds to make this dream a reality. 


Other Ways You Can Help

I know sometimes making a monetary contribution just isn't possible. That's ok. If you are not able to, please share this campaign by facebook, twitter, any social media. Email your friends and family and please contact me directly if you have any questions. 

I appreciate every single dollar, whether someone contributes $1 or $100 and please know that every dollar WILL go to good use in this endeavour. 

Thank you so much!

story:
Team Olympus

Team Olympus is a ragtag bunch of misfits who happen to be pretty amazing poets. We were the top five poets in Orlando's S.A.F.E.! Words! Poetry! Grand! Slam! (yes, those exclamation points are actually part of the title). We think Orlando is to spoken word what Austin is to indie music festivals. 

We want to represent our city on a national stage, but we'll need some help. 

What We Need & What You Get

Needs:

  • Airfare for 5 to California
  • 5 days of accommodations
  • Heaps of merchandise for our #TeamOlympus2015 supporters.

Our perks are about as personal as they come without sending one of us to your front door with chocolates and a poem. But, to be honest, if it helps us meet our goal, we've got a guy for that.

You might wonder what would happen if we don't reach our goal. The answer is that we are a band of poets, and we'd probably hop cargo trains. We'll manufacture the perks first, then put the profit toward our NPS 2015 journey. None of us want to sleep in a dumpster behind a Starbucks, but if it happens, we'll write a poem about it.  

The Impact

Orlando, Florida is much more than a tourist trap. We're the #1 city in United States for foodies on a budget. Orlando is home to the second biggest University in the nation and to a growing community of entrepreneurs, artists & innovators. Team Olympus wants bring a little of our Orlando magic to Oakland. 

The five titans on Team Olympus look to represent our state and to grow as writers and performers. At Nat's we'll share the stage with our idols, network with professional poets, and get our art out to new audiences.  

Risks & Challenges

Our team is trying to spend the better part of a week about as far away from Florida as we can get and still be in the continental United States. 

We're trying to do this by selling merch and winning slams. 

We aren't certain how we're going to pull it off, but we have confidence that we'll figure it out. If we were the type to let fear of failure dictate our pursuits, we wouldn't have become performance poets in the first place. #teamolympus2015

Follow the Journey 

Team Olympus Facebook
Team Olympus Twitter
Team Olympus Instagram

story:
Short Summary

Theodore J. "Ted" Otteson was a husband, father, son, brother, uncle, grandfather, great-grandfather.  He was a teacher, mentor, friend, counselor, seeker of wisdom, adventure and connection with others on this path called life.  Ted spent many years helping others turn their own lives into stories.  

Now it is our turn to help him fulfill a dream and ambition to write a book.  We can think of no better way to do that than to continue what he's been teaching all these years.  Turning life into stories...his life, our lives, connected, collected, assembled into a book...his legacy.

What We Need & What You Get

  • We are seeking funds for costs associated with compiling, writing and publishing this book.
  • As well as financial contributions, we invite you to submit written contributions to be considered for publication. Send your life stories to paula.marie@earthlink.net. 
  • Anyone who contributes at least $100 will receive a copy of this book once it is published.
  • If we exceed our goal, this book will be donated to individuals, universities and local libraries.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you aren't able to financially contribute, there are other ways you can help:

  • Ted certainly turned his life into a story and helped many others do the same, we would love your story to add to his book.
  • Share this page on your social media.
story_txt:
Short Summary Theodore J. "Ted" Otteson was a husband, father, son, brother, uncle, grandfather, great-grandfather.  He was a teacher, mentor, friend, counselor, seeker of wisdom, adventure and connection with others on this path called life.  Ted spent many years helping others turn their own lives into stories.  
Now it is our turn to help him fulfill a dream and ambition to write a book.  We can think of no better way to do that than to continue what he's been teaching all these years.  Turning life into stories...his life, our lives, connected, collected, assembled into a book...his legacy.   What We Need & What You Get  We are seeking funds for costs associated with compiling, writing and publishing this book.  As well as financial contributions, we invite you to submit written contributions to be considered for publication. Send your life stories to paula.marie@earthlink.net. 
Anyone who contributes at least $100 will receive a copy of this book once it is published. If we exceed our goal, this book will be donated to individuals, universities and local libraries.


    Other Ways You Can Help Even if you aren't able to financially contribute, there are other ways you can help:  Ted certainly turned his life into a story and helped many others do the same, we would love your story to add to his book.
Share this page on your social media.

story:
Short Summary

Mark Jackson played in the NFL as a receiver for nine years.  He was selected by the Denver Broncos in the 1986 NFL Draft as a wide receiver from Purdue University.  He played in Super Bowls XXI, XXII, and XXIV with the Broncos.  It was Jackson who caught the touchdown pass from John Elway that sent the game into overtime on “The Drive” in the Broncos’ January 11, 1987 AFC Championship Game victory over the Cleveland Browns.

David Medansky is a world class authority on the game of craps and trusted published author.  His books include: Wholly Craps, Craps: A Winning Strategy, Craps:  Playing for the Money and Walk Away Craps.  Medansky’s first novel, Flamingo’s Baby,is an adventure thriller set in 1968 about Valentina Benjamin, age 21, a spunky, quick witted pragmatist turned protagonist, and employee at MGM Studioswhose bloodline may also be her death sentence as she races to solve the mystery of her birth, adoption, and inheritance. 

Greatest Craps Guru- A Novel.  Read what happens when a retired NFL player has a chance encounter with one of the world’s greatest craps guru. It is a lively fiction thriller that could pass for non-fiction; a how-to book and engaging story about making money in an unconventional way - at the craps table. 130 page (6 x 9) soft cover novel.

A portion of the proceeds from the sale of this book will be donated to My Fig 8 Foundation to support inner-city at risk kids.


What We Need & What You Get

 

What the money will be used for:

  • Website Design

  • Professional Editing

  • Professional Book Cover Design

  • Printing books

  • Legal expenses for Trademark and forming business entity

 

The Impact

 

We are appealing to you to help us get published.  It is with your support and contributions that we will reach our goal.  Please grab one of our fantastic rewards as our way of saying thanks for your contribution.  In addition, a portion of the proceeds from the sale of each book will be donated to My Fig 8 Foundation to support inner city at risk kids.

 

Risks & Challenges

 

Indiegogo is important because we really want to make this book without the help of a publisher. We found printers that can get everything made but printers are not cost effective unless we can order in bulk. The Numbers have been crunched and we’ve set a $5,000 goal that makes everything achievable.This project is in its final stages.  All the printing details have been worked through, including the first draft.  An editor and graphic designer for our book cover design have been hired - all play their part to bring you an excellent high-quality product.  The rewards are in place and we are ready to do whatever it takes to share our book with everyone!

What could go wrong? Oh, plenty of things.  We could have a printing glitch, items could get lost in the mail...but we are up for whatever challenges arise and we have surrounded ourselves with a cavalry of skilled people who believe in this project as much as we do.  We will be able to work through anything that comes our way.  Everything always comes together in the end.

This project is ready to come to you, but only if you lend your support!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand some folks just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help us:

  • You can ask your friends, colleagues, and relatives to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Rememebr to use the Indiegogo share tools!
