story:
NipPop: Parole e Forme da Tokyo a Bologna è un progetto avviato nel 2011 in collaborazione con la Scuola di Lingue e Letterature, Traduzione e Interpretazione dell’Università di Bologna. L’iniziativa, cresciuta anno dopo anno e avvicinatasi a un pubblico sempre più eterogeneo, si concentra in particolare sul Giappone contemporaneo e sui diversi tipi di tendenze e prodotti culturali che dai confini nipponici si diffondono a livello internazionale, raggiungendo una molteplicità di paesi che comprende anche l’Italia.

Letteratura, arte, manga, musica, cinema sono solo alcune delle componenti che caratterizzano NipPop che, nell’arco delle varie giornate, prevede solitamente un primo momento di riflessione critica, nel quale si alternano gli interventi su diverse tematiche di studiosi e accademici provenienti da importanti centri di ricerca internazionali e di artisti ospiti; un secondo momento, poi, è dedicato agli appuntamenti che incentivano uno scambio con il pubblico, come laboratori e incontri con gli autori, ma anche attività ludiche come concerti, performances, proiezioni, cosplay e molto altro.  Nel novembre 2013 da quest’esperienza si è costituita a Bologna l’Associazione Culturale NipPop, per la promozione delle culture del Giappone contemporaneo.

Per la sua quinta edizione, NipPop segue il filo rosso della metamorfosi che si è affermata come linea guida dell’arte contemporanea e della cultura “Asian power” del nuovo millennio che guarda a est. Nello specifico, saranno presi in esame artisti nella cui ispirazione il tema della metamorfosi si dispiega sullo sfondo discorsivo delle nipposuggestioni: personalità creative profondamente ricettive che dal Giappone si sono spostate – e tuttora vivono – in Europa, nei cui lavori prepotente è la contaminazione.

Tanti gli ospiti e gli appuntamenti di questa  edizione: dal Giappone l'autrice di Lady Oscar Riyoko Ikeda e lo scrittore, regista e cantante Jinsei Hitonari Tsuji,  protagonisti della sezione Incontri; le artiste Yumi Karasumaru e Tomoko Nagao, per la sezione NipPop Art; NipPop Music con  l'incredibile sound che mescola tradizione e pop di Keisho Ohno, con i SAGA e le BABYMETAL, con Eriko’s K-ble Jungle.  E poi ancora i workshop con Keiko Ichiguchi e Watanabe Yoshiko, Ivo De Palma, e tanti altri appuntamenti (anche in base al vostro supporto!).

Per il programma completo visitate il nostro sito http://www.nippop.it/5-6-7-giugno/


NipPop: Words and Forms from Tokyo to Bologna is an annual project, started in 2011 in collaboration with the School of Foreign Languages and Literatures, Interpreting and Translation – Alma Mater Studiorum University of Bologna. The event, developed throughout the years towards a broader audience, focuses on contemporary Japan and particularly on phenomena – such as literature, cinema, manga, and animation – playing a decisive role in spreading the Japanese culture in Italy, and worldwide as well, now and during the last decades.

Every year, NipPop hosts a series of important talks and workshops, including the participation of internationally well-known scholars, professionals and artists. This aims to generate a multi-disciplinary, critical reflection on important cultural topics and to reach the interest of an increasingly heterogeneous audience. 

Alongside with cultural talks and academic debates, a second aspect of NipPop has been growing during these years. Music concerts, art performances, film exhibitions and cosplay events call on the attention of many people and students in Bologna. On top of that, new and more interesting activities come to life with every new edition of NipPop, assuring a great visibility and affluence to the event.

In November 2013, the Cultural Association NipPop was born in Bologna from this positive experience. 

For its fifth edition, the central theme of NipPop will be Metamorphosis. The metamorphosis is acknowledged as the key element to an understanding of the contemporary art and the “Asian Power” culture of the new millennium, now looking towards the East. Specifically, the main focus will be on artists and creative personalities who in recent years moved from Japan to Europe, mixing in their works styles and techniques from the different cultures they have to deal with on a daily basis.

This year’s edition of NipPop will feature many guests and activities! Directly from Japan, our guests of the section “Incontri": mangaka Ikeda Riyoko, author of the celebrated The Rose of Versailles (Berusaiyu no Bara), and the novelist, director and musician Jinsei Hitonari Tsuji. Artists Tomoko Nagao and Yumi Karasumaro will be the guests of the "NipPop Art" section; "NipPop Music" with spectacular shows by Keisho Ohno and his incredible sound, that mixes tradition and pop styles, with SAGA and Babymetal, with Eriko’s K-ble Jungle. And also workshops with Keiko Ichiguchi and Watanabe Yoshiko, Ivo De Palma... and many many other appointments you wouldn’t want to miss!!!

For the complete program of the event visit us at http://www.nippop.it/5-6-7-giugno/

Supporta NipPop 2015!!!

Con un contributo, per quanto piccolo, supporterete l'associazione per rendere l'evento NipPop 2015 ancora più dinamico e interessante, permettendoci di utilizzare location sempre più belle e spaziose che accoglieranno ospiti, workshop e tavole rotonde. Ogni donazione aiuterà, ad esempio, ad acquistare i biglietti di viaggio per gli ospiti internazionali che parteciperanno all'evento, a provvedere alle spese per i nostri workshop e per le performance degli artisti ospiti.
NipPop 2015 è un progetto che cresce di anno in anno proprio grazie al supporto di volontari e appassionati, interessati a renderlo sempre più grande. Ed è proprio grazie al vostro aiuto che  possiamo garantire che NipPop continuerà a essere un evento gratuito e aperto a tutti.
Attraverso la nostra pagina Facebook, Instagram e Twitter avete la possibilità di inviarci suggerimenti, consigli o critiche, in una ricerca collettiva e partecipata.


Support NipPop 2015!!!

With only a little financial help, you can support the association and make this fifth edition of NipPop2015 even more interesting and funny!  To host international guests, lecturers and artists from all over the world; to organize workshops and roundtables; to cover all the necessary technical expenses required by the location: we need your help for these and many other activities for you to enjoy at NipPop2015! 

NipPop is a project growing bigger and bigger every year thanks to volunteers and to passion-driven people, helping in all the scheduled activities. Via our Facebook and Twitter pages, you will have the opportunity to help us improving and developing our project with feedbacks, suggestions and critics, in a collective research towards the best possible experience.


A cosa servirà il tuo contributo?

  • Contribuirà al 60% delle spese per portare i nostri ospiti dal Giappone.
  • Contribuirà al 50% dell'organizzazione delle attività in programma nelle due giornate presso lo Spazio OZ.
  • Contribuirà al 50% dei costi di comunicazione.
    Comunicare l’evento è fondamentale per far crescere NipPop, e far sì  che abbia una eco sempre maggiore a Bologna, in Italia e nel Web.
  • Contribuirà al 50% delle spese di allestimento tecnico.


In which way will the contribute be used?

  • It will cover the 60% of the total expenses towards journeys and accommodations of our international guests.
  • It will contribute for the 50% to the organization of planned activities, scheduled to be performed during our two days at Spazio OZ.
  • It will help for the 50% towards communication and web media management.
    This is a key element for the future growth of NipPop. Your support will allow us to gain a better visibility on the Web and to keep on promoting NipPop all over Bologna, Italy and the Internet.
  • Last but not least, it will contribute for the 50% to the technical needs of the event.


Come funziona?

Non potrebbe essere più facile. Si può pagare con carta di credito/carta di debito o PayPal. Basta cliccare sui banner CONTRIBUTE NOW a lato del video  e scegliere la donazione con cui vorreste supportare l'associazione NipPop. Noi, una volta conclusasi la campagna Indiegogo, vi spediremo il premio corrispondente. Potete anche optare per contribuire con una cifra diversa da quelle indicate e non richiedere alcun perk. E' possibile anche effettuare una donazione anonima.


How does it work?

It is really simple. You can donate using your credit/debit card or through a PayPal account. Just click on the CONTRIBUTE NOW banner, you can find it next to our video, and choose one of the PERKS with their corresponding rewards. You also have the opportunity to choose the amount to be donated, and you will be able to do it anonymously. At the end of the Indiegogo campaign, we will send you your perk via mail.



Cosa succede una volta scaduto il tempo della campagna Indiegogo?

L'obiettivo indicato è quella che ci permetterà di sostenere  l'organizzazione di NipPop. Se alla scadenza la cifra risulterà superata, l'importo in eccedenza verrà investito in un ulteriore miglioramento dell'evento. Se, invece, alla scadenza non dovessimo raggiungere la somma prefissata, utilizzeremo le donazioni per supportare al massimo l'organizzazione.


What will happen at the end of the Indiegogo campaign?

The set goal will allow us to fully organize NipPop 2015. Should we exceed the expectations, all the extra money will be spent to further improve our activities and organization. Otherwise, the collected amount will be used to organize the event at our best.


Vuoi dare visibilità alla tua azienda o associazione?

Collabora con NipPop e avrai:

  • Riproduzione logo su materiali pubblicitari online (siti web, web magazine, social, newsletter)
  • Riproduzione logo sul video pubblicitario della manifestazione
  • Riproduzione logo su locandine, volantini, flyer, catalogo (cartacei)
  • Cartellone individuale con massima visibilità nei luoghi della manifestazione
  • Volantini e materiale informativo nei luoghi della manifestazione

Per altri tipi di collaborazione scriveteci a office@nippop.it


Come contattarci:

How to conctact us:

Sito ufficiale / Official site: www.nippop.it

Facebook: www.facebook.com/nippopbologna

Youtube: www.youtube.com/nippopbologna

Twitter: www.twitter.com/NipPopOfficial

Email: info@nippop.it

story: Hello! My name is Nikki and in the video Denise did an awesome job giving you all the details of what The Dragon's Rocketship has come to be. As she mentioned we are working on another anthology, but this time we want to make sure it's done right. We want to make sure that our book is polished and perfect so when it goes out into the world it's only after an editor has had the ability to go through and fix all our writer mistakes. story:
Children's Book - Duke & Michel: Return of the Nibbles

I am Elias Zapple, noted cabbage thrower, occasional moustache model, keeper of attack-minded slugs, tormentor of my neighbour, Dieter and renowned children's author of humorous stories that make kids laugh so hard they have been known to spontaneously combust.

Duke & Michel: Return of the Nibbles is the third in the series. The first two books, Duke & Michel: The Mysterious Corridor and Duke & Michel: The King Tingaling Painting have already been released and are currently fighting for survival in the ultra competitive world of children's fiction.

Set within an alternate-reality, the series follows the adventures of skateboarder Michel, a 12 year-old boy from Fulham, London and Duke, a sarcastic, food-obsessed Basset Hound and their search for their missing relatives. (And later on, Duke's missing dog food). This is a fast-paced, action-packed, humour-filled, hyphen-hyphen series that more kids would love if they knew about it. The latest instalment sees Duke & Michel continue on their quest to rid the realm of the Master and make everything all right again.

The first two books I was able to fund myself, however the third is proving difficult what with the price of cabbages nowadays and my prolific literary nature, (8 books published last year, including new illustrations for my first book).

Achieving my target amount and being able to get the third Duke & Michel book edited, illustrated and published would mean a great deal to me and my slugs. It would mean so much that I would tell Gino the Slug not to cook any slugs for one whole week.

Our Non-Cabbage Related Target

I need $1000 to get Return of the Nibbles from just words on my screen to being an actual book with illustrations and all. The sum breaks down like this:

  • $150 to hire the same illustrator that did the covers for The Mysterious Corridor and The King Tingaling Painting to do the cover for this book.
  • $250 to get a literary consultant to read the book and provide me with any necessary advice on plotting, characterisation etc...
  • $100 for it to be proofread.
  • $300 to hire another illustrator to do the interior illustrations.
  • And another $200 for the same illustrator that'll do the interior to help me revamp the two earlier Duke & Michel books and add/change some illustrations.

Perks! (Besides the promise that I won't throw any cabbages at you).

  1. For $5: A thank you email from Elias Zapple. (Yes, I do refer to myself in the 3rd person).
  2. For $10: An email to say thank you + a message on my blog that'll reach a potential audience of 2 people.
  3. For $25: I will write a terribly unfunny poem about you and feature it on my blog + an e-book of Duke & Michel: The Mysterious Corridor.
  4. For $50: An exclusive black & white illustration of either Duke or Michel sent to you via email + an e-book of Duke & Michel: The Mysterious Corridor.
  5. For $100: A signed copy of Duke & Michel: The Mysterious Corridor + a Duke & Michel Death's Harvest t-shirt. 
  6. For $250: A Duke & Michel t-shirt, a signed copy of The Mysterious Corridor, a Duke & Michel poster PLUS, an acknowledgement in Duke & Michel: Return of the Nibbles.

The Impact On My Slugs

If Return of the Nibbles achieves its funding then the lives of my slugs will be that much more bearable as I won't throw any temper tantrums and shall eat chicken for my dinners instead of slugs.
The world needs humour, the world needs Zapple. By helping Return of the Nibbles get released you're giving the world more of Duke - a dog that needs to be heard and insulted by.

If financial support is not an option...

Then do not worry! My slugs will come and slime you forthwith! To avoid being slimed, it would be slug-tastic if you could: 

  • Share this campaign on Twitter, Facebook and other forms of social media. (You can find the widgety-things somewhere on this page apparently).
  • Spread the word about Elias Zapple and his books and make my moustache, Mr Snazzy, the most famous moustache in the world.

That's all!

Your Zappleness

So you haven't had time to read the 27th Protector series?

This may be some of the reasons:

  • You're really busy and only listen to audiobooks
  • You've been waiting for it on audiobook
  • You downloaded it on kindle, but wish it was on audiobook because you have to time to listen to those

 

What We Need & What You Get

Let's break it down:

  • You help us pay the narrator and audible to produce the audiobook
  • Hear a sample of Chapter 22-23 on https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bH-HDN_QZjw

Book One is already in production

With five chapters done and a preview complete, we are already rolling!  Book one should be done by December 16th!  If we reach our Indiegogo goal, we'll be able to start on Book 2 and it should be complete in March!

EVEN IF...

We reach half of our goal, it will help Book 1 get completed by December 20!  That's a HUGE accomplishment! Every gift helps!

Thanks all!

story:
We are eleven authors, an artist and a publisher who have come together to create a rather special book, inspired by traditional animal stories from Cameroon.

The stories are fun, and they are beautiful. They are full of tricky tortoises, cunning monkeys, flies stronger than elephants, blue bottomed drills, despicable crocodiles, and animals gathering for meetings up in the sky.

These tales are being retold by some of the best children's authors around. They are illustrated by an amazing artist, and published by an award winning publisher.

And we really want you to have them, in our book. Take a copy through our perks (there, on the right!), and these stories will do some very good things.

What's the plan?

If you take our book, it helps us in our goal to give free copies to at least 2,000 children in Cameroon who otherwise would have no books. (And we mean no books. None at all. Not one.)

And these aren't just any stories or any children. The stories we're retelling belong to the children of the Korup Forest in Cameroon - these children who otherwise won't ever read them.

The stories are being lost and the children's education suffering. We want to put that right.

So we need money to print and distribute the book in Cameroon. These are our only costs - we all gave our time for free!

How does it work?

Here's the idea:
  • We print a UK version for our book, which YOU can take through our perks. (Look to the right - there! There it is!)
  • The UK copy pays for its own printing and for multiple copies to be printed in Cameroon.
  • We distribute at least 2,000 copies to children in the Korup.
  • You receive a unique, beautiful book of stories, written by some of the best children's authors and available nowhere else.
  • You read the book, give it as a present or simply marvel at its beauty on your shelf - knowing that you've done something lovely for someone who needed it.

So who's involved?

Glad you asked!

The storytellers are Abi Elphinstone, Adele Geras, Beverley Naidoo, Elizabeth Laird, Geraldine McCaughrean, Gill Lewis, Ifeoma Onyefulu, Lucy Christopher, Piers Torday, Sarah Lean and Tom Moorhouse.

(Fun game: spot the award-winners and best-sellers. Hint: there are lots!)

The illustrator is Emmie van Biervliet. (And just look at the art she creates!)

The publisher is Lantana Publishing. (Winners of Best Book at the Children's Africana Book Awards, 2016.)

And helping out, providing vital logistical support, is the conservation research charity WildCRU, part of Oxford University's Zoology Department.

What will the book be like?

We're aiming for beautiful and hoping for spectacular. We've been working hard on the diverse stories, Lantana have a reputation for extremely lovely books and Emmie is terrific. The book will be hardback, approximately 160 pages with 33 colour illustrations. It should be lovely.

 

Why the Korup?

Good question, and a slightly long story (bear with us):
As well as being an author, Tom Moorhouse works as an ecologist at WildCRU. One of his colleagues, Christos (that's him in the middle), runs a conservation project in Korup, working with local collaborators to study and safeguard the region's precious, ancient forests and the wildlife therein.

Christos and his team (Malenoh, Orume and the other amazing folks), knowing that the traditional folk stories were being lost, collected tales from all the region's elders and chiefs. Christos asked Tom to write the stories up, so they could be photocopied and handed out to the local children.

Rather than just doing that, Tom called up some amazingly talented and incredibly generous people who all said "yes" to writing a story, illustrating the stories or editing and publishing the book - and so the project began.

Do these kids really have no books?

Really. You can read more here on Lantana's website (click the "Learn More" link the bottom of their page), but just imagine homes where the only things to read are some tattered medicine instructions or a rotten old poster. They look a bit like this:


Imagine a school where there is one textbook. The teacher copies it onto the board and the children write it down and study it.

Imagine kids leaving school after only primary education.

Now imagine what a difference a free book of the region's stories could make.


Are there any other benefits?

Yes. Like many places with a wealth of natural resources, but a relatively poor population, the Korup's forest is under threat. The main threats are rampant hunting of animals for bushmeat and massive conversions to oilpalm plantations.

Our book is full of tales of the forest and the animals that live there - and while they may just be stories, they are a connection to the forest, educating children about animals and habitats, and inspiring literacy.

Of course one book can't solve all the problems facing the Korup's forests, but it can help: education is vital to empower people to protect their resources and way of life.

What happened to the Korup's stories?

Here's how it used to be: every month the whole of each village would gather and tell their stories - part of an oral tradition. But life has changed and these gatherings no longer happen. The oral tradition is being lost, but there are no written stories to replace it.

Can you really do it?

Yes, absolutely - with your support. Christos' project has been established for a long time and works closely with the people in the Korup. We are perfectly placed to get these books quickly printed and delivered to the children who need them.

Why the fundraising goal?

Printing books gets less expensive (per book) the larger the batch you print. We need enough to cover the Cameroon printing and distribution costs for 2,000 copies - thus supporting local Cameroonian businesses - as well as the costs for printing and distributing a large enough batch of UK copies, on the right paper, with colour illustrations, in a beautiful gift format, to send to all you lovely people - remembering that your books will fund the Cameroon printing.

If you beat your funding target, what happens?

There's more to do. Our book is written in English, which is one of the main languages the three ethnic groups living in the Korup use to communicate. The other main language is French - with further funding we can translate the book into French, and distribute many more copies.


How do I learn more?

There are lots and lots more details available here. We've made it a tiny challenge: click on the link and go to the bottom of the page to where it says "Learn more" (near the elephant's posterior). It will open a magic portal (pop up window) of information.

How else can I help?

Not everyone who comes here will be able to buy a book or make a donation - we definitely understand. But you can still help us by spreading the word.

  • Whenever and wherever you can, try to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign #CameroonStories.
  • Don't forget to use the Indiegogo social media sharing tools!

THANK YOU - you are wonderful.


Oh, and one more thing: you might be wondering where we could possibly have found the heroic megastars who created our fantastic campaign video. The answer is that Daniel Nils Roberts and Adam Hale went so far beyond being merely "incredible" that we are all still awestruck.

story:
What is Perspektif Magazine?

Perspektif Magazine is a non-profit, free, volunteer-run print publication, and a project of Melbourne University's Indonesian Students Society. However, Perspektif Magazine is inclusive; Perspektif can be read and enjoyed by everyone, and our committee and contributors consist of students and non-students of all nationalities, who are based worldwide.
Perspektif Magazine aims to showcase talents, ideas, and initiatives. We do that by presenting writings (which can be fiction and non-fiction), ideas and opinions, or artwork on topics related to arts, culture, education, lifestyle, politics, business, and economics through a visually appealing, intellectually engaging, and thought-provoking magazine. 
Perspektif is the Indonesian word for 'perspective', and it represents our aim: to act as a platform by which individuals can showcase their perspective on contemporary issues.

Your Perspektif

Our contributors are based all over the world, and range from experienced writers to students who have never written for a publication before. We want to give new and emerging talents in writing, art, and design a platform to showcase their work.

Perspektif Magazine is free - and we'd like to keep it that way. We want to get fresh and engaging content out there and into people's hands - not just in their digitalised screens.

So far, Perspektif Magazine is distributed mainly around the University of Melbourne campus, Indonesian Students' Society events, and around Melbourne and Jakarta's cafes and coffee shops. With each volume, there are individuals who have shown interest in Perspektif Magazine but could not receive a copy, due to the limited number of copies we are able to print for each volume.  


Risks & Challenges

We print 500 copies of every volume, which launches at the start of each semester. Since we are a free magazine, we rely on sponsors and advertisers to generate enough funds to send our magazine for printing.

Our challenge is that some advertisers do not want to buy advertising spaces unless we print (way) more than 500 copies. Unfortunately, we cannot do that unless we get more funding, and that becomes a chicken-and-the-egg situation for us as a small and relatively new magazine.

What we want to do is eventually break that threshold - we want to get Perspektif Magazine out there and into the right hands. With increased awareness, our hope is that more people will support our vision. But most importantly, we want to be sustainable. 


We greatly appreciate any kind of support, so whether you decide to pledge, or share this project and spread the word to everyone, it would be a significant help for us.

story:
Short Summary

This campaign is to fund the first year expenses for Cuil Press, a new publisher that will specialize in diverse and #ownvoices genre fiction. The publishing industry does not welcome non-mainstream work. Too many authors have been told their stories are "too ethnic" or "unrelatable" to mainstream readers or that a character could be part of only one minority group. We want to change that.

We are a small team, Jess, Michon and Michelle, with a lot of experience. We've written and published books, worked as editors and marketers, organized communities and gone to art school. Between the three of us we've done a bit of everything.

In time, we hope to release multiple books each month, in ebook and audio format.

What We Need & What You Get

What we need:

  • Our minimum goal is $1500. This will let us pay back the loan from friends for our legal incorporating fees, get a big batch of ISBNs (required to publish a book), pay for our webhosting, keep our cover artist in art supplies, and have a bit extra for unexpected expenses.

  • Our first stretch goal is $5,000. This will cover going to a few conventions (transportation, hotel, and table fees) and some advertising expenses.
  • Our final stretch goal is $10,000+. Currently our team is all volunteer, no one is getting paid until the Press starts making a profit. If we reach this goal, we can start paying ourselves for our work.
  • As long as we get enough money to get a stack of ISBNs, the Press is moving forward. But your help can make a big difference in whether or not we succeed.

What you get:

A new publisher putting out the kind of stories you want to read.

And as thanks, you'll get a few extra things as well ;-)

Of course since we're a publisher, we're offering books

 

Our Book Lovers Perk gets you our first ten ebook at ~20% below retail. If you're quick, you can grab the Early Bird Book Lovers Bundle for even less.

 

We're also offering:

  • Exclusive wallpapers based on our book covers
  • Original short stories
  • And more...

The Impact

There is not enough diverse and inclusive fiction out there. There is not enough own voices fiction out there. And there is way too much genre fiction that follows the well-worn tropes and cliches without bringing anything different and new to the table. We aim to change that.

  • We will be publishing inclusive and diverse fiction, much of it #ownvoices, so folks looking for good representative fiction can find it.
  • We will be publishing books that break genre tropes and conventions, so readers who are tired of the same-old, same-old, can find fresh, new fiction to enjoy.
  • Our team is new to publishing-as-a-business, but includes self-published authors, an editor, a marketer, and an artist. Our prior and current projects include the successful blog Polyamory on Purpose and building the Facebook community Intersectional Non-Monogamy (3,000+ members in one year and growing). We've taken on big projects before and know how to make plans come together.
  • We'll be starting small, and building as we go. But we believe we can bring real change to your bookshelves and to eventually to publishing.

Risks & Challenges

Publishing is pretty saturated right now. There are hundreds of new books coming out each month. So the big challenge for any new publisher is standing out and getting our books in front of people. Cuil Press has some specific challenges because we are small team of spoony folks and are starting on a shoestring budget. But we believe in what we are doing and have plans to how to make it work.

  • There are very few genre publishers focusing on inclusive fiction, and the ones that are, are almost exclusively putting out LGBT romance. Many people are calling for more diverse books and more #ownvoices books. We believe we can stand out by filling this need.
  • Our belief is that once readers know they can find diverse and #ownvoices romance and SFF with Cuil Press, they will keep coming back to us. This way we make it easier for readers to find what they want and we don't need to constantly fight for visibility in a saturated marketplace.
  • We will deal with the low budget by doing all work in house. While our team is small, it is experienced. Two of our team members are self-published authors who have also worked as editors. They know the process of taking a book from manuscript to publication as well as the editing process and how to help an author make their book shine. Another team member is a skilled artist who will be creating the images for our book covers, as well as helping with the various steps of the publishing process.
  • However, as mentioned before, our team is all spoony. So we will be starting slow and releasing a new book every other month. Our goals are 1) by giving proper attention to creating and marketing each book, to bring in enough money we can begin contracting editors and cover designers (as most publishers do) and 2) to bring in new team members so we have more person-hours available and can gradually increase how often we release new books.

 

So that's it, what we're doing, who we are, and all the little details. Thank you for taking the time to read and learn about us. Thank you for your interest. Most importantly...

Thank You For Your Support.

Every Bit Helps.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We know not everyone has money they can afford to put into projects like this, but that doesn't mean you don't care. So here are some other ways you can help!

  • Share, share, share! Share this campaign on your social media accounts. Share the main campaign or link to specific perks that people you know will enjoy. Indiegogo has lots of awesome share tools you can use.
  • Follow us on social media or subscribe to our blog so you can buy our books when they start coming out!
  • And of course, tell your author friends to send their manuscripts our way!

The publishing industry does not welcome non-mainstream work. In time, we hope to release multiple books each month, in ebook and audio format.

Our minimum goal is $1500. This will let us pay back the loan from friends for our legal incorporating fees, get a big batch of ISBNs (required to publish a book), pay for our webhosting, keep our cover artist in art supplies, and have a bit extra for unexpected expenses.


Our first stretch goal is $5,000. This will cover going to a few conventions (transportation, hotel, and table fees) and some advertising expenses.
Our final stretch goal is $10,000+. Currently our team is all volunteer, no one is getting paid until the Press starts making a profit. If we reach this goal, we can start paying ourselves for our work.

A new publisher putting out the kind of stories you want to read.

story:
Summary

We are The Burril’s, JimmyO and my wife April.  We have been artists all of our lives.  We love our children, we love the life-long magic of a good picture book, and we love monsters.  Our home is funded, lives, and breathes on art of one form or another. I was a medical illustrator for the National Institute of Health for 18 years, and April works as a graphic designer for several local companies, and has illustrated several children’s books.  Besides art, we both act, play various instruments, April dances, and I write.  However, we are best known for the few films we made in the horror genre.  We were bestowed the title of “First Family of Indi Horror” which I felt was the best compliment we could ever receive at that time.  When we would go to fan conventions, our kids were there.  When we would create  and perform plays, our kids were there.  When we had anything going on at all, it was done as a family, to a great extent. If it was a safe and beneficial environment for our girls, Lilli and Willow, they were with us. Yes, First Family of Indi Horror suited us just fine.  

In my early 20’s, I got my start writing for stage by first directing and then writing for children’s theater. I found it to be some of the most heart warming and gratifying work I had done. Some shows were performed by the kids, and then others were performed by adults for kids. It was this sort of performance where I would meet my wife to be, April.  She and I, now married 18 years, have raised two incredible young women - one sharp, book wise, smart as a whip; the other whimsical, artsy, full of imagination.  These two personalities are the formula for our stories, Creepy and Boo.  Growing up is complicated.  It’s full of little traps, let downs, insecurities.  But also full of passion, discovery and joy.  Navigating the ups and downs of growing up are the basis of our stories.  

What We Need & What You Get

We are looking to self publish the Creepy and Boo Books and to get that ball rolling, we are looking to raise $5,000 for printing, ebooks, marketing, etc.  Without an agent, it is difficult to get into a large publishing house.  Our goal is to self-publish the first book, in hopes that the next of the series can get picked up by a larger house.  We have 4 books at this time.  two completed and two in process.  We are hoping to make Creepy and Boo, as well as whatever other quirky original stories we come up with, our full-time career. So we are looking for the long game here. 

The Goodies

  • $5 = You get an emailed thank you from April and I.  
  • $10 = You will get a mailed Thank you card, signed (For the film fans who collect) with a                          Creepy and Boo Sticker.
  • $25 =  You get the same as the $10 perk plus the Kindle e-book of Boo’s Big Growl.
  • $50 = Same as above but add in an exclusive signed poster of Creepy and Boo from April and              I.   (Suitable for Framing)
  • $100 = Signed first edition book of Boo’s Big Growl, plus all of the goodies listed above. 
  • $200 = The Silver Sponsor Credit in the book, First Edition Book, e-book, poster, sticker.
  • $500 = Gold Sponsor Credit (larger) in the book, First Edition Book,  e-book, poster, sticker,                     and the limited edition “I Love Monsters” T-shirt.
  • $1000 = Platinum Sponsor credit (largest) in book, All the other stuff … Tee, Book, Poster,                           ebook, all signed, sealed and delivered… BUT  We include an original Creepy and Boo                   drawing, framed, signed… one of a kind.  We draw it FOR YOU! 

The Impact

Eye catching art and a solid story with a little bit of a lesson make the Monstrous Adventures of Creepy and Boo work.  And they do work well.  The first two stories were accepted by the Johns Hopkins Children’s Hospital, as “Gifts for Young Guests.”  They have been well received there, even if only in print out form, since there was no book published at the time.  Your support helps us create this new world for children… for your children, your friends’ and families’ children.  Books are magic.  They are the building blocks of learning and entertainment.  Your support opens a new path for young readers to explore, imagine, and learn. 

Challenges

As parents, artists, filmmakers and entertainers, we have dealt with the challenge of funding for various projects for years. We have successfully swam these waters to the point of creating a world known horror icon, at least  in the horror genre, using the internet, and marketing skills I acquired working for Warner Home Video.  For Warner my job was to promote mostly Looney Tunes videos in the late 80’s and early 90s, back when there was such a thing as a video store.  I also had a hand in promotions for Tim Burton’s  Batman and Beetlejuice, Gremlins, National Lampoon's Vacation, and various other films.  It was a time of learning and growth both artistically and in marketing. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We know not everyone is in a position to contribute, so we ask for those with interest to please help spread the word.  Send this to your aunt, uncle, work friend who has kids, grandparents, or anyone who you think would be interested in supporting this sort of educational and imagination expanding entertainment we are offering.  Please remember you can use the Indiegogo share tools! 

All support by you is appreciated by our entire family.  

Thanks for taking the time to give our dream a look, and for your thoughtful consideration.

story:
You're invited to join an exceptional young woman as she shares her story of acceptance and understanding.

Jenevieve Woods was born with a life-altering Mitochondrial Disease that requires her to take a different approach to life. She looks at her illness as a gift, because it has given her the ability to see the world with different glasses. With your support, Jenevieve will be able to print the first edition of her book and share her glasses with you and many others.

In addition, Jenveive believes in giving back. Throughout her life she has been blessed with the support of some wonderful Mito organization. The phrase "it takes a village.." is applicable and a percentage of every campaign dollar raised will go to helping these organizations find a cure for Mitochondrial Disease.

The Book

PEACH, the book, is an inspiring account of courage, hope, and strength despite a rare life-altering disease that that is told with heart-wrenching pathos. Peach, the teenage author, aka Jenevieve Woods, relates with lyrical beauty how she feels while being ignored because she is 'different', and implores us all to celebrate our differences and be 'as one'. She explains that her affliction is a gift that enables her to focus on the unstoppable powers of hope, kindness, compassion, and gratitude for a life of meaning and discovery.

Ms. Woods' book demonstrates wisdom, compassion, and insight into the human condition that is far beyond her eighteen years.  She praises her mom for being her hero, her stepfather for being her rock, and her brothers for being her soul mates. She accepts the life granted her with grace and even gratitude: ' HERE IS THE GREAT PART: I am glad I have this disease, mostly because I have come to understand and have discovered the meaning in my life. It is to help others. I have a unique set of glasses that I wear that gives me the power to see everybody’s soul and their truest self.

Sneak Peek at the Table of Contents

*This is an early edition, minor changes may still occur.

 

Early Reviews

Medical Professionals

Peach has a unique set of glasses that gives her the power to see everybody's soul and their truest self. I believe that her glasses also help identify people who most need a massive dose of kindness. Buy the book, read it, and feel its power working on your soul.

- Dr. Eugene Myers, MD, Distinguished Professor Emeritus, University of Pittsburgh Medical Center

This is a powerful story of hope and its unstoppable power.

- Paul Spence, former Vice President, Highmark Health System

I will recommend this book to my patients and others who are struggling with health and relationship issues, or who want to be moved by an exceptional story told with lyric beauty.

- Dr. Jacqueline Meyers, Ph.D., Clinical Director, Meyers Professional Group

Peach displays communications and other talents that are rare and unexpected in a teenager struggling with a debilitating medical condition that is also life threatening. She has a story to inspire the world; her struggle is a compelling read.

- Nancy Green,  Disability Services Director (Ret), ACHIEVA 

Academia & Teachers

Truly a brilliant piece of literature… Peach is a gift who has given us a gripping story of a young woman’s courageous daily battle with a life-altering illness. I was captivated with her very first words in Chapter 1. Peach’s view of equality, a “feeling inside more than a reality.”

- Rebecca A. Clemens, M.Ed. ,Professional School Counselor

Peach has provided a glimpse into a world that not many people will experience.  Her account of MITO and its devastating effects on her life and the life of her family is both moving and encouraging... her story should give hope to the rest of us as we try to make sense of our lives. 

- Daniel K. Donnelly, Ph.D.,  Dean, School of Business, Aquinas College

Your book should be required reading...you have inspired me deeply and irrevocably...

- David Zimomra,  Public School Teacher

Business Leaders

Thank you, Peach, for giving me insight into myself and bettering the way I relate to exceptional people...and for sharing your deep and personal thoughts. You will enhance the behavior of many.

- Jim Browne, President, and Founder, Allegheny Financial Group 

(Peach) has captured with her own words a significant concept that seems to be increasingly absent from human interactions - be kind to one another by truly celebrating others' differences. Peach's message of acceptance will teach all who listen that 'although things look different to the eyes, all souls are equal.' I am honored to have read her story.

- Keri Cimarolli,  Environmental Biologist 

Peach is a gifted writer who silently shouts out an optimistic message of forgiveness of adversaries, and a celebration of differences, through her beautiful prose and poetry.

- John Yasinsky, Former CEO, GenCorp. 

Peach's story is inspirational.  The thoughts and feelings of a young woman who faces adversity with an attitude that is far beyond courage - and includes wonder, awe and hope - is an inspiration to all of us. I believe that her story will resonate with everyone who hears it.

- Bill O'Rourke, Former President, Alcoa Russia  and co-author of The Power of Ethics.

Budget

As we have discovered that publishing a book is no small undertaking. We need your support to help us print and market the book.

Total Budget: $8,500

  • Book cover design $400
  • Overall graphics, formatting, & graphics $800
  • Editors $1,300
  • ISBN, copyright, & barcode $350
  • printing: ~$4,500
  • 5% giveback $425
  • Crowdfunding fees (5%) + Credit card fees (3%)  $680

The cost to print the books will change based on the number we print. The estimate we used is for 1,000 books. 

Perks & Contributions

With every contribution to the campaign, we get closer to printing our 1st edition. We have created some wonderful perks as a thank you for helping spread Jenevieve's story and message of universal acceptance.

If you are interested in contributing at a level not specified within one of our perk levels you can by clicking the BACK IT button at near the top of our page.

Peach

The main perk is the actual book. If you choose a perk with a printed copy of peach, it will arrive signed in early to mid-December. Digital copy will be sent within a few days of the campaign ending.

 

Warhol-like/Pop Art Covers

As an homage to one of Pittsburgh's most famous artist, we created a small series of 7" x 10" prints paired with one of Jenna's poems. In the prints below we used her butterfly poem, but you may choose any poem from the book.

Pop Art Cover & Poem Turquoise Background

 

Pop Art Cover & Poem Magenta Background

 

Pop Art Cover & Poem Blue Background

 

Pop Art Cover & Poem Green Background

 

Giving Back

Peach has been fortunate enough to be recognized by Mito Action. She was recently awarded a scholarship to help continue her college education at LaRoche College in Pittsburgh, PA. She includes information about the organization and how to contact them within the book. In addition, this campaign will donate 5% of the total amount received to Mito Action.

MitoAction is a nonprofit organization dedicated to improving the quality of life for children, adults, and families living with mitochondrial disease through support, education, outreach, advocacy, and clinical research initiatives. For more information, please visit www.mitoaction.org or email info@mitoaction.org.

After the Indiegogo campaign is over, 5% of all proceeds from the sale of the book will continue to support mito organizations researching a cure.

Other Ways You Can Help

We're relying upon our supporters and friends to help get the word out. If you could please tell your friends and share this campaign page on Facebook and your other social media accounts. Thank you.

I believe that her story will resonate with everyone who hears it.- Bill O'Rourke, Former President, Alcoa Russia  and co-author of The Power of Ethics.BudgetAs we have discovered that publishing a book is no small undertaking. We need your support to help us print and market the book.Total Budget: $8,500
Book cover design $400
Overall graphics, formatting, & graphics $800
Editors $1,300
ISBN, copyright, & barcode $350
printing: ~$4,500
5% giveback $425
Crowdfunding fees (5%) + Credit card fees (3%)  $680
The cost to print the books will change based on the number we print. The estimate we used is for 1,000 books. Perks & ContributionsWith every contribution to the campaign, we get closer to printing our 1st edition. We have created some wonderful perks as a thank you for helping spread Jenevieve's story and message of universal acceptance.If you are interested in contributing at a level not specified within one of our perk levels you can by clicking the BACK IT button at near the top of our page.PeachThe main perk is the actual book. If you choose a perk with a printed copy of peach, it will arrive signed in early to mid-December. Digital copy will be sent within a few days of the campaign ending. Warhol-like/Pop Art CoversAs an homage to one of Pittsburgh's most famous artist, we created a small series of 7" x 10" prints paired with one of Jenna's poems. In the prints below we used her butterfly poem, but you may choose any poem from the book.Pop Art Cover & Poem Turquoise Background Pop Art Cover & Poem Magenta Background Pop Art Cover & Poem Blue Background Pop Art Cover & Poem Green Background Giving BackPeach has been fortunate enough to be recognized by Mito Action. She was recently awarded a scholarship to help continue her college education at LaRoche College in Pittsburgh, PA. She includes information about the organization and how to contact them within the book. In addition, this campaign will donate 5% of the total amount received to Mito Action.MitoAction is a nonprofit organization dedicated to improving the quality of life for children, adults, and families living with mitochondrial disease through support, education, outreach, advocacy, and clinical research initiatives. For more information, please visit www.mitoaction.org or email info@mitoaction.org.After the Indiegogo campaign is over, 5% of all proceeds from the sale of the book will continue to support mito organizations researching a cure.Other Ways You Can HelpWe're relying upon our supporters and friends to help get the word out. If you could please tell your friends and share this campaign page on Facebook and your other social media accounts. Thank you.

story:
Autobiography novella that needs publishing!

We want to help a young woman publish her autobiography of her journey leading up to, through and past anorexia nervosa and bulimia.

Morgan was your stereotypical teenager; she struggled to balance school, work, boys, and finding herself. When an emotionally abusive relationship was added into the midst of her struggles, however, she went from a promising young adult to a victim of anorexia and bulimia nervosa- a fierce battle against herself. Learn about how this everyday 16-year-old fell into a life-threatening physical state of 82 lbs, and an even more life-threatening mental state of depression, insomnia, and suicidal impulses. Formed together by actual journal entries throughout Morgan’s illness, this true, heart-rending story explains in depth how her battle came about, the gruesome realities of an eating disorder, and how she came to be the healthy person she is today.

story:
I NEED YOUR HELP!

Hello, I'm Russell Slater - an author and head of Peninsulam Publishing, a small publishing press out of western Michigan. 

We're excited for an upcoming project, The Great Tractor King!  I've written and published three children's books, and I love sharing the material with youngsters.  I'm looking forward to offering more titles for little minds. 

I NEED YOUR HELP to make this project come to life.  Any donation, any size, is greatly appreciated!  

What I Need From You

I'm looking to raise $1,000 to cover the costs of illustrations ($500) to be done by the talented up-and-coming Argentine artist Christian Francone and the initial print run ($500). 

Please help join the effort to assist the growth of a creative small business in West Michigan! 

$25 (SUPPORTER level) = a signed copy of the finished book.

$50 (ENTHUSIASTIC SUPPORTER level) = a signed copy as well as a "THANK YOU" mention in the back of the book (if desired)

$100 (LEADER level) = a signed copy as well as a "THANK YOU" mention in the back of the book (if desired), and a coffee mug featuring the cover art

$200 (ROYAL LEADER level) = a signed copy as well as a "THANK YOU" mention in the back of the book (if desired), a coffee mug and a large poster featuring the cover art. 

Whether we reach our goal or not, whatever funds are raised will be put towards production.  Meeting or exceeding our goal means we can release the book sooner and get started on the next project. 

Help us create quality stories to help children learn valuable lessons so they may grow into intelligent, compassionate adults.

story:
Short Summary

The Vigilantics are a diverse team headed by a very powerful woman and made up of heroes from various backgrounds. They're relatable for everyday people, and they represent those that are usually ignored in the superhero realm.

The Heroes

Legacy - Maggie Luna is the last descendant of Olmec King Kele, and she has inherited the power of the were-jaguar, the protector of the underworld.

Chirp - Tosha Ramsey is a lawyer who became super strong after an experimental surgery to repair an injury from playing hockey for Harvard.

Fracas - The heart and soul of the group, Harpreet Anand is a successful accountant turned city councilwoman. Though she has no super powers, she is a trained fighter.

Wisecrack - Benjie Zielinski studied biology under his father and lost both of his parents when he was young. He is a self-taught master with a whip who joins the group to have friends.

Train Wreck - Kyle Palmer is the oldest and least educated member of the group. Thanks to an experimental organ transplant when he was a boy, he is completely indestructible.

The Plot - The team is pieced together after a discovery that a Josef Stalin conspiracy to create ape-man super soldiers may have come to fruition.

My name is Kevin Moyers. I'm the author of "The Vigilantics" and co-owner (with my ten-year-old daughter) of Bunny 17 Media. For almost two decades, I've written graphic novels, comedy essay collections, kids' books, screenplays, and more. With all of that, I realized that I was missing a significant audience; an entire generation of girls that my friends, family, and I are raising.

In today's difficult social climate, I want young women to have heroes they can look up to. I believe that Maggie, Tosha, and Harpreet are those heroes, while Kyle and Benjie set positive examples for young men. I want teens to feel inspired and empowered, and I'm happy to contribute with this exciting story.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is a modest $1000. These funds, even if we don't reach our entire goal, will go toward cover art and obtaining the ISBN and barcode needed for distribution.

Perks are available for as little as $2 or as much as $50. This includes our secret perk. Items included range from digital desktops and The Vigilantics ebook to paperback or hardcover editions, a coffee mug from our heroes' favorite cafe, or exclusive t-shirts. Should we exceed our goal, contributors will receive bonus perks at different levels.

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge for any independent writer or publisher is funding artwork and printing on your own. With crowdfunding, you purchase the book in advance, which not only helps us to complete the book, but allows you to receive The Vigilantics before the general public.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you aren't able to make a financial contribution, there are other ways you can help. Indiegogo's share tools allow you to alert friends on social media to our project. You can also copy and paste the link to share via text or email.

story:
About me:

I am Alexandra Konstatýna Veliká, I come from the Czech Republic. I am a single mom who loves writing and wishes to publish her book, The Big Apple Strippers, very soon. It's a literary novel - provocative romance - for women. It's going to be a trilogy. I am currently working on the second book. I also already have a schedule for all three books.

Writing has been my passion and my hobby since childhood. At school, my literary works were always best in class. I believe it’s my destiny. I was born to write. I studied Public Relations at School of International and Public Relationships in Prague. I also go to Markéta Dočekalová’s School of Creative Writing and Scriptwriting. I finish the studies in June 2019. I am a member of Czech Writers Union. I write articles as an external editor but I am happiest whilst writing books and I want it to be my full-time job. I wrote three books which I did not try to publish just yet. I used them as a perfector of my writing skills. Now, I’d like to start my career with a trilogy: The Big Apple Strippers, The Big Apple Dreamers, and The Big Apple Crashers. I live by it, I work on it every day, and I can’t wait for the success.

 

Personalized Manuscript Report: 

Here is a link of My Personalized Manuscript Report from the authors of the Bestseller Code. I received four stars, meaning my book is likely to become a bestseller. Books that receive three or more stars already sell very well. You can find more information at 

https://static1.squarespace.com/static/5648bac6... 

 

Book story: 

Ashley Cooper leaves for New York city to get a pause in her relationship with Dominik, the father of her daughter, and who had cheated on her. She travels to the big city with her daughter and brings along a nanny. She can't wait to see her three friends who have been living in New York and see how their lives are. It turns out all three of them work as strippers and not unlike Ashley. The three friends show Ashley around. Neither of the three wants to be strippers their entire lives. Their common themes are men, love, relationships, fashions and plans for the future. Ashley loves her job but often wonders if she should start thinking about doing something else in life. Her hope is to find her true love and passion. She succumbs to the seduction of James Black, who she wonders if she is opening herself too much to. Ashley's biological father, who doesn't yet know about her, lives somewhere in the Upper Westside. Ashley finds her love in New York and begins to believe that impossible can be possible. Dominik arrives in New York and replaces the nanny. This creates a dilemma; will she return to Dominik or would she succumb to the physical attraction she has with James. Will New York fulfill her dreams or will she hit rock bottom?

 

My book trailer:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IK-7CJfuSSg

 

Your help: 

The money is needed especially for publishing of Czech and English version. 1.000pcs of the Czech version at Klika publishing would cost me 70.000CZK (3.082,4USD). 200pcs of the English version would cost me 41.000CZK (1.805,4USD). Of course I'd prefer to print more of the English version which would reduce the cost per book. If I manage to get the whole amount, I will gladly increase the number of English copies by more than a half. I would also like to send out a small part of the English copies to English - speaking literary agents together with a publication proposal, meaning that a small amount of the money would be used for correspondence. If I managed to get more money, I'd like to invest them into promotion and possible repring of more books.

Money I'll make off the book I'll use to pay for translations into other languages thereby securing the prompt dissemination of the book to other countries. Your financial help would make it easier for me to publish the book on my own and release it as soon as possible. I'd love to use as many marketing and advertising tools as possible so my book would have the release it deserves. I'll be eternally grateful for any support at all.

You don't have to be afraid of losing your investment. To each and every amount invested, apart from basic support, you'll get a gift.

 

Potential: 

It would be a great loss if I didn't receive any support. I believe that my book has a potential to succeed and will lift lots of people's spirit. It's kind of similar to Sex and the City in that the main characters are also New York girlfriends that date men and wish to be loved, they just also happen to be strippers. Thanks to my book, people will have the opportunity to look inside the nightlife in New York and, I hope, will lose some prejudices regarding this infamous profession. Men and everyday life are the most common topic in the book which may also remind you of the 50 Shades series in that both books share common topic of sexual dominance and submissiveness. We also have the man of the dreams - James Black, who's even darker than Christian Grey. The book is about love, friendship, life in New York and Strippers. It would be a great shame if it didn't get to be published in a scale that it deserves. I will greatly appreaciate any support!

 

Other Ways You can help:

If you don't have any funds but still wish to help, please share my campaign and tell your friends.

 

You can follow me on the facebook page: www.facebook.com/iamalexandravelika

Instagram: www.instagram.com/iamalexandravelika

Twitter: www.twitter.com/alexavelika

 

Thank you for your support!

www.alexandravelika.com

www.alexandravelika.cz

story:
What is The Regeneration?

Published twice a year, The Regeneration Magazine highlights creatives, thinkers, artists, and entrepreneurs who are making waves in the environmental movement and changing the conversation about climate change. 

The project was founded by Kyle Calian in November of 2016 as a response to the digitally oversaturated, polarized media climate that surrounded our most recent Presidential election. 

Climate Change is becoming and already is the biggest and most complex problem humanity will ever face. There is not one solution – in fact, there are hundreds. 

Most mainstream journalism is focused on the problems caused by climate change – the impending natural disasters, the displacement of people and species loss. We become overwhelmed with a numbing cocktail of fear and empathy. We don't know what to do because the problem doesn't have a clear solution of action.

The Regeneration aims to solve that.

We've created a publication is to showcase writers, leaders, and entrepreneurs who are actually solving problems and equip readers with knowledge, inspiration and the ability to take action.

What We Need Your Help With

After a successful first round of crowdfunding this past May, we were able to distribute over 1k copies of our first issue.

We want to increase the number of copies to 2k – but we also want to plant a tree for every copy sold with TreeEra. The funding we're trying to raise will go towards printing, shipping, and other distribution costs.

To thank you for your help, depending on your level of support, we'll be distributing copies of the magazine,  invitations to our upcoming launch party, Back to the Roots home farming kits, and even publishing your name in the magazine. 

 

Risks & Challenges

One of the things we didn't account for in our initial $7k raised on Fundly were other costs, such as shipping, packaging and carbon offsets. All of the money was for printing, and because of the high per-copy cost, we were financially limited. This time as we increase the quantity, our prices will decrease dramatically and we should become financially sustainable according to our calculations.

story:
Short Summery

Have you heard about an erasable story book?  Now you have!  Sydney.

Our aim is to encourage children to explore. Explore color as they color and erase and color again. Explore relationships as seen as when Sydney meets friends traveling through the work day. Explore and define their own definition of "work”. Men and women are engaged in careers once thought to be “girl or boy jobs”. In accordance with this, Sydney is gender neutral.

What you get

Our perks are unique. Each of them a reminder of a moment shared with Sydney.

A CD that tells of a day in the life of Sydney, a placemat and markers for ongoing action and a playful magnet to greet you each time you open your refrigerator.

Then, of course, a copy of Sydney, the book, autographed by the author and illustrator.

The Impact

To get Sydney off the ground we need to raise $5250. This will mostly cover editing, design, production and manufacturing as well as perks and shipping. Because Sydney is a dry erase board book, we have found the production costs of Sydney are more than the traditional children’s book.

Risks & Challenges

Our first challenge is making sure everyone understands Sydney. Sydney is not a cookie cutter book. Sydney is a magic erasable book - a "color and color again book". Sydney has no gender because gender does not determine one’s station in life!

That being said, finding a supplier was difficult, after several "no's" we found a supplier right here in Michigan, enabling us to promote Sydney as a Made In America book.

Our plans to date include making Sydney into a series of books from Ricecheks Books. Marshall is up for this challenge - as he is our illustrator.

Seen and unforeseen costs are a big concern as this is our first book.

Marshall and I ran an online business for 12 years - Michiganmall.com.  During that time, many unforeseen problems emerged - BUT, we handled each one as they arose.  

A Little About Us

Marshall is a man of many talents engineer, entrepreneur, musician. substitute teacher and now author and illustrator. WOW, I'm his wife, but I am impressed!

Janis is a survivor. Her first challenge began in 1977 with her onset of Multiple Sclerosis.  Another of her challenges is keeping Marshall on task.  However, with several other challenges during her life - she has never lost her smile or her sense of humor.

Marshall and Janis Rice (we) are a husband and wife team and work together 24/7. Sydney has become part of our life and we look forward to the day that Sydney is brought to life!  We do need your help and support to make this happen.  

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean that you can't help. You may join us and become a part of Sydney's adventure by sharing this project on social media. This will help spread the word and help us realize our funding goal.

And that's all there is to it.

Then, of course, a copy of Sydney, the book, autographed by the author and illustrator.
The Impact
To get Sydney off the ground we need to raise $5250. This will mostly cover editing, design, production and manufacturing as well as perks and shipping. Because Sydney is a dry erase board book, we have found the production costs of Sydney are more than the traditional children’s book.
Risks & Challenges
Our first challenge is making sure everyone understands Sydney. Sydney is not a cookie cutter book. Sydney is a magic erasable book - a "color and color again book". Sydney has no gender because gender does not determine one’s station in life!
That being said, finding a supplier was difficult, after several "no's" we found a supplier right here in Michigan, enabling us to promote Sydney as a Made In America book.
Our plans to date include making Sydney into a series of books from Ricecheks Books. Marshall is up for this challenge - as he is our illustrator.
Seen and unforeseen costs are a big concern as this is our first book.
Marshall and I ran an online business for 12 years - Michiganmall.com.  During that time, many unforeseen problems emerged - BUT, we handled each one as they arose.  
A Little About Us
Marshall is a man of many talents engineer, entrepreneur, musician. substitute teacher and now author and illustrator. WOW, I'm his wife, but I am impressed!
Janis is a survivor. Her first challenge began in 1977 with her onset of Multiple Sclerosis.  Another of her challenges is keeping Marshall on task.  However, with several other challenges during her life - she has never lost her smile or her sense of humor.
Marshall and Janis Rice (we) are a husband and wife team and work together 24/7. Sydney has become part of our life and we look forward to the day that Sydney is brought to life!  We do need your help and support to make this happen.  
Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean that you can't help. You may join us and become a part of Sydney's adventure by sharing this project on social media. This will help spread the word and help us realize our funding goal.
And that's all there is to it.

story:
THE GOAL

Wired Correspondence aims to be an independent and progressive online newsmagazine that will focus on crowd-sourced stories on under-reported social issues in the Philippines and elsewhere written in narrative, longform journalism.  We intend to extensively cover stories of people and communities whose struggles are left under-covered, unheard, or un-addressed by the governments or other institutions. But as a progressive publication, we focus less on what these institutions failed to do for them, rather focus more on what can still be done by you, me, the reader, and the other members of the community who have the capacity to alleviate their environment or situation, one way or another. We leave those hardcore investigations on bureaucratic irregularities to the mainstream media and other outlets that have far better resources.

Then again, it’s not all about the failures and struggles. We also want good stories that inspire and give hope. Besides, don’t we all want that?

So, we plan to feature stories of people who won life’s struggles in hopes of learning from them and sharing their lessons to others who, at one point in their lives, felt they were losing or have lost the game.

We also want to feature ordinary individuals who are contributing extraordinary work whether to their family or community—yes, the many unsung heroes in our society.

Our mission is straightforward: to help and inspire people through our storytelling, by producing content that targets the heart to feel and provokes the brain to act on it—in a good way.

We start all these in our own backyard, the Philippines, with a dream of pursuing elsewhere.

PAY IT FORWARD

Beyond publishing these stories, we believe in paying it forward, too, so we will offer free summer writing workshops to public schools around the Philippines. Every year, we will choose one school beneficiary for the free workshop to find, inspire, and train future writers and journalists. We will collaborate with colleagues in the media industry who are willing to share their experiences to these children.  

We believe that the written word has not lost its power: it was here, is here, and will be here until humanity stops reading, lest it loses its language. And there’s a need to perpetuate good writing of good stories for the good of humanity.

THE CREATORS

Wired Correspondence started as a personal project of Filipino freelance journalist, Lorela Sandoval, who has contributed reports—text, photos, and videos—to various media outlets in the Philippines and overseas, such as Entrepreneur (PH), BusinessWorld (PH), SecurityMatters (PH), Planet Philippines (key cities worldwide), Deutsche Welle News TV (Germany), and Iltalehti (Finland), among many others. She primarily covers women's issues as well as safety- and security-related stories. She also assists foreign media colleagues wanting to report from the Philippines. She divides her time between Manila and her hometown in the northern part of the Philippines. You may get to know more of her work at http://lorelasandoval.com

She pitched the idea sometime this year to her good friend and mentor, Adela “Deedee” Santa Cruz-Espina, who later joined her onboard as a co-creator. With her expertise and expansive experience in telling intuitive stories of people, places, and circumstances, Deedee is the perfect partner to bring the idea to life. She is a trained facilitator and speaker for both government and non-government organizations in the Philippines. She was online editor of Philippine Star's website (philstar.com) as well as editor at ABS-CBN Publishing Inc. and at the Journal Group of Publications. She continues to provide content for books, modules, and magazines, among others. She is based in Metro Manila.

 

CURRENT STATUS

Lorela kickstarted the website in September 2016, writing content during her free time while taking other writing gigs for a living. She took her time to plan and develop the idea. As soon as Deedee officially joined her onboard in May 2017, Lorela then hired two part-time writers to regularly produce content for the website. 

At the moment, the website is up at https://thewiredcorrespondence.com, publishing global news and features based on available press releases, online resources, and interviews to keep the site running until we reach our original mission. But the website is still far from that—because, clearly, we lack sufficient funding. 

We need your help in funding the website to further pursue our goals, bring more like-minded people to the team who share our objectives, and deliver the content we really want to write and want people to take time to read. We can only do this with the support of people like you who believe in independent longform journalism that is people-focused and has no political agenda or corporate ties.

But we can’t move forward with our mission without your pledges! 

CAMPAIGN: “Birthing Pains”

Our first campaign will need US$4,000 to cover expenses of the following:

  • Business legalities and documentation: We have yet to process the complete legal documents and we want to make sure everything is accounted for according to Philippines laws.
  • Salaries of current staff
  • Additional staff recruitment: We plan to hire a full-time editor, a part-time website developer, a part-time social media assistant, and part-time writers/contributors
  • Other miscellaneous expenses for editorial planning, website ugrades, and writing workshop materials for public schools

TIMELINE

The requested funds will cover our operations from the moment we complete this campaign. We know we can only move forward if this campaign is successful and we're counting on your help!

PERKS

For helping us, you get perks as stated on the right side of this campaign page.  Your contribution likewise helps the people who produce these handicrafts and items. Each donation definitely counts and forever be appreciated. 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

If by chance you won’t be able to donate, we would also appreciate your help in terms of sharing this campaign, whether through Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, or any other social media platform, to your family, friends, and colleagues who have the financial capability to support us. Help us reach out to as many people as you know around the world. Your help enables us to help others, too.  

Again, we are hoping and praying for your assistance. We rely on people like you who can make things possible, and for that, we’ll forever be grateful.

CONNECT WITH US

You may follow us through our social media accounts:

Facebook:/www.facebook.com/wiredcorrespondence/

Twitter: https://twitter.com/TheWiredCorresp

LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/wired-correspondence-media-2a5860143

 

Thank you and Godspeed,

Wired Correspondence Team

story:
Who Am I?

I've been a student of love all my life.

I believe the world is more loving when we care for the consciousness and heart in children and in ourselves.

When Cora asks, "What's the most loving thing to do?”, the answers show each of us how we too might be more loving in the world.

Books have always been a doorway into the world of my imagination and heart. I believe they can deeply touch our souls and cause us to reflect on our very foundation. That foundation for me is love.

As a professional actor, I was fascinated with what made people tick and what gave them joy.  The capacity to see patterns, and to love what makes others thrive, brought me to the world of intuitive coaching at WisdomRx.com with my beloved partner David.

In the gift of raising my two daughters, Shelley and Jessa, the spirit of 'Cora’ blossomed inside me once again.

I’ve always said I was going to write a 'children’s' book; at least a book for the inner child. And then one day, it just showed up. Now, I realize I’ve spent my lifetime preparing for it.

 

What is Not So Little Cora

A book for children ages 7-12 and young readers of all ages.

“Love is bigger than Big and knows just what to do.” Cora is a pure soul, in a little body, that sees the world through the eyes of love.

Cora is friends with many beings, both seen and unseen, and hasn't lost the capacity to be friends with fairies, aliens or the spirit of her grandpa after he dies. For Cora, every being and everything is inside the world of love.

Not So Little Cora is a bright star. She acts as a reminder for each of us that we too have a true north star within us.

Can you imagine who you would be if the roots of your soul had been allowed to fully blossom and you could live free?

That is the world that Cora and I support.

 

What I Need & What You Get

I’ve decided to self-publish Not So Little Cora. I believe it's the best way to stay true to my creative vision for this book. To turn this project into a reality, I need to raise $5000.

I currently live in Mexico. My wonderful team here is helping publish Cora in both English and Spanish. The English version will come first in the spring of 2019, with the second launch in Spanish happening in the fall of 2019.

Specifically, the money will go to the costs for Illustrations, Publishing costs, website, translation into Spanish, and (the biggie) marketing. I want to raise enough to launch my book into the world at full steam with book-signing events, an online presence, and much more.

The English version is already edited and ready to print once the illustrations are complete at the end of October. The Spanish translator is onboard to begin work, once I've secure the funds.

My Web developer is also onboard, ready to create the website.

The special Cora canvas Tote bag is already being custom embroidered in Mexico.

 

Risks & Challenges

If I don't reach my goal, Not So Little Cora will still come to fruition--it's already written, edited and (almost) ready to roll. But with your support the book will soar.

  • Although I've never published a book before, I've been writing my entire life. This book is a culmination of all my years of working with children and adults as an advocate for love.

     

    Other Ways You Can Help

    If you can't contribute right now, please consider sharing this campaign with others. Your help will truly spread the wingspan of this fundraising effort to ensure that this book reaches the public next spring!

    Most of all, as you go through your day, consider asking yourself as Cora does,

    “What’s the most loving thing to do?”
