Short Summary

"There are going to be two more volumes to this series and if they deliver on the same level as volume one then this is going to be one fantastic collection for any fan of horror, weird, or short fiction..." - STORGY review of The Shadow Booth: Vol. 1

Table of Contents

  • Buddy by Mark Morris
  • We are the Disease by Gareth E. Rees
  • Waves by Dan Grace
  • My Father’s Face by Giovanna Repetto
  • Ear to Ear by Aliya Whiteley
  • Feasting, Fasting by Anna Vaught
  • Keel by George Sandison
  • What to do When Your Child Brings Home a Mami Wata by Chikodili Emelumadu
  • Good Good Good, Nice Nice Nice by Kirsty Logan
  • Monkeys on the Beach by Ralph Robert Moore
  • Cave Venus et Stellas by Anna Vaught
  • The Joanne by Johnny Mains

Dan Coxon is an award-winning editor, author, copy-editor and proofreader. In 2016 he won Best Anthology at the Saboteur Awards, for Being Dad: Short Stories About Fatherhood. He runs his own editorial company, Momus Editorial, and has worked for numerous publishers and authors in the past, including Titan Books, Urbane Publications, Unsung Stories, Influx Press and Dodo Ink. He is also a Contributing Editor at The Lonely Crowd, and has previously edited Litro magazine.

If you're interested in the concept behind The Shadow Booth, and the books that inspired it, read Dan's short essay on the subject here: Face the Strange: A Case for the Weird and the Eerie

The Impact

One of the aims of the journal is to reward the people who really deserve it - the writers. Yes, there are other costs involved in producing and distributing any book or magazine, but it's our belief that these should be outweighed by the authors' right to get paid for their work. It's one of the reasons we're crowdfunding - to ensure that the authors of these wonderful stories receive reasonable payment. Paid markets are becoming increasingly rare and it's a trend that we'd like to see reversed.

We have factored in the costs involved in printing, layout, proofreading, distribution and the production of the other rewards, and already have those covered. The funds raised here will provide payment for the authors, and will also help build the journal for the future - ensuring that we manage to bring out Volume 3 later this year!

Risks & Challenges

There shouldn't be many risks still associated with this project. The stories are already selected, and have all been handed in - so that lineup is final. The printing company is on standby. The design/layout team are ready to go. We just need the money to make it work.

As has already been said, most of the money raised here will go to the authors, so you know that you're helping support the people who deserve it most. The rest of the money will go towards Volume 3, due later this year.

Delivery for Vol. 2 is expected to be June 2018.

Other Ways You Can Help

The louder people shout about this, the more successful it will be. So please, please - if you're excited by The Shadow Booth, tell people about it! We're on Twitter and Facebook.

We will also be looking for reviewers, so if you run your own books blog or write reviews for a website, get in touch.

story:
About the project:

The Book

Movement is Life—Dance our birthright.

In 1986 Leslie Zehr returned to Egypt, the ancient motherland, to be fed and seeded from the Source. There she encountered the mysterious Serpent Goddess who taught her the ancient Sacred Dance.

In this book, the author takes us on that archetypal journey through the Tarot to the Universal Dancer, the Gold—accessing, through the Dance, the power held in ‘the field’. She has taught hundreds of women how to Dance the primordial Dance of the Serpent Goddess by reconnecting the sexual/spiritual aspects within themselves.

Let The Alchemy of Dance: Sacred Dance as a Path to the Universal Dancer open the door to the mystical Dance of the Serpent Goddess.

El Libro:

El Movimiento es Vida – El Baile es nuestro derecho.

En 1986 Leslie Zehr regreso a Egipto, la patria antigua, para recibir de la Fuente el alimento y la semilla.  Ahí ella se encontró con la misteriosa Diosa Serpiente quien le enseño a ella el antiguo Baile Sagrado.

En este libro, la autora nos lleva en un viaje arquetípico del Tarot a la Bailarina Universal, el Oro – accediendo, a través del Baile, el poder contenido en el “campo”. Ella ha enseñado a cientos de mujeres como Bailar el Baile primordial de la Diosa Serpiente reconectando los aspectos sexuales / espirituales en ellas.

Permite que La Alquimia del Baile: El Baile Sagrado como un Camino hacia la Bailarina Universal habrá la puerta hacia el Baile místico de la Diosa Serpiente.

The Author:

Leslie Zehr is a sacred arts teacher, mentor and ‘mid-wife’ to those on a spiritual path. She lives in Egypt, where she spent twenty years serving the goddess Hat-hor in a modern day temple in Cairo. She is the author of The Alchemy of Dance and The Al-chemia Remedies.

See full bio.

La Autora:

Leslie Zehr es una maestra de las artes sagradas, es un mentor y ‘co-madre’ para los que están en el sendero espiritual.  Ella vive en Egipto, donde paso veinte años sirviendo a la diosa Hat-hor en un templo moderno en El Cairo. Ella es la autora de La Alquimia del Baile: El Baile Sagrado como un Camino hacia la Bailarina Universal y Los Remedios Al-quimia.

La Traductora:

El Viaje de Alexandra Sánchez

Mi don por la traducción empezó a una muy temprana edad.  Recuerdo uno de los juegos de mi niñez era practicar hablar en inglés y en francés.  Siendo aún una niña, yo traducía del inglés al español tarjetas de cumpleaños o de días festivos para que mi madre las enviase a sus parientes en Sud América.   Esta pasión por la fluidez, ya sea de idioma a idioma o de cultura a cultura incorpora muchas formas de expresión.

La primera vez que conocí a Leslie Zehr fue en la ciudad de Nueva York.  Tomé sus clases y leí varias veces su libro The Alchemy of Dance.  Yo he tenido el placer de Bailar con Leslie en Nueva York y en el Cairo.

En el Cairo, Leslie fue testigo de como yo me rendí a la fluidez de la vida. Yo tuve la experiencia como la que Leslie describe en su libro, “¡Si quieres tener la experiencia de la Bailarina Universal ven a Egipto! Todo cambia segundo a segundo.”

Yo tuve maravillosas aventuras en mi viaje a través de Egipto.  Algunas de mis experiencias en este país de piedras y desierto, invocaron en mí, los recuerdos de mi niñez, de los volcanes y montañas Andinas, del origen de mi país.  La amplia vida palpitante de ambos países, con sus contrastadas topografías, culturas e historia, se sentían unificados en mí.

Instintivamente yo quise traducir el libro de Leslie. Quise traducirlo para mi madre y para todas las personas como ella.  Sabía que ella disfrutaría y se beneficiaria de leer The Alchemy of Dance en español.  Es mi deseo que los lectores de todos los rincones del mundo que leen en español se unan a nuestro viaje.

 

What We Need & What You Get

What do we need?

The manuscript is completed, translated, edited and uploaded.  The cover is being designed now. As soon as the cover is completed and approved it will be uploaded and we will begin the production phase. All we need to do is print the book and get it out there!

This project has been a labor of Love for both Alexandra and myself but there are always real world expenses, and that is where we need help.

The break down of expenses is below.

Where does the money go?

$675   Publishing services (including cover design, proofing and 1st order of books)

$275   Perks and fees

$950   TOTAL

What will you get in return for your contribution?

Coming soon

 

The Impact

"Leslie Zehr brings the feminine sacred arts to life in her magical book "The Alchemy of Dance." This book is a must read for any woman who wants to know how to move the subtle energies of creation through the body with dance. I've highlighted and worked with each aspect of this book and love the information and insights I've gained. Thank you for writing it, Leslie!"—Lisa Michaels author of Natural Rhythms: A Sacred Guide into Nature’s Creation Secrets

“Baile sagrado. Ese movimiento que te conecta con algo que conoces desde la profundidad de tu alma. Desde el primer momento sabes que no es la primera vez que lo bailas. Aunque estés bailando sola te sientes conectada con las mujeres de tu tribu. Flotas en esa energía que define lo femenino. Venus. Mujeres alrededor de un fuego. Y quieres quedarte allí. Sintiendo. Sabiendo.”—Dagmar Bock

"I'm anything but objective about the work of Leslie Zehr. She has been a beloved mentor and friend ever since I first visited Cairo, and gave me one of the most useful teachings I've ever heard: "This is the country of the River. Give up and go where she wants to take you, and it gets easier. Try to swim against the current . . ." -- and the rest did not have to be said. As the years have passed since 2003, her words have seemed to apply to almost everything: exchanges and interactions with people, communications with the Moon, Mother Earth, the Andean plant teachers and other Divine medicine, and with the flow of healing energy through all the bodies of my own consciousness.
Leslie is uniquely qualified to write not only about dance, but specifically about the Alchemy of it. The word comes from Khemt, the ancient word that the people of the Black Land by the Nile called their country before it became more widely known under its Greek name, "Egypt." She was initiated as a Priestess at the Temple of Hathor at Dendera, has channeled and created the Egyptian Flower Remedies read more..."—Dan Furst author of Finding Your  Best Places: Using Astrocartography to Navigate Your Life Map, Surfing Aquarius: How to Ace the Wave of Change and Dance of the Moon: Celebrating the Sacred Cycles of the Earth

"Por algunas semanas he estado pensando cómo poner en palabras que expresen mi experiencia con Leslie en sus talleres, tanto presenciales como en línea; en sus sesiones individuales y en los círculos de sonido y de mujeres. Conocí a Leslie en Egipto, en una tierra en la cual jamás me imaginé vivir, pero a la cual mi propio camino de sanación directamente me llevó. Las enseñanzas de Leslie fueron como un faro en días en los cuales buscaba respuestas; así ella me brindó su luz para alumbrar cosas que jamás había considerado antes. Sus enseñanzas podrán parecer místicas y complejas, demasiado profundas, sin embargo, son tan simples. Simpleza que no puede comprenderse hasta comenzar a fluir con los movimientos que ella te enseña. Y una vez eres capaz de fluir, entonces sientes que estas viva y te das cuenta que sus enseñanzas van más allá de las palabras hasta tu alma. Y al final de la clase podrías pensar que no has sentido nada o que no has podido tomar mucho de lo que acaba de acontecer, pero permanece segura que vendrá el día que de repente recordarás. Y así para mí a través de los años, sus palabras vuelven a mí cuando más las necesito. Profundamente aprecio y respeto el trabajo de Leslie porque fluye así como su danza, en espirales. Arriba y abajo, con movimientos que quizás al principio no sabes hacer pero que de repente emergen con información de dentro de ti y comienzas a descubrir un mundo que no habías vislumbrado jamás; y todo gracias a las perspectivas diferentes que ella sabiamente inculca en cada estudiante. Entusiásticamente espero por esta traducción al español del trabajo de Leslie, de forma que otras mujeres de habla hispana como yo puedan abrazar y hacer suyas estas enseñanzas, tal como lo hice yo. Gracias Leslie por hacer posible todo esto". —Maricel ~ Maridhavi de SanandaShakti. In English

"After reading this book I felt inspired to dance around the room, encouraged by the book’s message to reclaim this ancient art form. It is quite a liberating experience, to play some favourite music and dance with yourself, connect with your inner being. Leslie Zehr writes about dance in an original way, showing us that dance can reconnect us with the universe, as we move to higher energy forms—this experience she calls Sacred Dance. Leslie Zehr runs the Centre for Sacred Arts in Cairo , where she teaches her unique method of dance to young and old. Dance is shown to be a mystical experience as we learn to dance from within, channeling movement, positive energies and discharging negativity. Leslie gives examples of how to achieve this: see yourself connected to the earth, moving through the four elements, in four directions through space; your feet grounded in the earth, your crown reaching to the heavens. I love the way the book links this journey with the chakras, tarot cards and alchemy—dance as a form of transmutation, an awakening. I began to see my body as a mini universe, transmitting energy, rhythmic waves, and channeling it outwards. Through her in-depth knowledge, the author calls us back to our ancient ancestors, when we used to dance ourselves into a trance, feeling a sense of oneness. The book reminds us of our dance heritage, especially women, who once danced for the Goddess, celebrating the divine feminine. You don’t have to be a ‘dancer’ to experience this, you just have to allow your body to find its own rhythm and let yourself go, allow the energy to flow through you like water. The Alchemy of Dance shows us how to regain our deeper selves and feel a greater connection with the life-force, moving in harmony with the universe."—Yvonne Harlech author of Mistress of the Temple and Harp of Joy

"Sentir los diferentes aliados de poder en con la Alquimia de la danza de Leslie es una experiencia inolvidable."—Abjini Arráiz

Read more reviews...

 

Risks & Challenges

The manuscript is ready for publication. It has been translated, formatted and uploaded. The project is in the last phase, the production phase.

This is Leslie’s third book. She has been through the process before and knows what to expect and what is needed from her. She also has a lot of experience in the promoting of a book post-publication having done it before.

As soon as the campaign is finished the book will be printed for hardcopy proofing (seeing what it actually looks like printed).

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you don’t have money to contribute to the project we hope you will still join in our efforts to get this book published by getting the word out. Please share with your friends on social media and with people who you feel would be interested in this project. Let the flowers be heard!

Indiegogo makes it easy with their share tools!

Quise traducirlo para mi madre y para todas las personas como ella.  Sabía que ella disfrutaría y se beneficiaria de leer The Alchemy of Dance en español.  Es mi deseo que los lectores de todos los rincones del mundo que leen en español se unan a nuestro viaje.

 
What We Need & What You Get
What do we need?
The manuscript is completed, translated, edited and uploaded.  The cover is being designed now. As soon as the cover is completed and approved it will be uploaded and we will begin the production phase. All we need to do is print the book and get it out there!
This project has been a labor of Love for both Alexandra and myself but there are always real world expenses, and that is where we need help.
The break down of expenses is below.
Where does the money go?
$675   Publishing services (including cover design, proofing and 1st order of books)
$275   Perks and fees
$950   TOTAL
What will you get in return for your contribution? 
Coming soon

 
The Impact
"Leslie Zehr brings the feminine sacred arts to life in her magical book "The Alchemy of Dance." This book is a must read for any woman who wants to know how to move the subtle energies of creation through the body with dance. I've highlighted and worked with each aspect of this book and love the information and insights I've gained. Thank you for writing it, Leslie!"—Lisa Michaels author of Natural Rhythms: A Sacred Guide into Nature’s Creation Secrets
“Baile sagrado. Ese movimiento que te conecta con algo que conoces desde la profundidad de tu alma. Desde el primer momento sabes que no es la primera vez que lo bailas. Aunque estés bailando sola te sientes conectada con las mujeres de tu tribu. Flotas en esa energía que define lo femenino. Venus. Mujeres alrededor de un fuego. Y quieres quedarte allí. Sintiendo. Sabiendo.”—Dagmar Bock
"I'm anything but objective about the work of Leslie Zehr. She has been a beloved mentor and friend ever since I first visited Cairo, and gave me one of the most useful teachings I've ever heard: "This is the country of the River. Give up and go where she wants to take you, and it gets easier. Try to swim against the current . . ." -- and the rest did not have to be said. As the years have passed since 2003, her words have seemed to apply to almost everything: exchanges and interactions with people, communications with the Moon, Mother Earth, the Andean plant teachers and other Divine medicine, and with the flow of healing energy through all the bodies of my own consciousness.Leslie is uniquely qualified to write not only about dance, but specifically about the Alchemy of it. The word comes from Khemt, the ancient word that the people of the Black Land by the Nile called their country before it became more widely known under its Greek name, "Egypt." She was initiated as a Priestess at the Temple of Hathor at Dendera, has channeled and created the Egyptian Flower Remedies read more..."—Dan Furst author of Finding Your  Best Places: Using Astrocartography to Navigate Your Life Map, Surfing Aquarius: How to Ace the Wave of Change and Dance of the Moon: Celebrating the Sacred Cycles of the Earth
"Por algunas semanas he estado pensando cómo poner en palabras que expresen mi experiencia con Leslie en sus talleres, tanto presenciales como en línea; en sus sesiones individuales y en los círculos de sonido y de mujeres. Conocí a Leslie en Egipto, en una tierra en la cual jamás me imaginé vivir, pero a la cual mi propio camino de sanación directamente me llevó. Las enseñanzas de Leslie fueron como un faro en días en los cuales buscaba respuestas; así ella me brindó su luz para alumbrar cosas que jamás había considerado antes. Sus enseñanzas podrán parecer místicas y complejas, demasiado profundas, sin embargo, son tan simples. Simpleza que no puede comprenderse hasta comenzar a fluir con los movimientos que ella te enseña. Y una vez eres capaz de fluir, entonces sientes que estas viva y te das cuenta que sus enseñanzas van más allá de las palabras hasta tu alma. Y al final de la clase podrías pensar que no has sentido nada o que no has podido tomar mucho de lo que acaba de acontecer, pero permanece segura que vendrá el día que de repente recordarás. Y así para mí a través de los años, sus palabras vuelven a mí cuando más las necesito. Profundamente aprecio y respeto el trabajo de Leslie porque fluye así como su danza, en espirales. Arriba y abajo, con movimientos que quizás al principio no sabes hacer pero que de repente emergen con información de dentro de ti y comienzas a descubrir un mundo que no habías vislumbrado jamás; y todo gracias a las perspectivas diferentes que ella sabiamente inculca en cada estudiante. Entusiásticamente espero por esta traducción al español del trabajo de Leslie, de forma que otras mujeres de habla hispana como yo puedan abrazar y hacer suyas estas enseñanzas, tal como lo hice yo. Gracias Leslie por hacer posible todo esto". —Maricel ~ Maridhavi de SanandaShakti. In English
"After reading this book I felt inspired to dance around the room, encouraged by the book’s message to reclaim this ancient art form. It is quite a liberating experience, to play some favourite music and dance with yourself, connect with your inner being. Leslie Zehr writes about dance in an original way, showing us that dance can reconnect us with the universe, as we move to higher energy forms—this experience she calls Sacred Dance. Leslie Zehr runs the Centre for Sacred Arts in Cairo , where she teaches her unique method of dance to young and old. Dance is shown to be a mystical experience as we learn to dance from within, channeling movement, positive energies and discharging negativity. Leslie gives examples of how to achieve this: see yourself connected to the earth, moving through the four elements, in four directions through space; your feet grounded in the earth, your crown reaching to the heavens. I love the way the book links this journey with the chakras, tarot cards and alchemy—dance as a form of transmutation, an awakening. I began to see my body as a mini universe, transmitting energy, rhythmic waves, and channeling it outwards. Through her in-depth knowledge, the author calls us back to our ancient ancestors, when we used to dance ourselves into a trance, feeling a sense of oneness. The book reminds us of our dance heritage, especially women, who once danced for the Goddess, celebrating the divine feminine. You don’t have to be a ‘dancer’ to experience this, you just have to allow your body to find its own rhythm and let yourself go, allow the energy to flow through you like water. The Alchemy of Dance shows us how to regain our deeper selves and feel a greater connection with the life-force, moving in harmony with the universe."—Yvonne Harlech author of Mistress of the Temple and Harp of Joy
"Sentir los diferentes aliados de poder en con la Alquimia de la danza de Leslie es una experiencia inolvidable."—Abjini Arráiz
Read more reviews...

 
Risks & Challenges
The manuscript is ready for publication. It has been translated, formatted and uploaded. The project is in the last phase, the production phase.
This is Leslie’s third book. She has been through the process before and knows what to expect and what is needed from her. She also has a lot of experience in the promoting of a book post-publication having done it before.
As soon as the campaign is finished the book will be printed for hardcopy proofing (seeing what it actually looks like printed).

 
Other Ways You Can Help
If you don’t have money to contribute to the project we hope you will still join in our efforts to get this book published by getting the word out. Please share with your friends on social media and with people who you feel would be interested in this project. Let the flowers be heard!
Indiegogo makes it easy with their share tools!

story:
**When selecting your perk, make sure you include your email address so I can get the details for your custom pet doodles and portraits! You can email me at cirylxd@gmail.com or message me at @cirylxd or @theturtlewhowantedtofly on Instagram!**

**I'm trying to make the process of this book as interactive and personal as possible. That being said, if you want mass-produced perks NOW, this probably isn't the project for you. Read on if you want CUSTOM, HAND-DRAWN prizes and want to make an impact on my first book!**

About Me

Hello, all! My name is Kayla, and I'm a young, multitalented artist. I'm best known for my pet portraits and cartoony illustrations on my Instagram page, @cirylxd, and elsewhere on social media. I recently graduated from the University of Wisconsin-Whitewater with a degree in Graphic Design, and now I'm striving to find creative meaning in my adult life. I also run an art booth and play the clarinet in community band, and I am an avid plant and reptile keeper.

My work is usually best described as cute, fantastical, and funny. Since early childhood I've been most interested in exploring nature and the behavior of animals, especially as related to life lessons and compelling stories.

My digital illustration of one of my pets, Ketzel the crested gecko

 

Project Overview

The Turtle who Wanted to Fly is about a highly-ambitious turtle, Tiptoe, as he experiences frustration and longing while trying to make his latest dream a reality. I wrote the first draft in a high school creative writing class, but it was always more than a grade to me. In a lot of ways, I do see myself and my friends in Tiptoe: eagerly rushing through his work, failing, drawing inspiration from his friend Dusty, learning to be patient with his progress, and trying again. It was the type of story I needed as a kid, and, I hope, the type of story that other children might need. 

A very old cover concept, drawn back in high school when I was writing the first draft. Look at that improvement!

 

My classmates encouraged me to continue the project, and ever since- between jobs and higher education and life events- I have been working on it so quietly. Along the way I realized that the book is, in a way, a story about itself. Its completion is like my set of turtle wings.

 It's about 90% finished now, with approximately 34 pages completely written and beautifully illustrated in mixed media. The last 10% is the hardest: getting it published and noticed, and that's where I need you.

The Funding Breakdown

In the most beautiful, perfect world, I would hope to raise $800 for this project. Here's how I came up with that number:

  • Approximately $300 to purchase the ISBNs (basically unique "social security numbers" that every book needs in order to be discovered and sold) for the paperback, hardcover, and digital versions.
  • $100 to apply for entry into the Library of Congress and libraries around the US.
  • $35 to apply for a copyright, so my work and characters are protected.
  • $100 as the base fee for the publishing service I am using.
  • Then, the rest of the budget would go to the creation and shipping of perks for backers.

If We Don't Reach My Funding Goal:

In the event that we fall short of what I need, I plan to fund the rest with earnings from my art booth, online print shop, and pet portrait commissions. I'm intensely dedicated to this project and won't let a little pitfall end it. However, yes, it will surely take longer to finish this way. 

Stretch Goal

If we raise money beyond the initial goal, I would like to develop a website and more merch specific to the book. At $1000, I can work on getting you new poster and sticker designs. Pillows, pins, and even plushies may become options at around $1500.

Another thing I might like to do if resources and backers allow is to redraw a couple of my older pages. I think they're great already, but an artist is never satisfied, are they?

Also considering adding a couple pages featuring the journey of the book, like early sketches, character designs, and storyboards. Perhaps a page thanking my backers by putting their names in the book, if that interests anybody.

Early reference for Tiptoe's design

The Perks

Any amount makes an enormous difference to me personally, so I wanted to make the perks personal too.

  • Smiling Ladybugs ($15) - A custom DIGITAL doodle of your pet emailed to you. Does not have any shipping costs!!!
  • Dancing Ducks ($20) - A custom doodle of your pet or character, along with two character stickers from the book

A An example pet doodle

  • Painting Frogs ($45) - A signed paperback copy of the book, a custom doodle of your pet or character, two character stickers from the book
  • Racing Rabbits ($75) - A signed and doodled-in hardcover copy of the book, a custom doodle of your pet or character, two character stickers from the book
  • Singing Eagles ($100) - A signed and doodled-in hardcover copy of the book, a fully colored custom pet or character portrait, two character stickers from the book

A portrait example

  • Flying Turtles ($150) - A signed and doodled-in hardcover copy of the book, two fully colored custom pet or character portraits, two character stickers from the book
  • Ninja Geckos - Possible secret perks available to social media followers. ;)

Custom drawings will be started ASAP after ordering. Patience will be required as I'm making them all myself and by hand. So if I get a lot of backers... it will take a lot of time.  I'm more than happy to keep you updated via email, message, or social media. Book copies will be sent after the first print run (watch for updates).

The Impact

The Turtle who Wanted to Fly is my greatest dream, and by contributing you become a permanent point of light in my life. With this book, I also aim to spark imagination and self-confidence in young readers. It is my hope that they'll remember the story during times of stress, art block, creative frustration, and so on.

A promotional image depicting Dusty and Tiptoe, created by an Internet friend, @chaddieeeeee on Instagram

 

Risks & Challenges

As the book is already written, illustrated, and in its publishing phase, most of the hurdles have finally been cleared. Final things I'm looking out for are errors in publication and files, which are easily fixed with some patience. I would say the biggest challenge would be getting everything out to backers as quickly as possible, as many of the perks have to be hand-drawn by me. For that, please check back for frequent updates. I'm also happy to start a mailing list and reach out in other ways. You can also follow my Instagram, @cirylxd

Other Ways You Can Help

You don't have to purchase a perk to be a blessing to this project. Even giving a few dollars helps more than you know, and there are free ways to get in on the action too!

If Indiegogo isn't right for you, I will also be accepting donations and my normal commissions via PayPal. I also sell prints and stickers on my website, http://www.kaylaglaserart.net

For now, ALL proceeds from ALL my products will be going toward this project.

If you cannot support this financially, don't sweat it. :) Sharing this link, my website, or my Instagram in any way you can would still be immensely appreciated.

Thank you, thank you, thank you!

story:
The END of EVERYTHING

 

About a year ago, we moved from the city to an off grid homestead in the middle of the desert. I also decided that I didn’t need to be on my anti-depressants any longer. This book of poetry chronicles my crash and my struggle to fight my mental illness on my own and failing. Finally, coming to the conclusion that it would be better for everyone if I was back on them. 

 

If you have mental illness or know someone who does, then you know how real the struggle is and how heartbreaking it can be to lose that fight. 

 

I didn’t write this book to necessarily help anyone, I just wrote to help me. Hopefully, that is good enough. 

 

I hate asking people for money. The older I get the harder it is to do it. With that said, here’s the spiel of where the cash goes. 

 

Everything that I make on this will go to the cost of printing the 100 page books and getting them shipped to me so I can sign them and ship them to you. That’s it. 

 

I have perks including an audiobook version, your name in the book, and even me coming out for a reading or talk about my experience crowdfunding. Every tier will get the signed paperback and ebook.

 

I have some really fun ideas for stretch goals, but let’s cross that bridge when we come to it. 

 

Mental illness is real and is no joke. I hope this book can help people see how human this problem is and how many people are effected by it, whether they have mental illness or someone close to them does. 

 

If you want to read more of my stuff, you can visit my website at www.ihatemattwall.com

 

If you can’t contribute financially, that doesn’t mean that you can’t help.

 

Please share this page by using the share tools and let people know about it.

 

I really appreciate the support. 

 

If you have any questions, just let me know.

story:
Summary

Hi, I'm Ruby Kandah.

 

I've worked as an engineer at NASA Johnson Space Center, as Director of Business Applications at Doordash, as Director of Product at Salesforce and now lead a Salesforce implementation company, CloudX.

 

My journey of switching careers in the world of technology, more specifically, the world of "CRM" (customer relationship management) software has been unique. I've gone from an entry-level position in the tech sector to a director level at the hottest growing startup (Doordash) in 2 years. Additionally,  I've become a thought-leader in building excellent customer support experiences, identifying most growable customers, and building conversational AI frameworks.

 

With these experiences in hand, I've crafted a book that every business leader should own.  "Cash Cloud" reorients your thinking to focus on the customer and provides helpful diagrams, examples, learnings and tips for how to build lifelong relationships with your customers through cloud technology. After reading this book, you will know how to make the cloud rain with long term revenue and customer satisfaction.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • We don't need funding to write the book. 
  • This campaign is entirely for pre-ordering the book.
  • All of your proceeds go towards printing and shipping the book once we finalize the manuscript. 

The Impact

  • 60% of CRM projects fail. I wrote this book to help your CRM projects become successful.
  • 75% of executives don't know how to bring AI to their company. I wrote this book to help you cross this chasm. 
  • 80% of CEOs believe they deliver a superior customer experience but only 8% of their customers agree. I wrote this book to prevent you from getting blindsided by customer churn. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you're unable to pre-order the book, please help to spread the word by sharing this link broadly. Thank you!

story:
Café Pyt har brug for din hjælp - ellers lukker vi!

 

Café Pyt & De Uafhængige Forlags Boghandel er hårdt ramt af Corona - og desværre kan vi ikke få dækket vores faste udgifter fra kompensationspuljerne. Derfor må vi lukke, hvis ikke vi kan rejse penge på en anden måde. Vil du hjælpe?


Hvad er Café Pyt & De Uafhængige Forlags Boghandel?

Cafe Pyt er en lokal café i Sydhavnen startet af forfatter og forlægger Bjørn Themsen og hans kæreste Melanie Baumann  i 2019.

Udover økologisk kaffe, tjekkisk øl og koldt køkken huser caféen Danmarks største udvalg af udgivelser fra uafhængige skønlitterære danske kvalitetsforlag. 

Ved siden af vores daglige Café- og boghandelvirksomhed holder vi mange arrangementer.

Hver måned har vi fx haft Jazz & Tapas med P8 vært Jens Rasmussen, som har trukket folk til fra et stort opland.

Hver måned har vi haft oplæsningsaftner, forlagspræsentationer eller debataftner med forfattere og kunstnere som Morten Søndergaard, Asger Schnack og Anders Bonnesen.

Vi har også huset sammenkomster for Dansk/Svensk Forfattersammenslutning, dannet ramme om møder for de uafhængige forlags netboghandel, Mikrofest, og Poesiens Hus og andre. Café Pyt er også mange mindre forlags foretrukne sted at holde reception i forbindelse med bogudgivelser.

Under Corona-lukningen var vi de første til at lave Litterære Livestreams, og i halvanden måned havde vi en lang perlerække af forfattere inde og læse op hver dag kl. 15.


HVORFOR HAR PYT BRUG FOR PENGE?

Kort fortalt: Corona-udbruddet knækkede en i forvejen skrøbelig økonomi. Café Pyt er, og har fra begyndelsen været, en idealistisk humlebi, som ikke burde kunne flyve. Det er ikke nemt at drive kulturel virksomhed i Danmark, og det er ikke nemt at starte en lille café op i et “nyt” kvarter, men før Corona var Pyt langsomt vej til at nå en nulpunktsomsætning, hvor selve driften hvilede i sig selv.  

Så kom Corona, og desværre kan Pyt kun få dækket ca. en tredjedel af de faste omkostninger fra Corona-kompensationspuljerne. Årsagen er, at vi har haft underskud i 2019. Café Pyt åbnede i et eksisterende selskab, hvor der tidligere kun har været forlagsdrift, nemlig forlaget Fuglekøjen, som aldrig har givet eller skullet give, overskud, og det betyder, at de 4 første måneder af 2019 var der intet overskud. Dernæst har der været store opstartsomkostninger, og der er også begået fodfejl, mens vi lærte at drive café og boghandel. Summa summarum: Vi har et samlet underskud i 2019, og derfor kan vi ikke få dækket vores faste omkostninger af Corona Puljerne. 

HVAD SKAL PENGENE BRUGES TIL?

I skrivende stund er Pyt Lukket helt ned; køleskabe og frysere er tømt og slukket for at spare på strømmen. Hvis vi når kampagnemålet skal vi derfor bruge 20.000 blot til at fylde vores lager op igen. Dernæst skal vi betale husleje og leasing bagud og forud, som vi ikke har fået dækket af Corona-kompensationsordningerne. Og så skal kassekreditten nedbringes, så vi har lidt luft at arbejde med - 200.000 kr.  er altså absolut minimum for at åbne lokalerne igen.

HVAD ER DET LANGSIGTEDE MÅL?

Vi har hele tiden haft blikket stift rettet mod 2024, hvor metroen åbner 50 meter væk fra Café Pyt. Når Metrohegnet bliver fjernet forventer vi en massiv stigning i den gående trafik forbi Pyt - og meget lettere adgang til fx vores arrangementer. Og i 2020 er det (eller var det - lige nu er det uafklaret) meningen, at hele Borgbjergsvej skulle have et løft med nye træer, omlægning af vejen mm., som bl.a. vil give Caféen større og bedre udeserveringsplads. Sydhavnen er et kvarter i rivende udvikling, og der vil være brug for gode caféer og kultursteder.

SPRED ORDET

Hvis denne kampagne skal lykkes, så er det ikke nok, at vores lokale stamkunder og byens litteraturinteresserede bidrager - kampagnen skal nå længere og bredere ud. Så udover at give et bidrag kan du gøre en kæmpe forskel ved at fortælle andre om vores kampagne på alle de platforme du kan. Tak!

story:
Summary

Marie Sumnicht's daughter, Julia Sumnicht was an ambitious 21-year-old at the University of Wisconsin La Crosse when her lofty dreams and life would end abruptly on March 15, 2010. Julia's mysterious death during her spring break in Miami Beach, Florida, left unanswered questions and her family devastated.

Investigative findings would point circumstantial evidence to two suspects who were with Julia in her last hours.

Faced with injustice and one challenge after another, Julia's mother, Marie Sumnicht, would not be deterred in her search for resolution. A soul-searching journey would lead Marie through the depths of despair and toward a place of healing she never thought possible.

Marie's mission was solidified after constant disappointment and overcoming her own depression. 

Her personal growth was a catalyst for authoring "Beyond Broken" and creating a guide for others like her who were lost and in need of hope.

And that is why she created the "100 Day Journey to Living Beyond Broken" journal.

 

100 Day Journey to Living Beyond Broken Mission

• To empower those affected by the aftermath of loss and provide a roadmap of life truths.

• To transform through daily journal activities that create stability and purpose despite loss.

• To provide additional support channels through direct coaching from Marie who has thrived beyond issues affecting the bereaved.

 

Marie's Message

Too many of us are stuck in a life we weren't meant to live. I know because I experienced a tragedy that tried to hold me back from the breakthrough towards to a better life.

For over five years, I lived with the chains of despair and negativity holding me back from experiencing joy and peace. I was at the "bottom of the bottom", feeling like I had no place to turn.  In an unexpected turn of events, I discovered a process that ultimately gave me freedom. I invite you today to experience this same freedom with my journal.

I am a person of faith that had always believed things happen in life for a reason. When a crisis came along that shattered my faith, I felt like a child learning to walk or speak for the first time. I had trouble connecting the life-shattering situation with my faith. Even though I knew logically that other people had experienced such tragedies in their lives, searing pain and feelings of guilt took over every part of my being. 

Once I started experiencing peace and hope, I wanted to share it with others. I did so first with a book called Beyond Broken: Surviving and Thriving Beyond the Death of a Child.  

Even though my book is a powerful story of hope, I realized that people stuck in hopelessness needed to know the path I took to freedom and how they could experience change. With this in mind, I created a 100 Days to Living Beyond Broken journal. 

What I have shared has changed lives, just as my life was changed. With your donation and support or with your purchase of a journal and bonus packages, you will be helping impact 1000's of lives.

Thank you for any and all of your support!

P.S. Please spread the word about this campaign and assist in impacting 1000's of lives!

 

Who is Marie Sumnicht?

  • I am a wife and a mother of four children, one of whom has gone to her heavenly home.  I am an educator, entrepreneur, and author. For most of my life, I have been an avid athlete - mostly as a runner and skier - and an outdoor enthusiast.

 

Your donation and support will impact lives

  • Thank you for purchasing one of several packages I have specially prepared for you or as a gift for others. If you donated - thank you! Extra donations are greatly appreciated and will be used for printing more journals.

  • Your purchase and or donation will make a significant impact on a misunderstood and hurting group of people. 

  • Our funding goal will help offset the cost of creating, publishing and marketing the journal. Donations beyond our funding goal will fund journals that will be donated to people in need.

 

 

100 Day Journey to Living Beyond Broken Journal

I believe my journal is a unique tool to help people who feel "stuck" in negative thought patterns due to painful experiences. Journal users are encouraged daily to read, write and apply content to bring about positive change in their lives.

As a result of a greater vision after going through personal tragedies and injustice, Marie believes her purpose is to share her message and personal discoveries with the world.

We are excited to share this journal to inspire and impact you on your journey.

Journal features:

  • Receive daily life changing steps to discovering a greater purpose.
  • Morning and evening entries will transform how you experience your days.
  • EGGS (Exercise, Goals, Grateful for, Smile today) will round out your evenings.
  • An exclusive book list resource is included.

 

 

BONUS PACKAGES

​EARLY BIRD BONUS (FEATURED PERK)

Pre-order the exclusive "Early Bird Bonus" that includes "100 Day Journey to Living Beyond Broken" journal at a discounted price plus more.

Receive the "100 Day Journey to Living Beyond Broken" journal. Includes 100 days of daily guided action steps that will bring impact as Marie Sumnicht and others have received. 

As a bonus, you receive one complimentary  1 on 1, 30-minute coaching call with Marie Sumnicht and also have access to a support facebook group with others.

(*Complimentary coaching phone call must be within the first 30 days after receiving your 100 Day Journey to Living Beyond Broken journal.)

 

LET GO LET GOD BONUS 1

The bookmark and refrigerator magnet are great reminders to "Let Go and Let God".

 

LET GO LET GOD BONUS 2

Beyond Broken book, refrigerator magnet and a beautiful bookmark - are great reminders to "Let Go (of guilt, fear, etc.) and Let God (humility assurance, faith,etc.)"  All three make great gifts.

 

LET GO LET GOD BONUS 3

Receive the "100 Day Journey to Living Beyond Broken" journal and a beautiful "Let go Let God" candle that reflects God's light as it burns.

 

LET GO LET GOD BONUS 4

Receive the "100 Day Journey to Living Beyond Broken" journal and the Beyond Broken book, beautiful "Let Go Let God" bookmark, reminding you to "Let Go Let God".

 

 

BEYOND BROKEN BUNDLE 1

Receive the "100 Day Journey to Living Beyond Broken" journal and the Beyond Broken book. This package includes both the journal and book at a signficantly discounted price.

 

BEYOND BROKEN BUNDLE 2

This package includes both the journal and book at a discounted price along with the "Let Go Let God" bookmark. The Beyond Broken book and journal compliment each other and all items will make a great gift to anyone working through loss or adversity.

 

BEYOND BROKEN BUNDLE 3

Receive the "100 Day Journey to Living Beyond Broken" journal and the Beyond Broken book, beautiful bookmark, and refrigerator magnet. Reminding readers to "Let Go Let God".

All make great gifts.

 

BEYOND BROKEN GROUP COACHING

100 Days of Group coaching in an intimate online setting. Closed FB group access, weekly accountability group calls, daily check in’s, complimentary 30 minute 1 on 1 coaching call available with this purchase along with the journal and other exclusive resources.

*For availability and questions email us at runtherace13@gmail.com

 

BEYOND BROKEN 1 ON 1 COACHING

Bonus 1 on 1 coaching package: Weekly 1 on 1 coaching calls (30 minutes) that accompany your 100 day journey to freedom. Includes either a phone call or face to face video chat.

*For availability and questions email us at runtherace13@gmail.com

 

 

Share for a Cause

    Thank you to all of you that backed and supported my last campaign. I am grategul for your continued support! :-)

    Please share this campaign via social channels and assist us in bringing hope and healing to those hurting.

    *Share by clicking the social share icons on this page.

    **For direct inquiries and questions email us at runtherace13@gmail.com

story:
The story

Stan Grozniak, director of a ’90s cult action trilogy and gay art films, almost self-sabotages a prestigious directing gig with his writer-producer ex-boyfriend, after casting his rediscovered teenage summer stock crush. His tale of cinematic success and failure captures the passion and heartache of making love, making movies, and the occasional riot.

Read the first four chapters free at
http://palmdrivepublishing.com/Finding_Tulsa/FindingTulsa.html

 

Advance praise for Finding Tulsa

“Everything’s coming up roses in Finding Tulsa, Jim Provenzano’s intoxicating portrait of an artist as young to middle-aged man, from a high school musical techie in torn shorts to a semi jaded independent gay filmmaker. It’s a well-told yarn, full of humor and panache about a Hollywood player torn between his boyhood crush and a porn star. Spin the bottle, ride the Rolodex, and fasten your seat belt for Provenzano’s sweet roller coaster ride.”

– Marc Huestis, film director (Sex Is …) and author of Impresario of Castro Street: an Intimate Showbiz Memoir

“Finding Tulsa reminds you what a good friend a novel can be.  It’s about friendship, about “losing men and then finding them,” about brotherly love and conflict, and the possibility of resolution.  It’s sexy, funny, astute, panoramic – it knows about suburban Ohio basement rec rooms and glam parties in the Hollywood hills.  I felt like I had met a charming guy at a cocktail party who seemed to get me, understood my past, confided his own, and then disappeared to another better party before I was ready for him to leave.  And it’s wrapped around a fearless, wrenching narrative about facing your childhood demons, raising the question of whether or not one of the demons might have been you. There’s so much to savor, to argue with, reflect upon, learn from, enjoy.”­

– John Weir, Lambda Literary Award-winning author of The Irreversible Decline of Eddie Socket

“Jim Provenzano must have been spying on me from my adolescence (making short films with my brother) to my adulthood (making gay movies and TV series). I identified with every twist, turn, and blow by blow of this sexy show biz saga!” 

– Sam Irvin, Director of Dante’s Cove; Co-Producer of Gods And Monsters and The Broken Hearts Club

“Finding Tulsa is sexy, romantic, witty, engaging, both cleverly current yet sweetly retrospective. It's Jim Provenzano's most complex and accomplished novel. He gets so much right and so evocatively about show business, from those school plays we all remember to Hollywood made-for-television movies, with delicious stops at boyhood Super-8 movies and out of town gay porn shoots.”
– Felice Picano, author of Justify My Sins: A Hollywood Novel in Three Acts,
and the New York Times best-seller Like People in History

“Jim Provenzano's sexy, funny and soulful new novel Finding Tulsa is a beautiful deep-end dive into the memory of desire, the thumping bass note that drives life and art. The novel gorgeously explores how our hearts and cocks are woven with our theatre and films as we figure out how to be the star of our own queer story.” 
– Tim Miller, Performer and author of A Body in the O  

“Lights! Camera! Action! Finding Tulsa is a show-biz comedy told by a witty industry insider divulging how plays and movies and characters like “Tulsa” help gay boys survive adolescence, create identity, and worship beauty. What better icons could Provenzano have picked than Sondheim and Gypsy on which to fly his vivid characters, backstage intrigues, and dialogue sure to thrill the theater and movie queen in all of us. Writing at the top of his powers, with his striped tie and hopes high, he’s got rhythm. All he needs is you to go with ’im. A splendid romp! Let him entertain you!”

– Jack Fritscher, author of Mapplethorpe: Assault with a Deadly Camera and the Lammy Finalist, Some Dance to Remember: A Memoir-Novel of San Francisco 1970-1982

“Jim Provenzano always keeps in mind what the original ‘Tulsa’ said in Gypsy: ‘This step is good for the costume.’ Provenzano never misses a step as he suavely combines aesthetics and homoerotics in a work that is throughout deeply touching.”

– David Ehrenstein, author of Open Secret: Gay Hollywood–1928-2000

 

Publishing schedule

Set for a release date of September 2020 with Palm Drive Publishing, Finding Tulsa marks a new maturity in my fiction. Basic expenses will include:

  • Printing and shipping of advance review copies
  • Professional editing services
  • Paid placement in publishing industry newsletters
  • Advertising in print and online LGBT publications. No ad dollars will be spent on Facebook. Supporting LGBT media will be the focus of the paid ad campaign.
  • Fees for designers and commissioned musicians for music in the book trailer
  • Awards submission fees

 

Independent authors and small press challenges

Without the support of a major publisher, independent authors and small presses must use alternative community-supported means to share a book's presence. Strategies will include:

  • Targeted ads and promotions to fans of my previous novels
  • Focused advertising and reviews in LGBT and mainstream media.
  • Creative thematic book trailer
  • Online reading events and discussions
  • Special outreach to independent bookstores

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We're all facing economic hardship in these times. Even $5 to $10 helps. If you can't donate, please share the link for this campaign, follow me on my various social media author accounts, and support independent bookstores by special-ordering a copy of Finding Tulsa at your favorite independent bookstore, and post a review on various book sale websites. Thank you!

http://www.jimprovenzano.com

http://palmdrivepublishing.com/

https://jimprovenzano.blogspot.com/

https://twitter.com/jim_provenzano

https://www.youtube.com/user/Cyclizen

https://www.instagram.com/jimprovenzano/

http://www.amazon.com/author/jimprovenzano

https://www.facebook.com/JimProvenzanoAuthor/

The story
Stan Grozniak, director of a ’90s cult action trilogy and gay art films, almost self-sabotages a prestigious directing gig with his writer-producer ex-boyfriend, after casting his rediscovered teenage summer stock crush. His tale of cinematic success and failure captures the passion and heartache of making love, making movies, and the occasional riot.
Read the first four chapters free athttp://palmdrivepublishing.com/Finding_Tulsa/FindingTulsa.html

 
Advance praise for Finding Tulsa
“Everything’s coming up roses in Finding Tulsa, Jim Provenzano’s intoxicating portrait of an artist as young to middle-aged man, from a high school musical techie in torn shorts to a semi jaded independent gay filmmaker. It’s a well-told yarn, full of humor and panache about a Hollywood player torn between his boyhood crush and a porn star. Spin the bottle, ride the Rolodex, and fasten your seat belt for Provenzano’s sweet roller coaster ride.”
– Marc Huestis, film director (Sex Is …) and author of Impresario of Castro Street: an Intimate Showbiz Memoir
“Finding Tulsa reminds you what a good friend a novel can be.  It’s about friendship, about “losing men and then finding them,” about brotherly love and conflict, and the possibility of resolution.  It’s sexy, funny, astute, panoramic – it knows about suburban Ohio basement rec rooms and glam parties in the Hollywood hills.  I felt like I had met a charming guy at a cocktail party who seemed to get me, understood my past, confided his own, and then disappeared to another better party before I was ready for him to leave.  And it’s wrapped around a fearless, wrenching narrative about facing your childhood demons, raising the question of whether or not one of the demons might have been you. There’s so much to savor, to argue with, reflect upon, learn from, enjoy.”­
– John Weir, Lambda Literary Award-winning author of The Irreversible Decline of Eddie Socket
“Jim Provenzano must have been spying on me from my adolescence (making short films with my brother) to my adulthood (making gay movies and TV series). I identified with every twist, turn, and blow by blow of this sexy show biz saga!” 
– Sam Irvin, Director of Dante’s Cove; Co-Producer of Gods And Monsters and The Broken Hearts Club
“Finding Tulsa is sexy, romantic, witty, engaging, both cleverly current yet sweetly retrospective. It's Jim Provenzano's most complex and accomplished novel. He gets so much right and so evocatively about show business, from those school plays we all remember to Hollywood made-for-television movies, with delicious stops at boyhood Super-8 movies and out of town gay porn shoots.”– Felice Picano, author of Justify My Sins: A Hollywood Novel in Three Acts,and the New York Times best-seller Like People in History
“Jim Provenzano's sexy, funny and soulful new novel Finding Tulsa is a beautiful deep-end dive into the memory of desire, the thumping bass note that drives life and art. The novel gorgeously explores how our hearts and cocks are woven with our theatre and films as we figure out how to be the star of our own queer story.” – Tim Miller, Performer and author of A Body in the O  
“Lights! Camera! Action! Finding Tulsa is a show-biz comedy told by a witty industry insider divulging how plays and movies and characters like “Tulsa” help gay boys survive adolescence, create identity, and worship beauty. What better icons could Provenzano have picked than Sondheim and Gypsy on which to fly his vivid characters, backstage intrigues, and dialogue sure to thrill the theater and movie queen in all of us. Writing at the top of his powers, with his striped tie and hopes high, he’s got rhythm. All he needs is you to go with ’im. A splendid romp! Let him entertain you!”
– Jack Fritscher, author of Mapplethorpe: Assault with a Deadly Camera and the Lammy Finalist, Some Dance to Remember: A Memoir-Novel of San Francisco 1970-1982
“Jim Provenzano always keeps in mind what the original ‘Tulsa’ said in Gypsy: ‘This step is good for the costume.’ Provenzano never misses a step as he suavely combines aesthetics and homoerotics in a work that is throughout deeply touching.”
– David Ehrenstein, author of Open Secret: Gay Hollywood–1928-2000

 
Publishing schedule
Set for a release date of September 2020 with Palm Drive Publishing, Finding Tulsa marks a new maturity in my fiction. Basic expenses will include:

Printing and shipping of advance review copies
Professional editing services
Paid placement in publishing industry newsletters
Advertising in print and online LGBT publications. No ad dollars will be spent on Facebook. Supporting LGBT media will be the focus of the paid ad campaign.
Fees for designers and commissioned musicians for music in the book trailer
Awards submission fees


 
Independent authors and small press challenges
Without the support of a major publisher, independent authors and small presses must use alternative community-supported means to share a book's presence. Strategies will include:

Targeted ads and promotions to fans of my previous novels
Focused advertising and reviews in LGBT and mainstream media.
Creative thematic book trailer
Online reading events and discussions
Special outreach to independent bookstores


 
Other Ways You Can Help
We're all facing economic hardship in these times. Even $5 to $10 helps. If you can't donate, please share the link for this campaign, follow me on my various social media author accounts, and support independent bookstores by special-ordering a copy of Finding Tulsa at your favorite independent bookstore, and post a review on various book sale websites. Thank you!

story:
Short Summary

My desert story begins before I was born.  Before I was even in the womb, actually.  But in 2000, I came to live and work in the Mojave.  A tumultuous, surreal, and often dreamlike 20 years followed.

Desert Dreams: 20 Years in the Mojave is those two decades retold, as a photojournalist, spouse, parent, local businessman, musician, TV producer and host, and historian, through my photos and writing.

What We Need & What You Get

What I need:

  • I'm creating an 11" x 8.5" full color, soft cover, coffee table book, printed in the U.S.  I'm seeking funding to publish the initial print run of 100+ copies.
  • The best perk, of course, is a signed copy of the first edition of the book, but there are other ways to support this project.  My thanks go out to all who help support Desert Dreams!
  • I need to publish a minimum of 50 copies of the book.  If for some reason I don't raise the amount needed to do so within this campaign's time frame of 60 days, I will run a subsequent campaign until I do.  All supporters should receive their selected reward, but it is possible it may take longer to receive it.

The Impact

There have been an increasing number of books being written about the desert.  There's a lot of philosophizing and romanticizing and using the desert as the backdrop for plots.  That's not what this particular book is about.  This is a photo chronicle of two decades of experiences shaped by, and gleaned from, the desert, from my time as a "pornographer," to how the desert saved my life.  It, in many ways, is a logical conclusion to my time publishing The Sun Runner magazine, and draws from my 15 years with the magazine.

  • Desert Dreams will be (more or less) true stories from the desert.  There will be tales of intrigue, drama, celebrities (from Huell Howser to Oliver Stone), UFOs (of course), mystery, and backstories to news you may have thought you knew.  There will be lots of photos, and lots of fun.  
  • I'll be drawing from my 40+ years as a photojournalist  - half spent in the Mojave - to bring Desert Dreams to life.
  • This is a collection of stories, history, and images you won't find anywhere else.  Ever.

Risks & Challenges

Barring overwhelming natural disasters or myself catching COVID-19 from one of the desert's maskless wonders, this project should go as planned.  I do need to raise the funds necessary to publish a minimum of 50 copies within 60 days for this campaign.  However, should that not happen, I will continue to pre-sell copies until I do, and I should be able to fulfill my part of this bargain.

Part of the motivation for deciding to publish Desert Dreams is to provide some sort of resolution to my 15 years of running The Sun Runner magazine, and to have something to show for it (other than debt).  Another motivating factor is while other plans are delayed due to the COVID-19 pandemic, this is a project I can create solo, from my home office, with the full support of my Mojave Sand Leopard, and the tolerance and support of my wife.  

Other Ways You Can Help

Perhaps this pandemic has knocked you head over heels, or you are facing other challenges and cannot financially support this project at this time.  There are other ways you can help make Desert Dreams come true:

  • Please share this campaign with folks interested in the desert, independent books, and photojournalism.
  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools to help spread the word!

Thank you so much for your support!

story:
Early Praise for Dancing A Dizzy Holiness

 

Stuart Dybek, writer of prose and poetry, MacArthur Fellow

In Larry Janowski’s new collection, Dancing A Dizzy Holiness, a poem titled “Confessional Poem,” opens: “Ever wonder what it’s like on the priest’s side of the screen?” The witty title and the intimate voice that will answer this question typifies the complex, compassionate, and accessible down to earth beauty of this book. Down to earth—a stand-in phrase for wise. Down to earth in a way that is critical for Janowski’s credible reach toward the divine.

----------------------------------------------------------------------

From the Introduction to the book written by Judith Valente, award-winning author, poet and Pulitzer Prize-nominated journalist.​

Much of contemporary poetry lurks within the shadow side of human nature, or somersaults in clever word play, or else aims to reveal as little as possible of the poet’s meaning. But poems don’t need to be “fancy,” as Mary Oliver famously said. Janowski’s poems aren’t fancy. Think of them as the kind of unpretentious work shirts you might see proud men wearing in Chicago’s Southside Polish neighborhoods, places so familiar to Janowski. That doesn’t mean these poems are facile. They each carry their own beauty.

I finished this collection wanting for more. More time with this prophet of the quotidian. More time with the flawed and fascinating people who populate this collection. These are poems that will make you want to dance out of gratitude. That will fill your head with a dizzy holiness. And isn’t that the best kind of holiness?

---------------------------------------------------------------------

Fr. Jim Gannon ofm, Provincial Minister of the Assumption of the Blessed Virgin Mary Province

I was most fortunate to have attended a grade school, way back in the 1960’s, when the arts were part of the curriculum.  Friday afternoons were special!  One Friday of each month was dedicated to art, and another Friday was dedicated to poetry.  As a child, I did not fully appreciate the great gift of the arts.  Now, as an older adult, I have come to value, even more, the gift of poetry.  Poetry has helped me to understand the significance of speaking and writing. The study of poetry has also provided me with the insight to better understand people, as well as to better understand myself. Larry Janowski comes alive when he shares his poetry after years of deep, personal, hard reflections.  I love the title of Larry’s new book, Dancing A Dizzy Hioliness.  Please allow yourself to become “Dizzy” from the wide spectrum of emotions: diminishment of physical life and religious life, coming up on the “short end” of life, parents and family life, a scarred church, a tall and loving God.  Larry, you come alive in your poetry.  Keep on making us “Dizzy” with life. May we always emerge “dancing and holy.”

story:
Why Should We Exist? 

Greatest City Collective (www.greatestcitycollective.org) is a non-profit arts organization based in Baltimore, MD. We (Tim Neil + Divinia Shorter) founded it with a mixture of hope and frustration. We wanted to support non-profits that provide resources to disadvantaged people, but, as artists, our individual resources were limited. GCC exists to give voice to human-minded artists while raising money for essential non-profits. Our goals include: 

  • nurturing a space for empathetic artists, both emerging and established
  • curating a literary journal of the artistic process, Greatest City Diary 
  • discussing the intersection of artist and person with guests on Bus Ride Talks
  • generating funds for different community-oriented organizations each week
  • creating unique opportunities for artists of all mediums

 

What We Need

In order to share resources, you need to have some first. As we build our foundation, your contributions go to:

  • Website fees and operation costs (banking fees, business licenses)
  • Podcast and literary journal expenses (artist payments, software, equipment)
  • Social causes! As we intend to give a portion of all donations to community organizations, we're starting right now. 10% of funds raised here will go to a non-profit aiming to better the lives of fellow humans. An announcement of the organization chosen will be made at the close of this fundraiser. 

 

Risks & Rewards

Risks are inherent. Maybe this is just another arts organization with a literary journal and a podcast. Or maybe this is special, but so many things are special, and there's too many special things to keep up with. But Greatest City Collective believes greatness is inherently coexistent. We've chosen to exist as our own special piece of something, with the following unique points of impact: 

  • Provide a space for the unpolished, unfinished, undiscovered works of art (of all forms)
  • (Re)discover the humanity and personhood surrounding creative work and workers
  • Create opportunities for artists to support and uplift the causes that mean the most to them, while we cover the financial contribution part

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you don't have money to contribute, that's okay! GCC started from two people who didn't have money to donate but wanted to do more. Here are the ways you can still help us grow: 

  • Follow us on social media! @greatestcityco can be found on Twitter, Instagram, and Facebook and will bring you the latest news on this campaign, when our magazine and podcast are coming, and more. 
  • Share this campaign! Maybe someone in your circle will donate on your behalf, or someone who may never have seen us will connect. We believe in the power of human connection- the bigger our community, the stronger we are. 

 

No matter how you contribute (or don't, but we sure hope you do), thanks for interacting with us, and we hope to see you as part of our Collective soon.

story:
My name is Adam Jonathan Kaat and I am the author of Life on The Grocery Line: A Coronavirus Novel (title pending). I wrote this book after working as an upscale grocery store cashier during the initial months of the pandemic. In those early weeks of the global crisis, I started a blog to deal with the immense stress that I and other essential workers were dealing with. My book is a fictional summation of the stories I both heard and endured myself.

Through my experience, I discovered the story of Daniel, a young man in his first week as a cashier in an affluent grocery store when the pandemic hits American shores. He is thrust into a situation where his job has gone from inconsequential to “essential” nearly overnight. The store’s upper-middle class clientele that consists of "Lindas" and "Daves" are no help to calm his nerves with their pampered and myopic views of the world. Daniel’s experience evolves from a fun and simple part time gig to one where he is forced to give sage advice to customers while being called a hero for just going to work. His optimism turns dark as he grapples with his new found roll all-the-while society crumbles around him.

This book is a fictionalized version of my experiences, but I think it tells a story of the unheard and quickly forgotten. The problems essential workers face are less obvious because they have to keep it together at the cost of their livelihoods. My desire is that we all come to a better understanding of what essential workers and fellow human beings are going through and that everyone has their own struggles and hidden pain. 

What We Need & What You Get

  • Funding needed to print, edit and market the book.
  • At the minimum level of contribution, you will receive a pre-sale copy of the ebook and your name as a Thank You in the back of the book. The more you donate, the better it gets, with autographed copies, Life on The Grocery Line masks, prints and other goodies added at each level.
  • If we don't reach our goal then we will look at launching again at a later date.

About The Author

I am a supervisor at a grocery store in the Midwest. Like many people, I was born a "writer" or at least that's what my parents told me when I would pontificate and philosophize as a child. Their words planted the seed in my mind, leading to several successful blogs over the years. A few novels have been started, but what I really needed was something truly worthwhile to write about.

In the summer of 2019, I quit my comfortable corporate job because I was dissatisfied with the course my life was taking and it started to bubble to the surface. I was breaking down in real-time and I decided to take a leap composed of talent and faith in myself, cashed out my 401k and sat down to write that novel I had neglected for almost a decade.

After a few months of serious writing, the small sum of money ran out and I started a job as a part-time cashier at a high-end grocery store located in the wealthy area of town. I continued to work on the draft of my first novel, but in just over a month and a half of work, I was on the front lines of a pandemic. Every priority, idea of how I thought life would turn out, and my opinions about the world around me changed. Despite all the uncertainty, my desire to write and tell stories never faltered.

I found myself writing tales of what my coworkers and I were going through during the early pandemic on a blog that connected with essential workers and the people in their lives. We all leaned on each other and shared our trials and tribulations. I found an unexpected family of sorts. I can tell you the blog and community around it saved me over and over again, and this is where I discovered a topic worthwhile to write about. My experiences are now a novel, and you can help me publish my dream.

Risks & Challenges

  • The biggest risk to finishing this project is acquiring the money I need to pay my publisher for editing, cover, page design and marketing.
  • I have a substantial audience through Facebook already but want to reach them through some additional advertising. 
  • The topic is timely, people are interested and I’ve never been so committed to finishing something in my life.
  • Essential Workers need to be heard and I will use every medium possible to talk about the book. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Beyond funding assistance, there are ways that you can help this effort.

Word of mouth will be huge. Tell your friends through all means possible. Like my Facebook page and follow me on Instagram and Twitter, and like, comment, and share posts about the book with some of your own comments. 

Read the book and write a short review or endorsement on the book’s amazon.com page. Reviews help circulation.

Be good to essential workers. Even though this story is fictionalized, the goal is to bring awareness to the struggles our fellow human beings are dealing with on a daily basis. They’re assuming a lot of risk so the rest of the world can operate under the guise of normality.

Word of mouth will be huge. Tell your friends through all means possible. Like my Facebook page and follow me on Instagram and Twitter, and like, comment, and share posts about the book with some of your own comments. 
Read the book and write a short review or endorsement on the book’s amazon.com page. Reviews help circulation.
Be good to essential workers. Even though this story is fictionalized, the goal is to bring awareness to the struggles our fellow human beings are dealing with on a daily basis. They’re assuming a lot of risk so the rest of the world can operate under the guise of normality.

story:
Short Summary

Hi there, 

My name is Uliana and I am here to ask for your support. It was not easy for me to find courage and accept the fact that I need help - and, what is more important, this story needs help. 

I published my first book at the age of 15, and I have always been passionate about writing. But this time, my passion does not seem to be enough. 

I was writing Hearts of Cotton for around 4 years, on and off, of course. Today, it is the most beautiful synthesis of all the feelings, emotions and experiences I collected on my journey in the past years - amazing friendships from Lithuania, struggles of early adulthood in Germany, and breathtaking adventures from all around the world. 

Now, this is the time for this story to see the world, and for the world to get to know the story.

I am looking for support to publish this book: as simple as that, none of the existing publishing houses would accept a manuscript without any editing done before submission. And editing, to be frank, costs from 1500 to 5000 EUR for 200 pages manuscript, depending on thoroughness. 

I believe that the story uncovers something that can be deeply personal for all of us in a way that is easy and relatable: our emotional responsiveness in the days of uncertainty.

 

Here is what my first reader, Linja Fraenz from Germany, thought of this book:

 

'The story touched me deeply - I guess it just found me at the right time. All the main characters are very different, yet so relatable! The way they grow and develop is so unexpected, but this is what truly makes them so close to us. A character that you might have disliked in the very beginning shows up as a beautiful soul by the end of the story, and someone who you thought is nice and kind to their roots demonstrates the worst of their character - but isn’t it what makes us human, after all? 

I finished reading the story within a week— just couldn’t stop reading, wondering where the journey will take those characters. And after saving so many photos on my phone of all my favorite passages, I hope this story will find more readers from around the world, because it truly made an impact for me. Looking forward to the second part!'

 

What We Need & What You Get

To kick off the publishing process, I need professional help in editing the book. 

I am already searching for an editor with whom we could be on the same page about how to edit the story in a way that will not harm my own voice and narrative, but only strengthen the messages I want to share. 

The costs of such editing services vary from 1500 EUR to 5000EUR+, depending on the size of the manuscript and the effort required. As English is not my native language, I believe that the required effort will be rather big :) 

In case if you support me and Heart of Cotton, I will gladly:

  • Thank you over the social media for any donations - be prepared, and let me know if you would not like that :)
  • For donations more than 20 EUR I will send a postcard designed by me with a random quote from the book - they are really nice, I must say
  • For donations more than 50 EUR I will be happy to send you the book once it is edited - in a digital format, or as a printout (and of course as a paperback whenever it is published)

 

The Impact

Once this story gets a touch of a professional editor, it gets wings: it can be published on Amazon Publishing, it can participate in the international writing competitions and it can be submitted to various publishing houses in the US.

But what is even more important, it gets a chance to impact lives of people all around the world, supporting them in the challenging times, bringing hope and helping them to reinvent themselves, no matter in which period of their life they stumble upon this story. 

I truly believe that this book can make the world a little bit better, in its own way. 

And you never know - maybe your support today will turn this story into your favourite Netflix show in a couple of years :)

 

Risks & Challenges

Editing is a long process, and so is publishing. Even with your immense support it can take years until Hearts of Cotton get to the bookshelves of the stores in your city (as well as in mine), so we need to stay patient together. 

However, every donation is a little step forward, and I am positive that this story is worth to be shared with the whole world, when it is the right time.

In case if I do not collect the full amount needed for hiring professional editor, I won't leave this cause and most likely will invest in it anyway. But I sincerely believe in that old African saying: if you want to go fast, go alone, but if you want to go far, go together. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Follow me on Facebook and Instagram - from time to time I will post the quotes and passages of the story for you to get familiar with it and share your thoughts whether it resonates with you or not!

Facebook: Uliana Domasheva

Instagram: uliaaaaaanaa

story:
Confident and sassy, Reese is anything but ordinary. In the Remarkable Reese children's book series, Reese is shattering female stereotypes by exploring male-dominated careers. Reese believes she can do anything! Why? Because the future is female!

I have a long list of male dominate careers that I plan to bring to life in the Remarkable Reese series: A pilot, football referee, and an astronaut to name a few. Instead of creating a fictional character, I always find a real-life inspiration to associate the main character of the book with. My first book, Remarkable Reese: I want to be a Police Officer was inspired by Murrieta police officer, Jennifer Metoyer. Remarkable Reese; I want to be  Dentist was inspired by Temecula dentist, Dr. Walker, and my newest addition, Remarkable Reese: I Want to be a Firefighter is inspired by Fire Captain Wendi Miller of Rancho Mirage. I chose Fire Captain Wendi because not only is she a Captain, which is even more rare for a female, but she is fighting cancer. Wendi is a strong role model for young girls and is a true hero.
I had no idea how many firefighters are affected by cancer. I found an organization, Fire Fighter Cancer Foundation that focuses on research to identify and reduce toxic exposures causing cancer. I reached out to founder and president, Cindy Ell, and spoke to her in length about her foundation and decided instantly to donate a percentage of my book sales to this amazing organization!

There are many expenses associated with self publishing. Your monetary support will allow Remarkable Reese: I Want to be a Firefighter go to print. I can't thank you enough for your support fulfilling my dream of being a children's author and sending the powerful message to young girls that they are capable of anything!
