story:
Jaclyn Rae 
R&D Recipes | worldwide author | writer | blogger | vegan chef
| nutrition expert | Certified in NHR | animal lover

ABOUT AUTHOR

Struggling with food allergies from a young age, Jaclyn Rae, founder of Jaclyn Creations, discovered the health benefits of a plant-based/vegan diet over eight years ago. Jaclyn, highly allergic to animal protein, began a lifelong journey that has led her to become a nutritionist, worldwide author, and advocate for cruelty-free food consumption.

Jaclyn Rae is a vegan health consultant in Portland Oregon and helps her clients with strategies to make their health a priority. Her experience in nutrition is the foundation for your support as well as lifestyle integration. She provides her clients personalized plant-based recipes alongside her bio-individualized programs, educating her clients on how to live their best life.

 

2ND EDITION RELEASE 



"JACLYN CREATIONS GLUTEN-FREE SAVORY & SWEET VEGAN RECIPES"

Each creation was simply inspired by healthy plant-based meals that are naturally gluten-free, wholesome, with a hearty essence.

  • Built from scratch - Each one of my creations is built from scratch, simple to make, and easy on digestion. Because I used healing foods to correct my gut health, I wanted to share my creations to help others restore and repair their bodies as well.
     
  • Plant proteins are in all of my dishes - I found a significant way to include healthy sources of protein, which are 100% from plants. Throughout my healing journey, I have discovered which food combinations provide the proper nutrients and macronutrient ratios that the body needs for a healthy and holistic wellness lifestyle.
     
  • No artificial sweeteners or fillers - Not only do my creations offer health benefits to the body, but they also taste delectable! Also, I have strategically removed sugar from my creations, only to replace it with natural plant-based vegan sweeteners when a recipe calls for it. Otherwise, no additives or crazy fillers are found inside of my dishes.


WHAT'S INSIDE THIS BOOK?

​

PRODUCTION IN PROGRESS

About a year ago was the infancy of the production phases, of publishing hard copies of my 1st edition recipe book. Fast forward to June of 2021, a hallmark and 1 year anniversary of my 1st edition recipe ebook, and my 2nd edition ebook launch date.

After doing research, I realize how much it costs to convert a single book into a print book. I noticed that many publishers offer bulk runs, of around 50 units in volume at a minimum. This would also be considered a bundle of products, which would give a significant discount when trying the keep print costs down. 

In the meantime, I am looking for ways to reduce the costs associated with editing, publishing, and printing.  One of my primary goals in this campaign to able to come up with the costs associated with the printing in high volume, manufacturing, and helping me with cost analysis of the future print book sales. For now, I have been generating all of my book sales locally from Portland and around the world virtually.  

On this very occasion, was when I  became self-published in many electronic publications. The many electronic publications that I am currently using are Amazon, Kindle, B&N Press, Google Play, and also carrying copies on my website. Using many of these electronic platforms has resulted in a wonderful avenue to gain as much exposure as possible, through a lens worldwide, and the results are booming, as I continue to make book sales across seas. 

Last year's printing decisions were heavily impressed upon because of the pandemic, and production phases were put on a halt. However, one day soon, I know I will be able to share my personalized recipes to help others explore the creations I have made and truly bring them to life.


FUNDING & NEXT STEPS


With my funding, this will expedite the next production phases:

  • Printing costs - $1500  
    Printed 1st and 2nd edition recipe books (prints of each version, in English, binding in perfect bound, softcover, color ink, 80 lb - white paper, 12 pt white - Glossy covers, set up fees, etc.)
     
  • Gain more exposure
    • In-person sales opportunity
    • Wholesale or vending opportunities
    • When hard copies of both of my recipe books make it to print, I plan on housing several copies at local coffee shops in the Portland neighborhood!
    • Hosting a professional tabled book signing, where my local community can have the chance to pick up hard copies of both of my books and meet with me.


BOOK RELEASE

The books will be released in versions below:

The 1st edition, electronic digital version of "Jaclyn Creations Raw Vegan Recipe Book".


The 2nd edition, electronic digital version of "Jaclyn Creations Gluten-Free Savory & Sweet Vegan Recipes".
 

HOW TO CONTRIBUTE
 

  • Donate $14 to receive a digital copy (PDF) of my 1st edition ebook.

  • Donate $30 to receive both digital copies (PDFs) of my 1st (June 2020) and 2nd edition (June 2021) ebooks.

  • Donate $45 to contribute to the costs associated with hardcover printing. Helps me to reach the goal to send my books to production, and includes digital copies (PDF) of my 1st (June 2020) and 2nd edition (June 2021) ebooks.

  • Donate $75 to contribute to the costs associated with hardcover printing, and receive both digital copies (PDFs) of the 1st (June 2020) and 2nd edition (June 2021) ebooks.  ​Also, we will include a one-of-a-kind t-shirt design from our VEGAN FOR THE ANIMALS CAMPAIGNS (as seen in the picture below). Expect a follow-up email from me, requesting your size after your contribution is made. 

T-Shirt Specs:

  • Unisex
  • Softest and smoothest
  • Durable material
  • Screenprint design
  • Machine washable (wash cold turned inside out)
     
    SIZES: S-XL

    We do our best to describe every garment to the best of our ability as well as list measurements. Please allow time for processing, all items are exclusively made to order (MTO).

 

*The vegan for the animal's campaign is where we donate 10% of profits from a single t-shirt sale, to non-profits or organizations that are dedicated to saving the animals. 

 Visit our apparel on our website! https://jaclyncreations.com/product/i-heart-veg... 

INSPIRATION OF PLANT-BASED EATING

All of my recipes are my very own personalized plant-based recipes, which are the cornerstone of my healing and to my coaching programs. After healing my poor gut health, I was certain about sharing a piece of my story, healthy recipes, and help individuals with supplementing their nutrition with a holistic approach. 

My work is primarily based on a plant-based diet/lifestyle, nutrition, sustainability, health, and promotion of education.   

I have written in my 1st and 2nd edition recipe books combined over  55+ plant-based, gluten-free recipes, that are part of my largest accomplishments! All of my recipes are simple, delicious, and offer a variety of health benefits and nutrients with every bite.  

  • Gluten-Free
  • Celiac Disease/Gluten intolerance  
  • Alkaline 
  • Keto-friendly
  • Diabetes-friendly 
  • Plant-based
  • Vegan
     

THANKS FOR YOUR SUPPORT

Anyone who donates and pending numeric amounts that are not listed above will receive a digital copy of my 1st edition recipe book because we want to thank you for your support!

SUPPORT BY SHARING THIS PAGE

If you are unable to contribute anything at this time, please share our page with someone who may be able to help me reach this goal. 

Also, visit https://www.JaclynCreations.com to learn more about the company.

story:
Short Summary

Hi, I'm Janis, and I've published 3 award-winning books and more than 50 articles and essays. I created Creative Caffeine Daily to help motivate, inspire, and connect an unlimited number of writers at all stages of their careers, in all corners of the globe, and from all walks of life.

Creative Caffeine Daily is based on 3 core writing principles I absolutely believe in--and practice myself.

1) The more you write, the better you write.

2) There's a creative alchemy that comes from free writing first thing in the morning--close to the dream state.

3) Writers thrive in community--when they have other writers to read and comment on their work.

For three years, I ran Creative Caffeine as a manual subscription service. And it was an amazing resource for writers! Creative Caffeine members finished novels and essays--and they got published. More importantly, they wrote. Because writing every day--even if it's only for 10 minutes every morning--helps you develop a really strong writing practice.

But because I ran Creative Caffeine manually, I had to limit the number of writers who could take advantage of it. 

The goal of this campaign is to create an online version of Creative Caffeine. Creative Caffeine Daily will be an automated platform that brings all the benefits of the manual version--the daily writing prompt (delivered fresh each morning!), the weekly writing partner, and the online magazine--to an unlimited number of writers, at all stages in their careers, in all locations. It will give writers what they need most. Community. Inspiration. Motivation. Feedback. And the pleasure of seeing their work out in the world. All for less than the cost of a daily latté.

What We Need & What You Get

The bulk of the money raised will be used to create the Creative Caffeine Daily online platform. This will be a responsive website on which our members will write (we'll be building our own visually compelling, easy-to-use word processor), review their work, and the work of their partners. In addition, each member will maintain his or her own dashboard and avatar on the site. We will also be creating a beautiful online magazine to showcase our members' work.

The three key features we will be building first are:

1) The daily writing prompt

2) The assignment of a weekly writing partner

3) The online magazine

We will also be building in a rating system--one to five coffee cups--so partners can rate each other on quality of feedback and reliability. As we move forward, partners with similar ratings will be matched.

Additional funds will be used for server storage for the online magazine, as well as for all the writing created by our members.

Everyone who contributes at least $100 will be given a 4-week membership at launch and become a founding member of the Creative Caffeine Daily community. The site will identify founding members, each of whom will be eligible for discounts in the Creative Caffeine Daily store and editing suite. Memberships are transferable at launch, so you can give one to a deserving writer who may be unable to contribute to this fundraiser.

We require a minimum of $30,000 to build a basic version of Creative Caffeine Daily. It's our hope we will raise more so we can begin building additional useful features for writers--the editing suite, a mechanism for our members to interact outside of the Creative Caffeine environment, a newsletter with writing advice, and an interface to connect our members with industry professionals such as agents and editors.

The Impact

There exist dozens of apps that will send writers daily prompts. What makes Creative Caffeine Daily unique is the weekly partner piece of the equation. Feedback, and the knowledge that someone is waiting to read your work, is a huge motivator. Writing is, at its heart, solitary work. Yet to thrive, to be inspired--to feel as if they are not so alone in the creative world--writers need readers. Every step of the way, Creative Caffeine Daily will fill that need.

 

Creative Caffeine Daily will also be giving back. Once we launch, 10% of all profits will be donated to Dave Eggers' ScholarMatch.

Other Ways You Can Help

While you might not personally be able to help, you may know someone--or many people who can. Please share our story (and the link to this campaign). Your friends and family don't need to be writers. They only need to care about books and reading--and who doesn't care about that?
story_txt:
Short Summary

Hi, I'm Janis, and I've published 3 award-winning books and more than 50 articles and essays. I created Creative Caffeine Daily to help motivate, inspire, and connect an unlimited number of writers at all stages of their careers, in all corners of the globe, and from all walks of life.
Creative Caffeine Daily is based on 3 core writing principles I absolutely believe in--and practice myself.
1) The more you write, the better you write.
2) There's a creative alchemy that comes from free writing first thing in the morning--close to the dream state.
3) Writers thrive in community--when they have other writers to read and comment on their work.
For three years, I ran Creative Caffeine as a manual subscription service. And it was an amazing resource for writers! Creative Caffeine members finished novels and essays--and they got published. More importantly, they wrote. Because writing every day--even if it's only for 10 minutes every morning--helps you develop a really strong writing practice.
But because I ran Creative Caffeine manually, I had to limit the number of writers who could take advantage of it. 
The goal of this campaign is to create an online version of Creative Caffeine. Creative Caffeine Daily will be an automated platform that brings all the benefits of the manual version--the daily writing prompt (delivered fresh each morning!), the weekly writing partner, and the online magazine--to an unlimited number of writers, at all stages in their careers, in all locations. It will give writers what they need most. Community. Inspiration. Motivation. Feedback. And the pleasure of seeing their work out in the world. All for less than the cost of a daily latté.

What We Need & What You Get

The bulk of the money raised will be used to create the Creative Caffeine Daily online platform. This will be a responsive website on which our members will write (we'll be building our own visually compelling, easy-to-use word processor), review their work, and the work of their partners. In addition, each member will maintain his or her own dashboard and avatar on the site. We will also be creating a beautiful online magazine to showcase our members' work.
The three key features we will be building first are:
1) The daily writing prompt
2) The assignment of a weekly writing partner
3) The online magazine
We will also be building in a rating system--one to five coffee cups--so partners can rate each other on quality of feedback and reliability. As we move forward, partners with similar ratings will be matched.
Additional funds will be used for server storage for the online magazine, as well as for all the writing created by our members.
Everyone who contributes at least $100 will be given a 4-week membership at launch and become a founding member of the Creative Caffeine Daily community. The site will identify founding members, each of whom will be eligible for discounts in the Creative Caffeine Daily store and editing suite. Memberships are transferable at launch, so you can give one to a deserving writer who may be unable to contribute to this fundraiser.
We require a minimum of $30,000 to build a basic version of Creative Caffeine Daily. It's our hope we will raise more so we can begin building additional useful features for writers--the editing suite, a mechanism for our members to interact outside of the Creative Caffeine environment, a newsletter with writing advice, and an interface to connect our members with industry professionals such as agents and editors.

The Impact
There exist dozens of apps that will send writers daily prompts. What makes Creative Caffeine Daily unique is the weekly partner piece of the equation. Feedback, and the knowledge that someone is waiting to read your work, is a huge motivator. Writing is, at its heart, solitary work. Yet to thrive, to be inspired--to feel as if they are not so alone in the creative world--writers need readers. Every step of the way, Creative Caffeine Daily will fill that need.
 

Creative Caffeine Daily will also be giving back. Once we launch, 10% of all profits will be donated to Dave Eggers' ScholarMatch.

Other Ways You Can Help
While you might not personally be able to help, you may know someone--or many people who can. Please share our story (and the link to this campaign). Your friends and family don't need to be writers. They only need to care about books and reading--and who doesn't care about that?

story:
‘A is for Agbada: An African Alphabet Adventure’ is a gorgeous picture book for children aged 0-5 that takes readers on an exciting journey to discover the sights and sounds of life in Nigeria – Africa’s most populous country. This book uses the alphabets, rhyming sentences, and colorful illustrations to introduce readers to the rhythm of life in the Giant of Africa.

 

Your child might know what a bus or a train is, but do they know what a Keke is? They might know about winter, spring, summer, and fall, but have they ever heard about Harmattan? Do they know about the Super Eagles? From A is for Agbada to Z is for Zuma, this book will broaden your child’s imagination and knowledge in a fun and exciting way. They will be introduced to Nigeria’s diverse people, places, and traditions, while reinforcing early learning concepts like the alphabets, counting, and rhyming. The colorful and vibrant illustrations will make this a book that your child will return to over and over again!

 

 

As an added resource, we included a detailed "Did You Know" section at the back of the book with a pronunciation guide and fun facts for each alphabet that will surely delight you and your child as you read this book. The process of exploring and learning together will give your family memories that will last through the years.

 

This book was designed with durability and quality in mind. Our illustrations are colorful and child friendly, and the hard cover design will ensure that the book withstands wear and tear from toddler hands and frequent reading.

 

 

 

 

This book is important for children who need to learn about their cultural heritage. As parents with young children who live outside our home country of Nigeria, instilling a love for Nigerian heritage and culture in our children is so important to us. Pride and knowledge of one’s history and background are key to giving our kids the gift of confidence and self-esteem; gifts that will build their resilience as they navigate the world around them.

 

 

Additionally, this book is important for all children because it is essential to expose them to a variety of cultures and people from an early age, and to teach them the importance of respect, knowledge, and appreciation of cultures other than their own.

 

Lastly, this book is a key addition to the collection of books written by Africans about Africa. Stories about Africa are full of life lessons that children can apply in their lives, and children’s books about Africa by Africans provide an opportunity to add more depth and variety to the information and perceptions of Africa that exist in our children’s books and influence their young minds.

 

 

 

 

Self-publishing has been such a time consuming and expensive project! Phew! We have invested over $12,000 of our own funds to pay for illustration, buy ISBNs, file for copyrights, editing, website design, and other behind the scenes, but very important tasks required to make this book a reality. 

As mothers with very young children, we know that books can go from mint condition to ripped-to-shreds in the twinkle of an eye, and that is why we are printing hardcover books. Funds raised from this campaign will be primarily used to fund our first print run of books in China, and to ship them to the U.S. 

 

We are Ufuoma & Udhedhe, two sisters who were born and raised in Nigeria but found ourselves raising our young children away from home. We searched for books to use in raising our children to be grounded in their African heritage but found that identifying quality books about Africa written by Africans was hard. Instead of giving up, we decided to take the bull by the horns and write the books we want our children to read! ‘A is for Agbada: An African Alphabet Adventure’ is our first of many books!

 

 Our kids provided the push that set this whole project in motion. They continue to challenge and inspire us every day!

 

When thinking of the visuals for the book, we knew we wanted something vibrant and colorful to properly showcase the beautiful cultures found in Nigeria. Our talented illustrator, Gaby Zermeño brought our words to life with her beautiful illustrations!

 

 

To show our support for their amazing work, if we raise up to $15,000, we will give 60 books to Books for Africa (BFA). BFA is a charity organization that collects, sorts, and ships books, computers, tablets, and library enhancement materials to every country in Africa. In collaboration with worldwide donors, publishers, and African partners, BFA provides the tools of empowerment to children and students across Africa. HELP us make this happen! 

Give Young Kids in Africa the gift of Early Reading! :)

 

 

 

 

Risks and challenges

This is our VERY FIRST Indiegogo campaign! Woot! Your backing of our project means so much to us! We are TRULY grateful! Our illustration is complete and now, we need help with an initial printing of the book. Due to the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic, there have been world-wide delays in production and shipping of products like ours. If this affects our project, we will make sure to keep everyone in the KNOW!

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Crisálida es un proyecto Audiovisual y de Diseño (Transmendia), y nace a partir de la siguiente  leyenda indoamericana.

     

Es un proyecto que narrará diferentes historias; sobre el proceso que pasan algunas personas,  para superar una gran tristeza.


Seguramente te vas a sentir identificado, porque todos pasamos por situaciones difíciles en la vida, pero son las  decisiones o algunas situaciones que a veces parecen milagros que nos sacan de ese vacío por el cual podemos estar pasando.

 El proyecto se divide en 5 etapa , con el objetivo final de tener varios productos que ilustren diferentes historias sobre la esperanza y la resiliencia.


PRODUCTOS:

- Un cortometraje

- Un documental

- Una agenda

- Una página web

- kit virtual para resilientes

Con esta CAMPAÑA realizaremos el  PRIMERA ETAPA, que consiste en: 

La preproducción del  CORTOMETRAJE y  diseño e impresión de la AGENDA.

                                                             

 El CORTOMETRAJE  tiene una duración  12 min de duración. Se va a filmar en la Costa Caribe Colombiana. 


El objetivo  es poder participar en festivales , difundirlo en diferentes medios y eventos.

         

                                                               


 La AGENDA, es un cuaderno de apuntes, donde se podrá escribir  sobre actividades diarias, plasmar pensamientos e ideas personales acompañados  de frases reflexivas y tips  para ser Felices.

                                                                  

 Con esta campaña queremos conseguir la parte inicial del proyecto para poder comenzar oficialmente. Buscamos  recolectar el 20% del proyecto total.


En la parte derecha encontrarás las retribuciones que puedes recibir a cambio de tu donación.


                                                                     

Nuestro  gran objetivo es poder realizar y terminar el proyecto  y  que en el 2016, Crisálida recorra el mundo alegrando corazones, cambiando pensamientos y generando consciencia  de que la vida es corta y hay que vivirla cumpliendo los sueños.


Esperamos que te unas a esta metamorfosis transmedia y que juntos realicemos este sueño.


                      



DESCRIPTION TEXT:


Crisálida (chrysalis) is a transmedia project, that born from the following American  Indian legend. 


                                                               

is a project that will tell magical stories that remind us the sense of live and 

dreams. You will probably feel identify, because we all go through difficult 

situations in our lives, but are the decisions or some situations that sometimes 

looks like miracles that take us out of that empty place that we could be going 

through.

WHY TO DO A TRANSMEDIA PROJECT? : To start, transmedia: is the technic of 

telling the universe of a story using multiple digital or traditional platforms. The 

central message is complemented or is extended through the different platforms  

                                                               

for more information about the transmedia narratives you can visit our 

web page transmedia.shaktistore.com, there you can find the investigation that I did about the topic.

                                                            

the initial idea of Crisálida (chrysalis) was to create a short film. At the end 

of the writing of the script, I visualize more stories and I found different anecdotes 

of people who have overcome sicknesses, disappointments, love, frustrations 

etc… and I want to expand the universe of the story to visualize and know more 

tales. That´s how the idea of taking the short film into a transmedia project was 

born. 

In this order of ideas, the central story would be tell through a short film of 12 

minutes, filmed in the Caribbean Colombian coast. That we will send to festivals, 

and disseminate in different media.


                                                      

the great connector with people would be the WEB PAGE. There you 

would fine the sub stories, told through documentaries, reports and videos that 

people can upload to the web page, telling us the stories and anecdotes of their 

lives. All of this with the purpose of generate HOPE in those who feel alone o sad.

                                                     

in addition we will create an DIARY, which will have the characters 

tales, you can write the diary activities, translate thoughts, personal ideas 

accompanied of reflexive phrases and tips to be happy.

DATA SHEET OF THE DIARY

Size: 15x15 cm

Hard cover

You can use it any day and any year

Stickers page

We also will create the “Resilient kit”  that will have: tips, phrases, challenges; 

capture in images and videos to recover the sense of live and realize that we are 

not alone.

                                                             

with this campaign we want to get the initial part of the project, to officially 

start; we look to gather the 20% of the total project.

With this 20% we will develop:

 Design, creation and layout of one agenda that will have the tales of the 

characters and would be accompanied by reflexives phrases.

 Print of 200 agendas

 Design of the web page

 to find and manage the short film locations (scouting)

 We will make the casting to find the characters of the short film

 Teaser of the short film

 Ending of the stage of pre-production of the short film

 Scenery props for the short

 Release of the diary

 Creation of the “Resilient kit”

                                                         

our principal objective is to make and complete the project, and in 

2016, Crisálida (chrysalis) tour the world liven up hearts, changing thoughts, 

generating conscience that live is short and it must be lived achieving dreams.

We hope that you join this transmedia metamorphosis and that together we 

perform this dream.

Other ways that you can help us: 

 Sharing our campaign

 Telling to a familiar or a friend about our campaign 

 Following us in our social networks 

 If you are a compositor, designer, illustrator, photographer, artist, etc… and 

you want to be part of the project donating something, or as a volunteer. 

You’re welcome. Write us to our email.

 Telling to a familiar or a friend about our campaign 
 Following us in our social networks 
 If you are a compositor, designer, illustrator, photographer, artist, etc… and 
you want to be part of the project donating something, or as a volunteer. 
You’re welcome. Write us to our email.

story:
I am disabled.  I try really hard to work.  I write in what little free time I get.  I worked in professional kitchens since I was 16, 21 years ago.  I went to culinary school in 2004 and have an Associates Degree in Culinary Arts.  I worked for famous chefs that include Wolfgang Puck and Todd English.

My first book is about chefs.  I have known a lot of chefs who told me a lot of fascinating stories.  I have condensed them into a handful of characters for simplicities sake.

The second book is about a romance gone bad between a recovered alcoholic chef and a mentally ill alcoholic woman.

Professionals editors charge $25 dollars an hour.  My first book is about 140 pages.

I have always worked hard.  I have always just had enough to get by.  I do not know why this is.  I do not like taking your money every month because I was born disabled but would be up the creek without it.  The doctors recently told me to stop cooking.  I have taken up work driving for a living but I do not make very much money.

It would mean the world to me and the woman involved in the second book to get them finished and published.  The first step was to write them.  It has taken a decade and a half to write them.  Step 2 is to have them edited...

Here is the introduction to the first book, Ramblings of the Roaming Chef...

Intro   

I remember these things like they were yesterday.  I remember them when speeding across Kansas at three in the morning trying to get to my next job on time.  They crisscross my memory after driving for too long across this vast country, while looking at the reflections in my rearview mirror, long after chain-smoking, trucker coffee, and red bull cease to produce stimulation or pleasure anymore, when wondering if I'll fall asleep and crash my underinsured car before I make it to work in three days for my next cooking gig.

  What you are about to read did not necessarily happen to me; it has, mostly, happened to some of fine culinarians I knew, hence I do not name my character.  It is hyperbole; the stories of many happen to a few.  Their names have all been changed.  I heard their kitchen stories late at night after dinner service ended while standing outside in the back of various restaurants and hotels catching a quick smoke before cleanup, in seedy billiards parlors, around bonfires, in dive bars where cooks could afford to drink…  Everyone all had one thing in common; they were all young once.  Many are still young at heart.

Some will call them foolish, others will call them reckless idiots, and some will call them free spirits.  The years portrayed have taught me three things: 1)don't take unreasonable shit from anyone 2)god loves fools 3) life goes on.  Kitchen professionals often wonder why their wages are low and why their hair falls out; this book will help explain these questions. 

  I'm coming up on Salina now, halfway across Kansas; Time for another Red Bull…..  Vito and his gun are 600 miles behind me now!

You will  have to donate to read the rest!  Even 5 bucks would help.  Please tell your friends.  Thank You.

S. "Bailey" Walter

story:
Other Story - showing the humanbeing behind the category 'refugee'.

The first series of Other Story short films bring the viewer up close to the different stories, faces, moods and voices belonging to the people who are refugees in Europe. In a time when people fleeing are seeking security and dignity in Europe, the manner in which we receive them will greatly affect how our future together unfolds. 

Other Story has been developed based on a desire to break with a simplistic and partisan history and seek to cultivate the ground for a common humanity. We need to expose the human face, the thoughtfulness and the visions of the individual, in order not only to get to know who 'they' are, but also to find out who we are together.

Refugees are often portrayed as a single group, a 'stream', in the national conventional press. We believe that this creates prejudice and oversimplifies the conflict and it's consequences. Other Story shows the unique stories hiding behind the category 'refugee' and opens the individual narrative. In every short film, focus is drawn to the aspects of life which people share – dreams, love, friendship. With a simple expression, a filmic sensitivity and a series of ordinary questions, the short films show the seriousness, humour, life force and the absurdity of what it is to be a refugee. 

Funding:

Our funding goal of € 2000, is a symbolic amount. The idea is, that you support funding for one film at a time, and follow the count of films. 
For people in Denmark, you can also donate here or on mobilepay: 53991581
  • 1 film = € 1000
  • To establish the online platform = € 4500
Funding goes to:
  • Making it possible to establish Other Story as an independant mediaplatform.
  • Making it possible to continue collecting human stories told by the people who are right now refugees in Europe.
  • Covering basic travel expenses for the film-makers.
  • Covering full production of films.

The effect and objectives

On the long run, we want to create an online data-base of human stories. One human being at a time, one voice at a time. 

The Other Story films will play an essential role in continuously nurturing the humanitarian momentum Europe is experiencing, where ordinary people travel far to help others in need. Since the project started, Other Story has been receiving messages from volunteers all over Europe, thanking Other Story for showing them who they are helping. 

Other Story maintains contact with all the people who are interviewed. There will therefore be the possibility at a later stage, to travel to various parts of Europe and make follow-up interviews with some of the refugees.


Risks & Challenges

It is a big emotional and financial investment to do this kind of work. Therefor we need support from people, who also believe in the Other Story project and vision. 

Some refugees from Syria are afraid to let their stories go public, and we will always respect the boundaries of the people we meet. Every time a film is created, a contract is created, to protect the person involved. We will never jeopardise the safety of the people involved.


Thank you!

We hope that you are inspired to support the project!
Greetings from the Other Story team.

story:
Short Summary

This is Takara's Legacy: Angela's Hope

  The young woman Setsuko can't wait to be free. Free from tradition, free to follow her dreams, but most of all, freedom from her father. Her father's status affords her a life that many could only dream of,  but this life comes with certain expectations that force her down a path she does not want to go. Dreaming of something more, she chooses to do things her way. Little does she realize how her rash behaviour will forever change her life, and those around her.

  Jonathan and Angela meet one another for the first time during a class at the local university. Enamored by the young student, Jonathan, a teachers aid, falls in love and marries her. The two of them enjoy their first year together as husband and wife, but are caught un-prepared for the trials ahead. After losing his job, Jonathan seeks employment elsewhere. Angela is forced to give up on her dream of becoming a doctor because of finances and decides to follow her husband overseas so he can pursue his own career. This is an exciting time for Jonathan, but a struggle for Angela, as she tries to adjust to a new culture and a life, far from home.

  Journey with us and find how God is faithful through the anguished prayers of a barren women, the fervent prayers of a mother and the sweet birth of little Takara.

   I started this first book about two years back, inspired by a show I had watched with my brother in law. This show touched on a subject that struck a chord with me and was the catalyst for this series. Taking parts of my own life, I began to create an outline for these books that reflected many of my life's struggles, joys, and experiences.

  From my own struggles with faith, to the tragedy of losing our unborn child. These things both good and bad helped to shape me into the man I am today. There are even stories that stem from family members, such as my own parents and my beloved wife.  In one way or another, I have included many of these in my writing, making this series of books very important to me.

  Most importantly, I show how God changes the lives of these characters, just as he has changed mine. Through people like my wife, He was able to soften my heart and bring me back to him and give us the strength to endure the loss of our first child and our ever present fertility problems.

  Please join me, as we journey through the life of Takara and her family, through the pain of loss, to their victory through Christ.  


What We Need & What You Get

  • We need to raise at least $5000.00 USD to cover the publishing of my book. 
  • This helps to cover the cost of publishing through FriesenPress. Here is a break down on what this covers...

  • Publishing Features

    • 100% of Copyright & Creative Control
    • Editor's Manuscript Evaluation (Up to 90,000 words)
    • Professional Copy Editing (Up to 90,000 words)
    • Custom Layout (Inside, Front & Back Cover)
    • Express Design Services (Layout & Revisions)
    • Premium Cover Design
    • Paperback Edition
    • Hardcover Edition
    • Full Color or Black & White Interior
    • Full Color Book Cover
    • 2 Revision Rounds
    • Copyright
    • 3 ISBNs

    Book Distribution Features

    • Online & Wholesale Book Distribution
    • PDF eBook Distribution
    • Amazon Kindle Distribution
    • Nook Distribution - Barnes & Noble
    • Kobo Distribution - Chapters Indigo, Best Buy
    • Google/Android Books Distribution
    • Apple iBookstore Distribution
    • FriesenPress Online Bookstore
    • Online Royalty Reporting
    • Amazon.com Look Inside
    • Preferred Author Discount on Suggested Retail Price
    • Up to 70% Royalties for eBooks priced over $2.99
    • 40 Paperback Copies*
    • 15 Hardcover Copies*

    Book Promotion Features

    • Author Website
    • Amazon.com Look Inside
    • Google Books/Barnes & Noble See Inside
    • Print Media Promotion Training
    • Book Promotion Plan
    • Press Release
    • Back Cover Copy writing 
    • Social Media Starter 

  • This amount will also help cover the perks I am honored to give you.
  • The due date for publishing this book is late January early February of 2016. 

The Impact

Your donation will help me achieve my dreams of publishing my first book. I have been writing since high school and have always enjoyed telling a good story. I hope this book also impacts you, my reader, and engages you on many levels. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Share this campaign on Facebook, twitter, etc.
  • Follow me on Facebook, Twitter and check out my website

facebook.com/TakarasLegacy   @TakarasLegacy    www.braddwarholm.ca

story:
Meet the EuroBRICS Young Leaders

After the tremendous success of our first meeting last year in Helsinki, Finland, we — the Euro-BRICS’ Young Leaders — are proud to announce the second EuroBRICS Young Leader’s Summit in New Delhi, India, in March 2016! 

2016 will be the year of Sustainability. If today’s world leaders fail to implement the promises of the Sustainable Development Goals and Climate negotiations of late 2015, it will be our generation who pays the price for their shortcomings. Therefore we will come together in New Delhi to discuss the prospects of a sustainable way to live in the newly arising multipolar world, which the EuroBRICS initiative incorporates. 

We are not just another Youth Conference. Our aim is to bring together the brightest and most promising young leaders from four continents and stay independent, so we can discuss what matters to us, instead of copying the agenda of donors, as it happens all too often. But it doesn't stop here. We firmly believe that ones ability to shape the future should be determined by knowledge and passion, not by the size of one’s wallet. Therefore we want to enable every young change maker to come together and discuss our issues, no matter his or her financial background. This is the only right thing to do, but it also an expensive prospect.

With your support we will be able to cover the airfares of at least 50% of our delegates to come all the way from Europe and the BRICS to New Delhi. We want to build on the momentum created by our first summit and hold a gathering unlike any other, where we can deepen our transnational friendships and work on the intercultural understanding that is so important for our future. 

Let's make this happen together, let's occupy the future! :)


What We Need & What You Get

To be able to cover the airfares of half of our delegates and convene to what is most likely the only inclusive youth event there is on this scale, we need to raise another 15.450€ in addition to what we already have. 

We got our venue, the food and local transport already sorted for our entire delegation. On top, we even already have contributions summing up to more than 10.000€. The 15.450€ we want to raise with this campaign are going to be used for the biggest cost factor: the airfares to bring people from more than 20 countries and 4 continents all the way down to India's capital New Delhi. Our ambitious aim is to cover at least 50% of our delegations, so nobody gets excluded. 

But every little helps! The more money we raise the more delegates we can fly in at not costs for our delegates, who might - as most students and young professionals - be short on cash. In our opinion that is an exclusion criteria on already to many youth events. You can help us to overcome this and enable us to shape the future we want, you can literally fund the change you want to see in the world! Once we reached our goal, the next aim is 30.000€, which would mean we can allow every single one of our 100  delegates to attend our summit for free. 

You can even be part of this change!

For supporting our ambitious endeavour, we prepared a lot of interesting perks for you. You will get a live newsfeed from the delegate of your choice and you can even adopt individual leaders or entire delegations, so you don't only know exactly what your money is used for, but get first hand informations in your language from your delegate or delegation. Have look at our perks, there is more! A handful of our generous supporters even get the unique chance to witness future in the making! You have the chance to actually meet us and the high-profile guest we invited in person next year in Delhi!

If we wouldn't manage to raise the entire amount we need, your money is not wasted. We already got enough money to make this summit happen and cover a very limited number of airfares. With every Euro you spend, however, we will be able to cover more airfares, every Euro you spend makes our summit fairer, more inclusive, and hence more like the future we are working on.


Our Impact

The EuroBRICS Young Leaders' Summit is unique. Nowhere else outside the United Nations do young people from such a vast array of socio-cultural and economic backgrounds have the chance to talk to each other with the same level of trust and mutual understanding. We have huge plans, even beyond our summit.

By inviting high-level politicians, diplomats and entrepreneurs, we want to offer the highest decision making circles the opportunity to build on the momentum we created and engage in talks themselves.

We want to built a more understanding, multipolar future and we know it is possible. Why? Because we already did it. Last June, we had an amazing First EuroBRICS Young Leader's Summit in the Finnish capital Helsinki. One hundred young leaders from all over Europe and each of the BRICS countries came together in Helsinki and went to nearby St. Petersburg in Russia for a post event. Not only did we discuss a broad range of topics, we laid the foundations of a global network of inspiring and aspiring young change makers. It is this network that we want to strengthen. Last year was to get us started, this year will be even more ambitious. We will discuss a central issue for our generation: Sustainability in a Multipolar World, and we won't be satisfied with simply discussing it.

We want policy makers in all of regions to address the concerns of us young citizens. After all, it is our future that is at stake here. So, this year we will collaborate on policy papers calling for the attention of this generation of leaders and telling them exactly, what we expect them to do to save our future.

We need you to make this vision a reality.


Risks & Challenges

Coming together on a global scale is never easy. We come from a vast set of the most diverse backgrounds on four different continents and we celebrate our differences. As in every relationship there are clashes and misunderstandings ranging from very funny to really not funny. But our strength is to be young, accepting and open-minded people. We do not let take differences take us down, because this is what we came together for in the first place: to foster mutual understanding and acceptance. And it works, across, despite and indeed because of our differences we created a network of global reach and with your help we will even deepen our connection. This is what the future needs. You can help us to clash more often and even in person, so we can become a stronger network with every settled conflict.


Join our network

Are you young and passionate about shaping your and our all future on a global scale? Then come and join our ever growing network. Let us know and we set you into contact with our national representatives, so you can become involved, use and deepen your skills.

You wouldn't consider yourself as too young anymore? No worries, even all grown-up you can help us to make a difference. Please share our campaign with every single person you know. 

Get in touch with us in case of any questions, to get involved or if you just wanna have a chat :) We are truly looking forward to meeting you!


Let's #OccupytheFuture !


PS: Check out what we did last year on our summit in Helsinki:

http://www.leap2020.net/succes-et-resultats-concrets-du-sommet-des-jeunes-leaders-euro-brics-helsinki-8-9-juin-2015/?lang=en


:)

Nowhere else outside the United Nations do young people from such a vast array of socio-cultural and economic backgrounds have the chance to talk to each other with the same level of trust and mutual understanding. We have huge plans, even beyond our summit.
By inviting high-level politicians, diplomats and entrepreneurs, we want to offer the highest decision making circles the opportunity to build on the momentum we created and engage in talks themselves.
We want to built a more understanding, multipolar future and we know it is possible. Why? Because we already did it. Last June, we had an amazing First EuroBRICS Young Leader's Summit in the Finnish capital Helsinki. One hundred young leaders from all over Europe and each of the BRICS countries came together in Helsinki and went to nearby St. Petersburg in Russia for a post event. Not only did we discuss a broad range of topics, we laid the foundations of a global network of inspiring and aspiring young change makers. It is this network that we want to strengthen. Last year was to get us started, this year will be even more ambitious. We will discuss a central issue for our generation: Sustainability in a Multipolar World, and we won't be satisfied with simply discussing it.
We want policy makers in all of regions to address the concerns of us young citizens. After all, it is our future that is at stake here. So, this year we will collaborate on policy papers calling for the attention of this generation of leaders and telling them exactly, what we expect them to do to save our future.
We need you to make this vision a reality.

    Risks & Challenges Coming together on a global scale is never easy. We come from a vast set of the most diverse backgrounds on four different continents and we celebrate our differences. As in every relationship there are clashes and misunderstandings ranging from very funny to really not funny. But our strength is to be young, accepting and open-minded people. We do not let take differences take us down, because this is what we came together for in the first place: to foster mutual understanding and acceptance. And it works, across, despite and indeed because of our differences we created a network of global reach and with your help we will even deepen our connection. This is what the future needs. You can help us to clash more often and even in person, so we can become a stronger network with every settled conflict.

    Join our network
Are you young and passionate about shaping your and our all future on a global scale? Then come and join our ever growing network. Let us know and we set you into contact with our national representatives, so you can become involved, use and deepen your skills. You wouldn't consider yourself as too young anymore? No worries, even all grown-up you can help us to make a difference. Please share our campaign with every single person you know. 
Get in touch with us in case of any questions, to get involved or if you just wanna have a chat :) We are truly looking forward to meeting you!

Let's #OccupytheFuture !

PS: Check out what we did last year on our summit in Helsinki:
http://www.leap2020.net/succes-et-resultats-concrets-du-sommet-des-jeunes-leaders-euro-brics-helsinki-8-9-juin-2015/?lang=en

story:
We are funded! The minimum we needed, 5,000 euros, has been funded with additions outside this campaign! Now its a question of how many books we get to Paris!

Note: For Finnish-speakers, you can also get the book in Finnish:
Suomea paremmin lukevat voivat pyytää kirjan suomenkielisen version (paperiversioita rajattu määrä, sähköisiä rajaton). Lähetä osallistuttuasi sähköpostia: climategamble@gmail.com ja kerro toiveesi.

What is this Climate Gamble about?

We are two independent authors and researchers on energy and climate change from Finland. We have been following and participating in the debate on mitigating climate change for years. What we have found out has been alarming. The utter failure of humankind to respond to the growing emergency of decarbonizing our energy systems has been striking. And it does not end there. Many people still seem to think that we should not use all of the tools available to mitigate climate change. This simply does not make any sense.

So we wrote a book about it. It’s called “Climate Gamble – Is Anti-Nuclear Activism Endangering Our Future?”

In the book, we go through the climate realities and present all the main arguments against and for nuclear, in a hundred pages or so. We do it in an easy to read manner, applying logic, latest research and evidence based data. The book has already been published in Finnish (March 2015), and it also became available in English, from Amazon worldwide (August 2015).

Then we had a great idea. At least we think it’s great. Why not have a non-profit campaign to supply as many books as possible to the climate negotiations held in Paris this December? The sad thing is, many of the negotiators get their information on climate change mitigation and nuclear power mainly from the prevailing environmental organizations. Many of the negotiators even have a background there. This information is – as we found out when we did background research for our book – horribly biased, based largely on fallacious argumentation and cherry-picked, even falsified, evidence. It’s no wonder that the negotiations have all but ignored what is – based on real world evidence – one of our most effective ways to decarbonize energy production: nuclear power.

We will try to get hundreds, and with your active help and contribution, thousands of books printed and delivered to Paris. We will go there and distribute them to the thousands of negotiators and tens of thousands of other participants. Some of them will read it, others will have a glance at it, and some may just check out the key takeaways of each chapter which we will be inserting to this edition. The book will give them an evidence-based view on how we can overcome what is probably our biggest challenge so far. We are in it – for our own part – to save the world. And we need your help.

Help us to help the climate!

Our goal is to give at least 500 and preferably 10,000 books to the delegates and negotiators at the COP21 climate summit. For this we need to raise 5,000 to 50,000 euros. Most of that will go to printing the books. Smaller portion will go to expenses in getting us to Paris to distribute the books (the amount of people going is dependent on the amount we raise). We will also plan to use 5 – 10 percent of the budget to market the campaign, both to raise more money as to raise more interest to the climate negotiations in Paris in general and nuclear energy as an evidence-based mitigation tool in particular.

We do have families to feed, and planning and running the campaign – let alone writing and self-publishing the book – has not been without expenses and lost income. If the campaign goes well, us, the authors, earn for our troubles a commission that is at most 50 cents per book per author (1 euro in total). This is the maximum, and we will be the last ones to get paid.

With this included, and depending on the final level of funding we get, the total price, including taxes and such, per book delivered to Paris is estimated to be between 5 and 10 euros. The more funding we get, the lower the price will be per book: fixed costs will be about the same, irrespective of the size of the print run.

We are based in Finland, and the law on accepting donations here is a bit tricky. In practice, we have to sell something in order to accept money. That’s why we are offering you, our dear prospective funder, something concrete for your money. You can get anything from a pdf version of the book, to a paperback signed by the authors to having your name on our website or even the book itself as a key supporter. If you have or work in an organization (or if you have a bit more money) you can also get a full box of the books to do as you like with. It’s a great Christmas present for family, friends and the businesses that your organization works with! Imagine: “This present is a part of a campaign that is trying to save the world.”

As the top-level perk, you get one (or even both) of us to give a presentation on the subject in a forum and location of your choosing. Of course there will be traveling expenses added, but otherwise than that, this will be something we are prepared to do on our own time to support the campaign, without pay. Both of us are experienced and entertaining presenters who are not afraid to say things like they are.

If Paypal is not a good way for you or your organization to pay, please contact us directly at climategamble@gmail.com. Other ways to fund the campaign are also possible, and we will try to get funding everywhere we can. It will all be added up when the campaign ends.

We have divided the goals between 5,000 and 50,000 euros, and 500 and 10,000 books, respectively (these are rough estimates). We are confident that we will reach the lowest level, and anything above that, whether it meets the next level or not, will be used for getting more books to Paris and raising awareness on the message. If we don’t get to the lowest level, we will try to find ways to get at least some books to Paris with the money we have raised.

What we plan to achieve

We already have some great people on board and supporting the campaign in their own various ways. These include:

-  Energy for Humanity, an environmental NGO

-  Ecomodernist Society of Finland, an environmental NGO

-  Tom Blees, the author of the excellent book Prescription for the Planet (link to free pdf) and the President of the Science Council for Global Initiatives.

If you'd like to support us and see your organization or name listed here, please contact us at climategamble@gmail.com.

With help from you andother supporters, we believe that we can spread information on this campaign and the message of the book far and wide. Like our good friend, now the executive director of the Finnish chapter of World Energy Council, said: “I think that amongst all the different campaigns and initiatives going to Paris this December, this is one of those that might actually have some impact”.

The facts are clear: without nuclear power we simply do not have a fighting chance at stopping climate change in time. This is the message coming from basically every major institution, including IPCC, IEA and others. Stopping climate change will be extremely hard even with nuclear power. Yet there are people who openly oppose nuclear power and campaign that its use as a decarbonization tool should not be allowed. They are even campaigning in Paris. To support their cases, they have flashy and catchy slogans, and use rhetorical tricks that would make any climate denial veteran proud. Some of the arguments seem legit, and some are even true, at least from a very narrow point of view in a world where no comparisons or cost/benefit analysis need to be made.

The thing is, there is nothing new. Every argument used has been discussed in Climate Gamble and in various other works. Yet they pop up again and again, going in endless circles not unlike the "discussion" about climate change and humanity's role in it does, just to "keep the debate alive" and the public unsure about the science and evidence. 

There is no rational base to claim that mitigating climate change – which is, and should be, the ultimate goal – will be easier, faster and cheaper if we limit our tools and options arbitrarily. Logic and numerous scientific studies support the inclusion of nuclear power. Many of those studies are referred in our book. We, as environmentalists, have accepted the scientific consensus on climate change. Now we have to accept the scientific consensus that nuclear needs to be a part of the solution.

We have run some similar, if an order of magnitude smaller, campaigns. We crowdfunded 300 free books (the Finnish version of Climate Gamble) to be distributed in a big Energy Debate last spring, which was held as a part of our parliamentary elections. The debate was organized by the big environmental organizations in Finland. Incidentally, they were not that happy to see us there. They did not permit us to distribute the books inside the event, and even moved us and the books farther from the entrance to the building. 

When the 200 members of the parliament were elected, we crowdfunded another campaign that got a copy of our book delivered to each of them. In June, we managed to get funding to get 250 copies of our book, along with us authors, to Paris as part of ENYGF 2015 (European Nuclear Young Generation Forum). There, we distributed the books to the participants and gave a presentation, telling the participants of this upcoming campaign we have now launched. We have also managed to get funding for smaller patches of the book to be delivered to various audiences from young political activists to employees and managers in the energy industries.

And now, we aim for COP21 in Paris.

This campaign will come to an end near the end of November. That gives us a good month to print the necessary amount of books and send them to Paris.

What are the biggest risks & challenges?

Obviously, if the campaign falls flat then it falls flat. As a result, ignorance about the importance of nuclear power might become even more widespread, as anti-nuclear activists with their signs and chants will definitely be in Paris. We are not saying that this project will save the world. It is just a small piece in a big puzzle. However, we are confident that we can have at least some impact. And we need to try. If enough people and enough good pieces get put together, things start changing.

How we will get and store the books in Paris, to be distributed? We know some people there, and we will map out their willingness to take the boxes as they arrive. Some have already agreed. We will also go there ourselves, with hopefully a few assistants in tow, to distribute them. We also know people from other like-minded campaigns and organizations, one being Nuclear for Climate and another being Energy for Humanity, that we will likely co-operate with.

Getting excited? Here are some other ways to help

If you don’t have the means to participate directly, but want to help us – or if you want to help us in addition to getting one of the perks available – here are some things you can do. These are important stuff.

1.  Spread the word

Obviously, our campaign can succeed only if people know about it. Every tweet with a quote and a link, Facebook posting or recommendation at the coffee table helps. Any one of them could be the step that helps this campaign to break through to a wider audience still. Indiegogo has some wonderful sharing tools as well. Use them.

2.  Write a review of the book / campaign

Do you have a blog? Do you have an Amazon account? Have you written something to a local paper? Are you an actual journalist with thousands, or millions, of readers? We would certainly appreciate any reviews, be they for a personal blog, Amazon’s page of our book, or a paper. If you want to have a free review-copy, let us know at climategamble@gmail.com and we will send you one to your email.

3.  Become a supporter

If you are a local or a global person of interest (a journalist, a climate/energy researcher, a celebrity, a famous activist or a mover/shaker in the energy or climate mitigation business), we would love to add your name to the list of people who are supporting this campaign.

4.  Give us good ideas

If you get a great idea that we could do, please, please let us know. We spend most of our time “inside the Box”, and we realise that. Any ideas that come “outside the Box” are greatly appreciated. Let us know at climategamble@gmail.com.

5.  Help us realise those ideas

Even better than giving us an idea, which we may or may not have the time to put in to action, is to offer to help us see it done. Become a part of the team and earn a big, heartfelt thank you.

And now you have earned a big thank you for reading all the way down here: Thanks for reading, now let’s get to action!

story:
What it's about

Casting Around the Eastern Sierra is a year-round, four-season guide to fishing the world-class trout waters of Mono County, including tips, maps and a handy “How To” section for learning to fly fishing, angling with kids, and all the basic information needed to go fishing with bait, lures or flies. 

Starring

The stars of the book are the fisheries and the people who know and love them the best—local tackle shop and lodge owners, managers, guides and long-time locals. They share what makes these places, their fisheries, so special and why they should be treated with respect and reverence, and revisited for generations.

Why?

Mono County has long been in need of a more comprehensive fishing guidebook that highlights the people and the amazing and unique opportunities it affords anglers of all ages and abilities. A publication that can also work as marketing tool. Casting Around the Eastern Sierra offers numerous benefits to Mono County’s tourist based economy.

  • It will directly promote local businesses through high quality stories and photographs.
  • The book will be promoted within the region and state as well as throughout the country.
  • Direct sales of the book by local retailers will increase revenue and sales tax.
  • It will promote responsible use of the fisheries.
  • A portion of the sales from each book will be donated back to support the Eastern Sierra-based non-profit, Kids Fishing Festival.

You Can Help

We are raising $23,000 to cover the costs of printing the first edition of Casting Around the Eastern Sierra. That amount pays for printing, design and fees ... and not much else. 

This is not the first successful fishing guidebook that I have authored.  I know what it takes to create, market and sell a good print product. For more information, or to purchase my first book, Angling Around Sun Valley, which was named "Best Book of the Year" in the Northwest by the international outdoor media association, NOWA, click here.

Perks!

There are many wonderful people and shops supporting this campaign, for which I am very grateful.  As a result, we have lots of wonderful perks available to you as a extension of our gratitude for your support.
Starting the week of July 27th, 2015, we will be posting new perks every week! Keep checking back to see new packages, including guided fishing trips, original artwork from the book, lodging, dining, and more.

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand if you aren't able to contribute right now.  Please consider:

  • Telling your friends about our campaign
  • Sharing the campaign on Facebook, Twitter, etc!

On behalf of the entire team that is making this happen, this dream that is becoming a reality, we are extremely grateful for all support.  Thank you!

A portion of the sales from each book will be donated back to support the Eastern Sierra-based non-profit, Kids Fishing Festival.

   You Can Help We are raising $23,000 to cover the costs of printing the first edition of Casting Around the Eastern Sierra. That amount pays for printing, design and fees ... and not much else. 
This is not the first successful fishing guidebook that I have authored.  I know what it takes to create, market and sell a good print product. For more information, or to purchase my first book, Angling Around Sun Valley, which was named "Best Book of the Year" in the Northwest by the international outdoor media association, NOWA, click here.
    Perks!
There are many wonderful people and shops supporting this campaign, for which I am very grateful.  As a result, we have lots of wonderful perks available to you as a extension of our gratitude for your support.
Starting the week of July 27th, 2015, we will be posting new perks every week! Keep checking back to see new packages, including guided fishing trips, original artwork from the book, lodging, dining, and more.

Other Ways You Can Help
 I understand if you aren't able to contribute right now.  Please consider:  Telling your friends about our campaign Sharing the campaign on Facebook, Twitter, etc!   On behalf of the entire team that is making this happen, this dream that is becoming a reality, we are extremely grateful for all support.  Thank you!

story:
It has taken tons of time, talent and group support of family and friends to launch Bezert as far as we have, but he still has more stories to tell and many more hearts to reach. 

THE STORY 

My name is Maria Knier and I have written, illustrated and published a clothbound illustrated gift storybook entitled 'The Bezert'. The quirky and lovable character in this book takes quite a journey & meets some odd friends learning subtle, yet valuable, lessons along the way. The story is a timeless tale and in its printed book form, has recently been enjoyed by hundreds of readers and creative thinkers from ages 3-93. We now need your help to give Bezert a real VOICE so he can also tell his tale via digital audio book download to reach thousands more hearts and ears throughout the world. Over the past year we have had a blast sharing this book by traveling to bookstores, doing dramatic reading events, even winning TWO indie book awards and we truly want to continue to keep the energy alive & well in order to release the audio book and a SEQUEL to The Bezert within this coming year


HOW YOU CAN HELP...HOW YOU CAN BENEFIT

We will share some fun personalized perks in return for helping us reach our goal. These include: signed books (they make great gifts!), sneak peek audio downloads of the book, posters with illustrations from the printed version of the book, and customized hand painted illustrations. 

If we do not reach our entire goal all funds will go toward current production costs of the audio book. If extraordinary things happen, and we go above and beyond our goal, the extra funds will go directly toward the publishing of the second Bezert book in this series. It is already written and quietly waiting to meet the world while we seek out our next publisher.


THE STORY BEHIND BEZERT 

'The Bezert' holds a heartfelt message that touches young and old alike. I believe it has the power to creatively challenge children (and adults) both mentally & emotionally. It had been in the works for over 15 years and was officially published in November of 2014. Although written and illustrated since 1999, the story was just waiting for the right publisher and community opportunities to bring it to life. I was thrilled to sign and work with a creative hybrid publisher in Milwaukee but unfortunately they needed to permanently close their doors only 4 months after the release and initial launch of the book. This changed our financial course quite a bit with the need to take on the expenses of distribution, marketing and buying out the remainder of the books. We persisted, and with a great deal of love and determination we have continued to organically bring Bezert into more and more homes, libraries and bookstores across the country through travel, events and genuine support from our community & friends. Many of the pictures and video clips in this campaign were taken at an interactive event created with a spectacular arts collaborative in Santa Barbara, CA. We had brilliant musicians, story tellers, actors, aerialists and narration choreographed throughout this event. We'd love to do more interactive events just like this one in order to share Bezert's story even more.

 I've learned so much through the process of creating and marketing this story and then sharing it with the world. We've connected with more wonderful people than I could have ever imagined and this has certainly made the world a much smaller place. I would love to pass this inspiration onto others who may have  the same goals and aspirations. 


Please help us to make Bezert's story more accessible to many, many more people  through this digital audio book version. We have an amazing narrator, music and many tools in place to finalize a spectacular interpretation of this timeless tale. 

If you are not able to donate to this campaign, we thoroughly appreciate your 'tweets', 'likes', 'shares' and general 'word-of-mouth' support! Warmest thanks for helping us spread the word!

story:
Roots & Branches Series

Over the thirty years since its founding, Spuyten Duyvil Press has gained appreciation and recognition as a place to encounter vital and lively new and established poetry and prose. SD helps integrate distinct, compelling voices into vibrant discussions of culture and literature at home and abroad. In order for these indispensible voices to continue their essential reach, we need your help!

We are seeking seed contributions to establish the Roots & Branches Series.

Roots and Branches will reflect the skyey reach SD's writers seek, affirm, and transform as they create and compose the next avant and post avant garde. Alongside brand new titles, out of print as well as public domain works will be planted into a scintillating new contemporary title-base.

In addition to creating this exciting new series, your contribution will also help Spuyten Duyvil broaden its distribution channels and increase its already considerable output of titles. Help us spread our seed wide and far!

We currently have 300 active titles, and 350 titles published during the lifetime of the press. We average 20 new titles a year, but last year we ramped up to 40 titles, and this year, we are shooting for 80. This is an astonishing record for a small (mostly one man!) press. But we want to go further!

Monies raised will assist in hiring part-time employees to manage, design, and produce hard copy as well as e-book titles. Marketing and outreach will be part of the crucial contribution you make, as we achieve this goal, and shoot beyond!

As we create new titles, we will also need to keep up with tech times, and focus energy on the inter-activation of older, out-of-print titles in both e-book and hardcopy format. It's a lot of work, research, and outreach ahead for us, but we are extremely determined to make Roots & Branches one of the most victorious poetry/experimental fiction ventures of recent years.

Times are tough for small presses, and community effort is needed in order to keep the ground wet enough for us to grow! Without the 20,000 dollars we seek in the next 60 days, SD will face severe drought conditions that stand in the way of immediate access to potential readers, reviewers and platforms.

 

Don't Let Our Size Fool You!

The small size and wide scope of Spuyten Duyvil offers an unparalleled, dynamic concentration of individual talent and creativity. Experimental and on-the-fringe voices (who would not otherwise have an opportunity to be published by a larger entity) find a nourishing, flourishing home in SD. Literary culture needs these voices in order for the bold next chapter to be written.


Come, Etch Your Name In Our Tree! 

Your contribution gains you immortality--

Every contributor will be mentioned within the Roots & Branches Masthead of each title produced in the series! When you donate $100, you will also receive your choice of 10 SD titles from the entire title base. If you donate $250, in addition to your choice of 10 SD titles, you will receive a copy of every title produced in the first year of the series. Those donors who go above and beyond with $500 or more in extraordinary contributions will receive all titles in the Roots and Branches Series, 10 SD titles of their choice, as well as the opportunity to select from available unique works of art by your hosts, j/j hastain and/or t thilleman (conchwoman.com and jjhastain.com), as well as a print from SD Limited Edition artist Scott Neary (scottneary at localartists) and Nancy Goldring (nancygoldring.com).


(Go on now, we know you want to pop that cherry on top of our tree!)



But times are  tough for creative folk--

We understand that not everyone is brimming over with extra funds. We encourage you to donate anything you can toward our goal. Every green bud is a blessing. Instead of dinner out this week, why not offer your contribution to a unique literary community that will further dynamic discussions? Why not skip Starbucks this week, and splurge instead for a future of literature to be possible?

Spread the word--

Please tell your friends and universities about our goal!

We are happy to accept contributions in honor of loved ones, or beloved institutions!

We prophecy our contribution list will read like a blending of a living trust whose roots and branches truly reach into and out of the most dynamic voices in arts and literature. Come add your name to our fecund family tree!
